Reviews.Title: “Great location in sultanmet the ancient part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: W0rldcitizenkiwi
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to walk around the old city see all the sights you must see in Istanbul , hotel service leads a bit to be desired , over all reasonable price great location terrible food average bar great bar top location for night drinks etc traffic can be a curse but it's close too the tram etc

Reviews.Title: “excelent”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLady T
Reviews.Content: I recomend Erboy hotel anytime! good location, helpfull staff, excelent food, clean rooms.. If I come back to Istanbul, I come back to Erboy hotel

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with wonderful hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: paulette s
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived we received a very warm greeting from the hotel staff who spoke excellent English. Everything was more than we had expected. The rooms were spacious, The breakfast had a terrific buffet which was very fresh. Service and location could not have been better. I highly recommend this hotel. Paulette NEW YORK CITY

Reviews.Title: “ERBOY: Fantastic, clean, great location for old city, sites and bazar. FAB”
Reviews.Author: linda s
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Erboy, some 25 years ago, I decided its location was perfect for a family cultural holiday. Children 18, 17, 13. Time of year, Easter - perfect not too hot, no tourists. The hotel met us at the airport, provided a complementary supper (very good) and got us settled in. Provided lots of tourist tips, printed tickets for the Hagai Sophia so we avoided queues - they couldn't have been more helpful. Wi fi in rooms.Rooms clean, fresh, and the team are truly hospitable. The breakfasts are fantastic with honey combs on racks, fresh cheeses, fruits, meats and fresh baked muffins. (The post holiday diet soon followed!) It is a well priced mid range , great value hotel. The concierge also arranged our return transfer, provided ferry times to the Princes Islands and the Bosphorus. Do tip the room maid and the concierge - they really deserve it - the whole family felt most welcome. Top tips - don't fall for shoe shine tricks ...avoid carpet shops ...we staggered the week by alternating city trips with ferry trips. Musts: Roman underwater cisterns, blue mosque, hagia sophia, turkish bath & massage, and grand bazaar. Try more local restaurants off the beaten track - the food is great and fresh bread will be cooked, kebabs are great... baklava too. No litter, very clean city!

Reviews.Title: “Fam. Jansson”
Reviews.Author: FamJansson Posted by an Apollo traveler
Reviews.Content: We loved Istanbul and Erboy Hotel. Thank you very much for everything. The staff is fantastic and we hade a lovely time i Istanbul. I hope se them again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel service”
Reviews.Author: Arisantoso
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week. The free airport pickup was really helpful. We arrived early and they were kind to give us free breakfast. Also had a free nice dinner voucher. Location is fantastic just a few steps away from the tram and also close to Sultanahmet area. Room was good & clean as I chosed the 4 bed room. Restaurant had good quality food and they provide discounts to a few others restaurant which the hotel group owned in Sirkeci area. Hotel also provided airport transfer with reasonable rates. Overall it was a great experience and I'd definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: rs0103
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Erboy for 7 nights. Chose the free pick up from the airport which was great as our flight landed late and then usual passport/visa chaos. We had booked a double room but were given a triple as we had young children with us. Breakfast has a good selection. Location is great - 5 minutes from Gulihane tram station and park and about 10 minutes from the mosques. Port is also only 5-10 minutes. We had free 3 course dinner for one night as booked directly through their website - it was great and very tasty (the restaurant was packed each night). Staff were freat and helpful. Totally recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “central location to visit main attractions”
Reviews.Author: dunya101
Reviews.Content: The location of Erboy hotel for visiting Topkapi, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar etc. is perfect, and most attractions are within walking distance. Hotel is clean, staff very helpful and rooms spacious. However, there are some downsides. Beware of the transport from the airport that the hotel offers if you stay for 3 nights or more, as we waited for the driver for a long while since we we delayed at the passport control, but the hotel concierge would not tell us that the driver already left to pick someone else up from another airport. Of course, they compensated this with a dinner in their restaurant, which was delicious and I highly recommend dining there. Also, beware of rooms on the second floor with only one window opening to skyhole just above kitchen, so no possibility to get fresh air in. But they did their best when we complained. Breakfast was fantastic. All in all, we'd choose it again. We just had bad luck with transport and electricity not working in the first appointed room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Njcasta51
Reviews.Content: The Erboy is a great place to stay in Istanbul. It is located within walking distance of all the major historic sights. The hotel is clean and serves a huge delicious breakfast buffet. But the best part is the service. The hotel staff - especially Can (John) just cannot do enough for you. Hospitality = A+.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LadyTara
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us, the room was clean and comfortable, the staff were very helpful and friendly, the services were excellent and the breakfast was fantastic! A lovely selection of local food: breads, the best yogurt ever, local cheeses, honey, eggs and a selection of things other people would probably like (sausages, ham etc)! We booked this without knowing Istanbul but the location and neighbourhood was perfect, a pleasant 5 minute walk to the Topkapi Palace, Sultanahmet Square, Ayasofya, the Blue Mosque and all the central museums. The street, though interesting and buzzy was quiet at night even though our room was at the front. The Paserzade Restaurant is on the ground floor and is fabulous, without being any more expensive than other more touristy restaurants in the area. I thoroughly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again. Out of the 2 of us, 1 had wonderful sleeps and the other found the bed a bit hard, but not really a complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Olga A
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel Erboy 29mar-03apr12 and the whole stay was a very pleasant experience. We liked the hotel itself, the great location (close to all major sites in Old city), the rooms (renovated, with flat TV and spotlessly clean), the friendly service and the restaurant with delicious cuisine very very much! Everything is arranged for comfortable and pleasant stay so the guests can really feel at home! Nice addition to a fairly good price was a free airport transfer and a free dinner on our arrival day at the wonderful restaurant Pasazade - delicious food and great service! The kettle and small bottle of water in the room helped us to warm up after a chilly rainy day. Would like to thank all the friendly and helpful staff of the hotel and special thanks to Ayse Sancak, Guest Relations Manager! She kindly answered some of my questions I've got while planning the trip, helped with any queeries in the hotel during our stay and it was a nice surprise to get a Thank-you letter upon my arrival back home! If I visit Istanbul again (and it is definitely worth it) I would stay at Erboy!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: LiliRueda
Reviews.Content: 2 blocks from Metro and a clean place to sleep, rooms arent big , i guess as most room hotels in that area of istanbul. we got free airport ride for 5 nights of stay. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: USAIndytravels
Reviews.Content: I want to express my thanks to the kind people at the Erboy Hotel. I chose this hotel based on price and location (and previous reviews). They did an excellent job in making my trip a very pleasant one. From arrival and check-in to a very early morning check-out, everything was handled smoothly and professionally. We booked directly through the hotel website (which I always think is best for any hotel) and we were able to take advantage of the special offering free transport to the hotel from airport and the free meal in the hotel restaurant which was excellent (see my review of the Pasazade restaurant). Check-in was smooth and the room was very comfortable. I emailed ahead and specifically asked for a room in the newer wing with a balcony. Our room was spot on, nice size - with a nice balcony with a small table and two chairs which over-looked a small but atmospheric street behind the hotel. The window/door was sealed tight and shut out noise. It was very quiet in the room. We could hear some sounds in the hall and room next door - but nothing different than any other hotel. The room (and hotel as a whole) was spotlessly clean. No faults here. The housekeeping service was fine. The bathroom was a nice size and had a shower only with great pressure and hot water. No problems here. The room safe was in the small closet. It would not open for us on the second day - we called the desk - and it was very promptly fixed. The staff at the front desk later asked if it was still working ok - follow-up - that is a great thing. The breakfast each morning was very good and offered a large selection of food, from fresh vegetables (the tomatoes and cucumbers were especially good), breads, cereals, and egg/meats, juice, coffee and of coarse, tea. A nice touch was the daily newsletter provided at each table with tidbits of information about the city and the current weather and upcoming events - it even had a little Turkish language lesson each morning. The location of the hotel was one of the best points. Close to the tram (Gulhane) stop, walking distance to many of the major sites. A couple of small grocery-type stores where very close (we made friends at one little store across the street and to the left), lots of restaurants nearby and tourist-type shopping too. The value (excellent price), service (outstanding), location (perfect), cleanliness (spotless) make it easy for me to say I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Alex R
Reviews.Content: The Erboy hotel is a *** star hotel in Istanbul. It is really value for money. Clean. Friendly staff and centrally located. I would recommend it for anyone looking for a budget conscious holiday.

Reviews.Title: “I felt spoiled in this hotel and its sister hotel”
Reviews.Author: MidwesternParent
Reviews.Content: I am going to post this review on the Erboy Hotel site and the Orient Express site since they are sister establishments, had a lot in common, and we stayed at both. I enjoyed both of these hotels and wouldn't hesitate to recommend either of them. To me, their prices seemed very fair for a large urban city. I had reserved a couple of nights at the Erboy just to start our journey, and then when I went back to add more nights, the Erboy was booked so I added some nights at the Orient Express. First, the desk staff has had excellent training and is just terrific. Upon arrival at both hotels, the front desk staff provides you with a map and helps you determine where to go if you are sightseeing. The desk staff is consistently friendly and helpful at both hotels and willingly answers questions. Second, at the Erboy, you are given apple tea upon arrival--it's great. At the Orient, there was Turkish Delight left in the room. Third, the rooms at both hotels were sufficiently clean and nice. I reserved a triple (3 twins) for two people online at Expedia at the Erboy just to have extra space, and when we first arrived, we were upgraded to a quad (one double, two twins). The room had no real view but was very quiet and comfortable with a flat screen TV with remote. I had reserved a twin at the Orient Express and it was a smaller room which I expected. The beds were pushed together but there was room to move around, and I hadn't asked for a larger room. The TV was older but still had a remote. I preferred the larger bathroom at the Erboy but I suspect the Orient Express has rooms with larger bathrooms as well so I am comparing apples to oranges here. We had hot water at both hotels. Fourth, the location of both hotels is terrific. The Erboy is up a hill about 2 blocks from the Orient Express. You walk down a manageable incline street (with restaurants and shops along the side) to reach the Orient Express which is on the tram line with the access to the tram a short distance away. The Orient Express was on a busier street but I had requested a quiet room and got one. Both hotels are within easy walking distance of the Topkapi Palace, the Haigia Sophia, and the Blue Mosque. There is also shopping within walking distance. The tram line only costs 2 TL and is very easy to use. (Get some 1 TL pieces and put them in the automated machine for a token at the access point.) Both hotels are also within easy walking distance of the Sirkeci train station. We caught a suburban train which also cost only 2 TL one way (uses a different token but uses same method to get a token). There was a convenience mart across the street from the Orient Express to buy a soda or bottled water. There was probably one nearby the Erboy as well. One night I couldn't find a small bill to pay for the water and the propietor of the shop across from the Orient Express was going to let me take it on credt--wow! I did finally find a small bill to pay. Fifth, both hotels had wireless which worked and had two computers for guests to use near the lobby with internet access and a printer. Sixth, the breakfast at both hotels was very similar--lots of fine bread, cheeses, cucumbers, olives, at least a couple of hotter items, tea, etc. I have no complaints about the breakfasts and enjoyed them. Seventh, the Orient Express had a nice looking pool that we didn't use. I would recommend either hotel wholeheartedly. They are at least as good as any Holiday Inn Express I have stayed in and actually have better breakfasts, more services, and more outstanding staff than I usually encounter at hotels. Each hotel also had a restaurant although we didn't have time to use them.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Thanks to all the staff”
Reviews.Author: Octavia S
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience, very good value for the money we paid. We booked the 3 star hotel on-line, but at arrival we were upgraded to their 4 star hotel, for the same money. What impressed me most was the friendliness of the staff there, the delicious breakfast and the souvenirs we received from them at departure. I sencirely reccommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nan B
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week in Istanbul to visit my daughter who is studying there. We stayed at the Erboy which is literally two short blocks from the Tram, which will take you anywhere on the line for 2TL. We were able to walk to many of the major sights on days that we weren't willing to ride the Tram (they can be very crowded). The area is full of great restaurants offering everything from traditional Ottoman, Turkish, Italian, Thai and Continental cuisine. The hotel itself is a nice basic hotel. The rooms are small as is standard for the region, but absolutely big enough to unload the suitcases and still have room to move. The rooms are clean and have the expected tea and coffee available. Maid service was available everyday, we only used it twice as we didn't need a full cleaning, but each time it was done it was done well. We ordered take out one night instead of heading out to a restaurant and were so happy with the cheese and fruit plates, bread, olive oil and tea for 30TL that we ordered in the next night too, much cheaper than going out! The rooms come with a safe for storing passports etc, our laptops fit in as well. The one thing that I will say that was not great, was that the walls are fairly thin and you could hear other people coming and going, conversations in the hall etc. It wasn't enough to keep me from going back as it was quiet at night, but if you are sensitive to that you might want to be aware... The complimentary breakfast was traditional Turkish: bread, cheeses, yogurt, beautiful honey comb, jams, meats, dried fruits, also continental stuff: cereal, scram eggs, homefries and lots of fruit. The staff could not have been more helpful, arranging transportation to and from the airport that was efficient, affordable and friendly. My flight home was early and they offered me a complimentary boxed breakfast to take with me. Both drivers spoke English and were only too happy to point out the sights and give some interesting history. The transportation from the airport was complimentary as was our first night's dinner, in the hotel restaurant, which was lovely and the service was exceptional. The return trip to the airport was 25TL, so less than $15, a great value for a private transport with friendly drivers! Traveling alone to and from the airport as a middle aged woman in this HUGE city was a concern, but I never felt uncomfortable. I had a few questions prior to my stay, all were answered by e-mail within 24 hours by the hotel Guest Relations Manager, Ayse Sancak. They were obviously concerned that we have a positive stay, even following up with an e-mail "thank you" once I returned home. This is NOT a luxury hotel, what it is, is a great basic hotel with a nice restaurant, great staff and a terrific location. I paid $500 USD for 6 nights which included a a complimentary dinner, breakfast every morning and transportation from the airport. It was a GREAT deal and I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Daniel J
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel and simply could not fault it. The hotel was in a perfect location being only 5 minutes walk from the major sights. The staff were super friendly, always helpful and very polite. The room was always cleaned well and well stocked. The restaurant attached to the hotel provided fantastic Turkish food, and the restaurants the hotel recommended were always of a high quality and good prices (as well as receiving a 10% discount). A perfect hotel for a visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Best idea i had”
Reviews.Author: chouzo
Reviews.Content: This is the best choice i made in my travels. The hotel is well situated to the main touristic attractions like Topkapi palace or St Sofia. There is many restaurant around but the hotel's restaurant is far away the best in the area. The staff was very nice and helpful. The breakfast was excellent and finishes a 11h00 good for a long sleep. lol. One remark was the internet signal in our room was too weak to stay online. but i think its easy to solve it. For sure, i will go back there again. PS: i booked from the hotel's website which gives me many advantages.

Reviews.Title: “Good value tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrew020666
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and tidy. It is located 200m from a tram stop which takes you anywhere for 2TL. Its an 800m walk to Topkapi palace and not much further to Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar (although after you get lost it seems alot further). Breakfast was fine. So if you want a base for sightseeing after a decent breakfast, it ticks all the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but lacking hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: DRD1965
Reviews.Content: The size of the rooms and the cleanliness was good. At first the customer service manager was nice and accommodating but when we had some problems, they weren't so accommodating. We had a slow draining shower and we told the front desk. They said they had fixed it but then it overflowed and they moved us to a new room. The next night there wasn't any water and the front desk failed to inform us and they were all huffy when I said they could have told us before I started a shower. The service in the breakfast room was sub-par. The servers should at least ask if you need anything and if you need something else before taking away the food. There was always something missing at breakfast. They didn't replenish when something ran out The dinner and dinner service was awesome. The restaurant was always busy. Overall, it was an okay hotel. The overall value is above average..

Reviews.Title: “A really nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Deta_12
Reviews.Content: A really nice, clean and friendly hotel, well located in a calm and nice area. The breakfast is super. We also had dinner there one night and the restaurant is superb. I can really recommend Erboy hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money with great location”
Reviews.Author: Shaddy82
Reviews.Content: The location is just perfect! Just stayed there recently during a 4day tour in Istanbul with my girlfriend and 7 other friends. It is situated in a location where it's not right smack at the touristy areas like Sultanahmet so it's not overcrowded and noisy and everything is easily accessible. A pharmacy is just right across the hotel and lots of souvenir shops and restaurants are a stone's throw away. It's also a short distance to a tram (GÃ¼lhane) station and very near to Topkapi Palace. And if you plan on visiting Istanbulâ€™s famous sites like Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, a 5-10 minute walk would take you there. Service is top-notch! The staffs at the reception were very accommodating and helpful on giving us tips and information on just about everything. Rooms are good but not that great. Some of the rooms don't have balconies so be sure to ask if you want one. I suggest you bring your own toiletries to avoid disappointment as only liquid soaps are provided. The free breakfast was pretty decent with a wide variety of selection of cold cuts, breads and pastries. For those who want to take great photographs, there's also a roof top terrace which give you a bird's eye view of the city and a spectacular view of the Hagia Sophia. Overall, the whole experience staying at the hotel was excellent and I highly recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in a hotel with decent value in an excellent location without compromising on quality of service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an excellent location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alarbim
Reviews.Content: We spent 11 nights at Erboy hotel,well the location is very handy to everything,tram,bus and train stations ,as well as to the Sultnahmett area and the blue mosque just walking distance ranging from few minutes to maximum10 minutes to the Sulatanahmett.The staff are very helpful ,professional and very kind and always welcoming .The rooms are spacoius, very clean and comfy.The breakfast is very tasteful by all means in terms of variety ,quality as well as quanitity.In general the hotel is an excellent value for money so I highly recommned Erboy hotel for every one looking forward to visit Istanbul. Alarbim

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AzizShaher
Reviews.Content: great location near everything in istanbul , walking distance from everything u want to see really good breakfast ,, only bad thing is really thin walls otherwise great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Hammer85
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at Erboy (family of 4) on our second trip ever to Istanbul. Location is great (4 minute walk from tram stop, 10 minute walk to blue mosque etc). Rooms are very very clean, size is as expected for Europe in general (tough to compare to North America), the service is great everyone is very helpful and always smilling, breakfast is great, very good selection (lacking in fresh fruits though), For the price we paid it was great. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Oscar O
Reviews.Content: we ljust oved everything about the hotel: great value for the price, the room very clean and comfortable, lovely and helpful staff, fantastic location in the town centre, the breakfast is excellent, variety and quality.. so zero complaints! I would recommend it to everyone wanting to visit Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and location”
Reviews.Author: jewelz88
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service We stayed at the erboy hotel for five nights and recieved brilliant service the entire time, beginning from our complimentary transfer from the airport. At checkin, we were given a larger room and Jon was very helpful in helping us plan our trip and recommending an itinerary. One morning we left before breakfast had started, so they thoughtfully packed us some sandwiches. He also provided us with some excellent recommendations for dinner and drinks. The room was clean to a high standard and was sufficient for what we needed - excellent value also considering it included buffet breakfast and transfers. We also received a discount for paying cash - an added bonus.Â  In all, the hotel was in a perfect location and the service and friendly nature of staff was far beyond that of a three star hotel, better in fact then a lot of five star hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Extended weekend in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Djordje V
Reviews.Content: We have spent unforgettable four days extended weekend from 09 Feb to 12 Feb 2012 in Erboy Hotel. The choise of the hotel was rendom as we were looking to be accommodated in old part of the city. Our first and all other impessions were great. Extraordinary kind and pleasent staff on reception, clean, quiet and large room (2403),delicious breakfast in nice ambient with staff every minute on your service. Whatever we have asked we have received correct information or service. Finaly, many thanks to hotel staff and management and we wish you to continue to do your bussines in this way. I will recomend to my friends and colleges to have expirence with your hotel as I have had.

Reviews.Title: “Erboy is an oasis of delight”
Reviews.Author: Ron P
Reviews.Content: I was returning from Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan and wanted several days of Istanbul relaxation to combat jet lag before returning home to the US. I had done this seven years ago on my last trip to Central Asia, so a return to the Erboy was a return "home." I am delighted to say that the hotel was even better than I remembered. The location is perfect, located in the heart of the historic Sircecki district. The breakfast is simply wonderful--expansive, varied, and graced with many local delights. The room itself is very comfortable, updated and upgraded from my last visit, with water pressure in the shower that is like an automotive "power wash." This is an excellent place to stay while visiting Istanbul--a city imbued with charm and exoticism of Asia but the comforts of Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly staff, Great location in a safe area”
Reviews.Author: TEWY32
Reviews.Content: Great friendly staff nothing was to much trouble for them, good safe location, 2 mins walk to tram stop, 10 mins walk to the mosque's and bazaar, sports bar 2 mins walk at the end of the street, restaurants and bars next street down, rooms are clean and tidy and breakfast had a good choice. If I'm ever in Istanbul again I know where I will be staying

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service.”
Reviews.Author: LaStef42
Reviews.Content: I was travelling alone and arrived late at night. Beforehand I had contacted the hotel that arranged transport from the airport and pay at the hotel. When I arrived I got the warmest welcome and information on what I could do based on what I wanted to do. The room was great and I felt comfortable at once. It isn't always relaxing travelling alone a middle age woman from far away culture but at Erboy I felt welcomed and relaxed. The location is absolutely fantastic for a tourist, I could walk to Haga Sofia and Sultan Ahmed Mosque (Blue mosque) the Bazaar, Istanbul Museum of Modern Art, I could enjoy the vibrant culture of Istanbul where so many worlds join each other and make exciting harmony. They had excellent service to get tickets and gave good information that I could rely on. And when tired after a long day of walking there is a gourmet restaurant at the ground floor PaÅŸazade Restaurant that gives you 10% discount if you are a guest. I highly recommend it. My travel agency had recommended that I should book a hotel room in one of the world chain hotels as I wouldn't know how a local hotel would be. I went through Tripadvisor and decided to try Erboy and am very happy about it. Their breakfast is very good and I enjoyed it very much, wide variety of things that I enjoyed coming from totally different culture and breakfast traditions. I specially enjoyed their newsletter every morning with tips about what was going on in Istanbul and on Turkish language and country. I had been working at another location in Turkey where it was extremely cold at that time and felt exhausted after the work. I was doubting my decision to take the weekend in Istanbul but I don't regret it at all. It was fantastic experience and the staff at Erboy Hotel created a comfortable environment so I could just relax and enjoy the great city of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality Accommodation at Competitive Price”
Reviews.Author: R_S_T_Sivakumaran
Reviews.Content: We, family of four, spent six nights in this hotel during late December 2011. We were happy with the size of our family room. The rates we paid was very competitive for Istanbul. Breakfast was okay. In my judgement they matched or even bettered standard you expect in good three star international hotels. Staff were hepful. Situated in Old Town near all the attractions. What I am not sure about Fire Drill and Fire Escape, how the hotels in Istanbul manage this safety issue.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: thornwald
Reviews.Content: I spent only one and a half days but I got very well impressed. Its location is fantastic, few metres from hagia Sophia and from the tram with lots of good restaurants, grocery, banks, etc. The hotel is fashionable, clean, beautiful, my room had a safe and the vision from my window could not be better. I recommend everybody to ask for a transfer at the reception because of the safety and price, which was to me only 45 turkish lira to ataturk airport. the street of the Hotel is not noisy so I could sleep with a almost complete silence in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Top service quality”
Reviews.Author: Blaede
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend spent 15 nights in this hotel. The room are pretty small and a bit noisy but the hotel is very well situated and the personnel is incredibly kind and professional. I have never seen such dedication in a hotel. I highly recommend this place for any touristic trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay right in the heart of Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: traversethesky
Reviews.Content: We had a great 4 night stay at this hotel. We were greeted by a very nice manager who offered us a free apple tea while he talked to us about the city of Istanbul on our complementary map. The room was nice, clean and comfortable. Free water, tea and coffee and a guide book to use during our stay. The breakfast was amazing - with a range of different foods on offer. Great value for money, couldn't ask for more, with a location right in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special - Good location”
Reviews.Author: BEYLHR
Reviews.Content: The whole experience was average I'd say, the facilities aren't that modernized or in great condition. needs some upgrades and work. room was extremely humid. breakfast was amazing, the best part of the whole stay. location is pretty good, close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Irma R
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say that the experence of staying in Erboy hotel was one of the better hotel experiences, for me and for my friends as well. We have talked about it all the time in Istanbul. The stuff is so great especially the receptionist working in the second shift, I'm sorry I didn't catch his name. The room was great, comfortable, cosy ... The breakfast also, better than in the most hotels I've been to. And I have travelled a lot. All in all, great experience. I will surely stay in this hotel whenever in Istanbul. I'd like to thank them for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful”
Reviews.Author: layerliz
Reviews.Content: We chose the Erboy Hotel because of the reviews on Trip Advisor and its location. On arrival, we had great trouble with the taxi driver from the airport, trying to charge over double the previously agreed rate. The Reception manager came to our aid and swiftly resolved the situation. He could not have been more helpful or professional. He then went on to explain that we had been upgraded to another hotel in the same group, just a few minutes away. This was due to there being a party of 117 schoolchildren at the Erboy and they felt we would prefer to be at the Sirkeci Konak Hotel. Too right - it was very much an upgrade in every way. So, I can not say much about the Erboy Hotel, other than that they were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Erboy is a great hotel in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Elza F
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend you to visit Turkey and stay at Erboy Hotel. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Breakfast is excellent. My husband and I were greeted warmly! Elza Ferreira Brazil

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Albina K
Reviews.Content: We are very satisfied with hotel. Erboy receptionists are very helpfull and kind. A men who cleaned our room is, obviously, a great perfectionist. We ate in restaurant Pasazade (in a hotel) four different meals and everything was delicious. The waiters are profesional and polite. If we ever come to Istanbul again, we will stay in Erboy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “3 Day Istanbul Break December 2011 (Simon Dudley)”
Reviews.Author: Siomn D
Reviews.Content: My 5 friends and I had the pleasure of staying at the Erboy Hotel in December 2011 during a 3 day break to Istanbul. Having not visited Istanbul before we were unsure as to where to stay so consulted Trip Advisor via; Booking.com and the reviews were very accurate. The hotel was spotlessly clean, the staff were very helpful and friendly. The location was excellent, close to a few good cafes, Resturants & bars, and within walking distance of many of the attractions on offer. There was even an English Pub within 100 yards of the hotel. All in all, I would 100% recommend the Erboy Hotel to anybody looking for a well placed, well priced Hotel as a base for your Istanbul trip. I'll definately be going back.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Zenaida L
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, within 10 minutes walking distance of the Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Basillica Cistern etc, and literally a minute from the tram stop. Rooms are extreamly clean, and very comfortable. Very friendly and helpfull staff. I forgot my sunglasses in the room and they sent them home (Spain) for free.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotelin Historical Area”
Reviews.Author: raejazh
Reviews.Content: Having read some excellent reviews of ERBOY in Trip Advisor & Booking .com we chose this hotel for our 4 days holiday in Istanbul. Ideally located - a mere 5 min walk from Topkapi palace, Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque etc & 2 min to the (Gulbanhe) tram station - very freindly & helpful staff, wholesome breakfast and daily servicing of rooms made our stay very comfortable. Mr Cen at the front desk & Ms Ayse (Guest Relations Manager) together very promptly provided whatever help we needed. Having stayed more than 3 nights we had a free pick up from Airport & a Welcome dinner in the Pasazade Resturant. Hotel is very good value for money paid Ejaz Husain Karachi, Pakistan 10 January 2012

Reviews.Title: “excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: makomez
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m a travel agent, after reading reviews here i booked 3 times for my family, friends and cousins at erboy hotel! They loved staying here! The staff are very friendly, professional and very welcoming. They told me that thereâ€™s A lot of attention to details. Everything is very clean and well maintained. excellent service, cleanness, perfect location! Iâ€™m also booking for my friends and parents during Feb! So the next time Iâ€™m travelling I will be sure staying at erboy hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful New Year”
Reviews.Author: ian k
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Erboy Hotel over New Year an experience that would be hard to fault. A hotel car collected us from the airport. The hotel is ideally located for all the principal sights & the staff & service would be very hard to fault. Our room was large spacious & clean & serviced daily in timely fashion.We took dinner in either the Erboy or sister hotel restaurants all of which were superb. I would thoroughly recommend the Erboy & will recommend it to friends travelling to Istanbul. I would without hesitation stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: jasjos
Reviews.Content: For me, the Erboy was a wonderful experience. I used to live in Istanbul but was not all that familiar with the historical district where the hotel is located. One block from Metro (train) and a five minute walk in either direction for wonderful historical sites and good food. Staff was very helpful even before I arrived helping me with directions from the airport and setting me up with a guide via email. I just had a wonderful Christmas visiting one of my overseas homes.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Dimosthenis F
Reviews.Content: The hotel had good comments from booking.com and the price was fair. We surely enjoyed our stay because of very helpful staff, clean rooms, delicious breakfast buffet and the location of the hotel which is very close to all sightseeings. It was a bit difficult to find because of the rude taxi driver that left us 2 blocks away while raining. The Erboy people welcomed us with a traditional Turkish tea and a big smile and we appreciated a lot that despite we arrived 2 hours earlier than check-in time, they offered us a room. In general, the hotel is a very good value for money and worth trying.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: lumidan
Reviews.Content: Incredible location for such a price per room. Aprreciated effort of the stuff to keep free car parking place and have care on it.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel of Convenience”
Reviews.Author: Vetri R
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok overall but I found the rooms were a bit to small. They did have a good presentaion of food. The srvice was professional but lack the friendly service. The price of the hotel was resonable but lack the room service effeincy

Reviews.Title: “upgraded on arrival”
Reviews.Author: JennMar
Reviews.Content: We booked at Erboy because of the great reviews it had on trip advisor. We booked several months in advanced and it was on 50 euros a night for the 2 of us. We arrived at SAW airport and took the havatas bus to karikoy dock (8TL) and a ferry to eminou dock (2TL). From the dock we walked to Erboy. It was slightly challenging to find but we just asked random people on the street and everyone was very nice. Erboy is centrally located in the historical part of istanbul within walking distance to topkapi palace, hagia sophia, and blue mosque, etc. On arrival they upgraded us to their 4 star hotel (sirkeci konak) which was only a few blocks away. They said they weren`t full but just wanted to give us a better experience during our stay. We were very happy to be upgraded and we had an amazing stay at konak. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: Rui L
Reviews.Content: Erboy Hotel is the best hotel in Istanbul for many reasons. The location is perfect, near the historical places, markes, restaurants, museuns and also the tram point, so you can reach all the city from here. The second point is that Erboy Hotel seems like family, I had a great moment with the team of this hotel, specially the Reception Desk, just ask Mr. Ã‡en and he can provide the bests tour, visits, tickets, and real good and trustful information. The rooms are wonderful, the breakfast is perfect and you also have a chance to drink a cup of turkish tea, just ask it at the recepetion. I really recomend the hotel and its team. Ask for Mr. Ã‡en!!!

Reviews.Title: “mmm... ERBOY, what else?”
Reviews.Author: muratmallorca
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a very pleasant visit to Istanbul. We stayed for six nights in Hotel Erboy and the only word can describe our stay could be "total satisfaction". The situation is ideal, close to the most important touristic interesting points, The room was comfortable, cleaned and towels replaced every day. The staff was efficient and proffesional, they gently arranged some show reservations for us and have been every time helpful. Special mention to Ms Ayse, I would like to know the secret to her permanent smile! The breakfast was abundant and varied. We also tasted twice Pasazade Restaurant's food, was delicious. I honestly would recommend it and no doubt will be our accomodation point next time to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel, everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Rami E
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights in this hotel and I recommend it. The staff was very nice and helpful, specially Ms. Ayse ,the guest relations manager. We were picked up and dropped off to the airport by a very friendly driver and on time. The location is perfect, 30m far from Gulhane tram stop and at walking distance from touristic spots in sultanahmet. The breakfast was rich and variant with fresh bakery and hot coffee, the room size was very good for two (we also had a separate small tv/living room) and our room was neatly made up with new towels every day. I will definitely stay in this hotel in my next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dzmom
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the many reviews on Trip Advisor, my husband and I chose to stay at the Erboy during our late October visit. Since we had reserved directly with Erboy, we were picked up from the airport. It was nice not having to worry about getting to the hotel after our 11 hour flight. We found the staff at Erboy to be pleasant and helpful. Our room was nice and clean. The hotel, located in Sirkeci is an ideal location. We were close to the tram, the historic sights and to Eminonu. If (when?) we come again, this will be where we stay!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel in perfect area.”
Reviews.Author: ASloan24
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Erboy for 6 nights during our stay in Istanbul. Neither of us had ever been to Turkey before. The hotel staff was helpful, friendly and extremely accommodating. The room was clean, neat and met all our needs (the bathroom was particularly good as the water pressure was really amazing and the water temperature was always hot). Ask for a room in the new wing if possible, we had a little balcony which was great and a really nice touch. The restaurant in the hotel was delicious and you get a free meal the first night. You also get an additional 10% at all of the restaurants at the affiliate hotels and the one we visited right down the street, Imbat Terrace, was wonderful and had terrific views. Free full breakfast is provided at the Erboy every morning which was really great. Erboy also gives free transport from the airport with a stay of over 3 days and arranged for our ride back for 40TL i believe. Also, 2 computers with high speed internet and a printer in the lobby for guest use! As for location, the hotel is right in Sultanahmet and at the Gulhane stop which made the rest of city so easy to get to - use public transportation or walk - everything is really very close and the public transportation system is very easy to use! All around a truly wonderful stay at the Erboy, we would without hesitation return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beatriz B
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in Istanbul, we thought are trip was ruined. All our luggage was lost during the flights and connections. But the staff from the hotel assured us this was common and that our luggage would be returned. They were very helpul and riendly, and called the airport information all the time while we enjoyed the city. After 2 days, when we got back from a tour, everything was back, in our rooms. The location is perfect, all the main tourist attractions are within a walking distance and there are a lot of restaurants! But the best meals we had were from the hotel. The breakfast has everything, and the restaurant serves delicious food all the time.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT-LOCATION-VALUE FOR MONEY-RESTAURANT-PERSONEL”
Reviews.Author: CHR71
Reviews.Content: everything perfect, considering the money one can pay to stay at erboy. Pasazade restaurant, perfect..real good food..relatively cheap..personel of hotel -restaurant perfect..easy access to everywhere...

Reviews.Title: “Value for money? Yes, indeed!”
Reviews.Author: konstantinos S
Reviews.Content: Location: excellent - walking distance from the major landmarks. In a peaceful area, full of restaurants. Tram station: just outside the hotel. Service: all very kind, helpful, with a good command on the english language (very rare). Rooms: clean and tidy. As big as you need. Breakfast: fair enough. Worth spending some nights there? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: franzv2
Reviews.Content: I had the most wonderful stay at Erboy Hotel while visiting with my family. Every member of the staff was the most polite and professional, the reception was lightyears above anywhere else I have stayed in years. Perfect location right in front of old Istanbul and the tram station to the other parts of the city, beautiful and safe neighborhood, excellent in giving tips for the first-time visiters, honest in organizing package tours and refunding. Would definitely come back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Ole Andreas H
Reviews.Content: Already by checking in we realised a remarkable hospitality, convincing us that we were most welcome and that the staff would really make our five day's stay to a great experience. This impression became verified during the stay. We have never met such a service-minded staff before. Not least the waiters in the restaurant, performed their service in a way that gave us the feeling of personal contact, not only perfect courtesy. Besides we appreciated very much the facilities and the sentral location in the old town - with short walking distances to several famous attractions. The two minor problems we discovered in the room, were promptly repaired.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Crazyv
Reviews.Content: Haven't stayed at any other Hotel in Istanbul so don't know how it stacks up relative to the others. The major advantage of this Hotel is that it is very close to all the major attractions in the old city including the Spice market and the ferry locations for a Bosphorus cruise. So it is quite easy to go and see a few things and then come back to the hotel and then go out again. Makes for a very relaxing experience. The other major advantage is that it is about 50 yards from the tram stop which makes getting to and from the airport an absolute breeze (there is an easy connection from the tram stop to the metro line to the airport total cost 4TL/person and about one hour). Although we didn't do it the tram also runs across the Golden horn to the new district. There is an elevator so getting to one's room is not an issue. The rooms are small but quite comfortable - but the TV leaves a lot to be desired. Don't plan on taking a tub bath because there isn't, one but the shower is good sized with good water pressure and hot water and the size of the bathroom is adequate. Everything was clean. The breakfast has all the traditional fare- is the same every day but there is plenty of choice so it is possible to vary breakfast each day. The staff were very polite and helpful. Didn't try the wifi in the room but the computers (2) in lobby were generally available. The major drawback is the noise - from the street and the hallway but strangely not from the rooms next door. Again the street noise might be a function of the tight quarters of the old city and something that all hotels suffer from- we were on the second floor and that might have also contributed to the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Erboy Hotel Has It All”
Reviews.Author: cmleong
Reviews.Content: When we travel to another country we always have the issue of where and what type of hotel to stay. For location, price, customer service and cleaniness, Erboy Hotel has it all. The location is within walking distance to all attractions in Sultanahmed district where there are many eateries and souvenirs shops. The price we paid is reasonable for a standard room around the area. It is clean and the towels changed everyday during our three night stay. We were welcomed by Ms. Ayse, the Guest Relations Manager, with her friendly smile. She sat down with us over a welcome drink of Istanbul apple tea. She briefed us of the nearby attractions and how to get around by public transport. We do not find such service in other similar rated hotels. The other front desk staff are equally friendly and helpful. Such attitude and service definitely place them at par with other higher rated hotels. Besides that, Erboy also arranged airport transport for us without any problem. Gulhane tram stop is about thirty walking steps from the hotel. We travelled to Taksim Square from this station. It was a wonderful stay at Erboy for an elderly Asian couple in the 70ish. Do wear comfortable shoes as many streets are paved with clobber stones that can make walking very arkward. Erboy would be our automatic choice of accomodation should we revisit Istanbul. It is a fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “Erboy Hotel Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: scott t
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and in a very good locaton close to one of the tram stops (which are very good as they run every couple of minutes and you can go anywhere for about 50p). I booked this hotel through easy jet at it was quite cheap and to be honest I was a bit sceptical, but I should not of been as for the money the hotel was excellent value and within walking distance of everything. The hotel staff were very good in particular Jan was so helpful. I travelled with my partner and a child of 5 and I was more than satisfied with this hotel and would stay there agian, I have never written a review before but I thought this warrented a review as if you are reading this you will be aware that Istanbul has many hotels and many varying prices. One tip I would give would be pay the extra and fly into Ashturk airport not Saben Gochen as the travelling times are a pain, if you are flying into Saben Gochen get a Havas bus from the airport to Taksim Square for 12 lira and then make your way to Sultamahmet via train and tram if you have little luggage or if not sit in a taxi for around an hour from Taksim to Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Syed A
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Istanbul. We chose Erboy again because the staff was so friendly, helpful and professional. The price is good value for the money. You can walk to almost every place of interest The Tram is so close to the hotel too. The restaurant was clean and has a good choice.There are also good eating places all around the hotel. For those who are fond of Mavlana Rumi, there is a cultural centre close by. You can see the Whirling Darvesh perform every night.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: linb
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in Istanbul for a couple of nights after an 11 night cruise and picked this hotel for its location, price and good reviews. It didn't disappoint. We left our cruise at 9.30 am and got a taxi direct to the hotel where they stored our luggage for us until they had a room available for check in. We went for a walk and came upon the Basilica Cistern about a 10 minute walk away. We had a look around this and by the time we got back to the hotel, they had a room in the new wing ready for us. Reception couldn't have been more helpful. The room was clean, modern and of average size. All the major sites in Istanbul are a short walk away. Reception recommended their rooftop restaurant so we booked for our first night. We had a lovely meal with wine at a very reasonable price overlooking The Topkapi Palace, Aghia Sophia, The Blue Mosque and The Bosphorus. We enjoyed it so much we tried to book for the following night but it was fully booked much to our disappointment. There was plenty of choice at breakfast. We were able to use the free internet in the foyer to check in on our flight for our journey home and the hotel arranged the transfer for us. I wouldn' hesitate to go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Molepolole
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel while on business with a colleague in May and wrote a very positive review. I decided to come with my wife and a friend this time and combine business with some sightseeing. The hotel staff were as welcoming and helpful as before. The rooftop restaurant remains a delight, with great views of the Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus, and very good food. It was raining for much of our time but this didn't dampen our enthusiasm for the place. We tried 2 of the 4 hotels in the Sirkeci Group, which owns the Erboy. The Pasazade was very good, as before. The Imbat Terrace, just 3 minutes' walk away, was even better. And you get a 10% discount if you are staying at one of the Sirkeci hotels. My business takes me from the financial district to the airport area and across to the Asian said. This is an excellent location. To get to the financial area, you can take a combination of tram (the stop is 2 minutes' walk from the hotel), underground furnicular (to Taksim Square) and metro (to Levent) for 6 TL and it takes no more than 40 minutes. You are less than 10 minutes' walk to the ferry terminal for ferries across to the Asia side. And you are a 30-minute taxi ride to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ErikaZonhoven
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for a stay in Istanbul: excellent location and outstanding service from the whole staff of the hotel. Restaurant was very good too. We certainly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Aglasis
Reviews.Content: Stayed in September for 5 nights. + Great location to nearby sightseeings + Helpful and friendly staff + Nice and clean room + Good breakfast + Tasty baked goods - A little bit noisy in the street - The restaurant closes at 10 p.m. - we haven't tried it because we were never in time :( - No ventilation in the bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Take your ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: gulliversmate
Reviews.Content: We have visited Istanbul on a number of occasions. We booked at the Erboy due to its superb location for getting around. Fortunately our 1st stay was only one night before moving on to the Aegean coast. We were shown to a tiny twin room overlooking what seemed to be an air-conditioning plant. The room had nowhere to put a suitcase nor did it smell fresh. The bathroom had a real dirty drain 'pong'. As this was only for 1 night, we did not complain. We enjoyed a good sleep and upon leaving requested a better room for our 4 night return stay after visiting the Aegean coast. The 2nd time around we were shown to what seemed to be a pleasant room overlooking Ebusuud Street. Our pleasant, somewhat larger room (also without a suitcase stand) turned out to be extremely noisy. The ablution sounds from surrounding guests did not spare the imagination! Furthermore, late into the night we were bothered by noises, which we thought were coming from the floor above. Upon enquiry the following morning, we were told that it was 'a party on the terrace'. However, the 'party on the terrace' was in full swing again the following evening! We investigated and can only assume that the strange thumping, scraping noises were in fact the workings of the lift mechanism. Otherwise, this is a pleasant enough basic hotel with good breakfast and restaurant facilities. Just be sure to request a room that is neither at the back of the building nor on the floor below the terrace. One word of caution: When paying for external services (i.e. shuttle/tour) at the front desk, do request a receipt for monies handed over. Shifts change and it could be that no one has a record of your request and/or payment. As mentioned, we have visited Istanbul many times and have stayed at other similarly priced, well-located Sultanahmet area hotels that provide suitcase stands AND mini fridges stocked with icy cold water! Enjoy your stay in a wonderful city

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Pavlo P
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a lot staying at Erboy hotel. We had to change our booking two times because of flight change and personal issues, but there were no problems with Erboy hotel. We also were really suprised when we got a family room instead of superior double without additional charge. Although we did not spend much time at the hotel, but everything was really good. Location is also good for travelling around city. We would definetely choose Erboy again during the next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Really good value, one of the best hotels we have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Dardoowee
Reviews.Content: A great welcome iced tea and an explanation of nearby attractions. The hotel is very clean. Breakfast is good value and plentiful. Staff very helpful. Rooms beautifully clean Very close to all the main attractions, 5 to 10 minute walk to Blue Mosque Topkapi etc. Hotel roof top restaurant is reasonably priced and a good experience, just a bit windy on the evening we ate there, not there fault. Restaurants close by very good and reasonable,one called Home Made is very good. Word of warning allow time for attraction queues, especially if cruise ships are in. Also disappointed with the Red Hop on hop off bus, waited up to and hour and a half on one occasion spoilt an otherwise excellent city break.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned”
Reviews.Author: tatiana63
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small hotel in the middle of Istambul. Very modern and clean. Staff is excellent. Breakfast is good. The view from the Terrace restaurant is breathtaking. Close to everything. I would definitely return and recommend it to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “really Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Algeriacouple
Reviews.Content: we were in this lovely Hotel from the 25th sep to the 3rd oct as an algerian couple, it was very very nice week, me and my wife we found a great hospitality from the hotel crew like the lovely FATALLAH and TOLGA also the girl near to the elevator with her laptop (guest relationship mg), the breakfast was 5 stars, our room was very very very clean, and the best one was the top roof restaurent its amazing with the view of the bosphorus and the famous bridge, to be honest I make a lot of searchs to find this lovely hotel, 5 mnts to the blue mosque and aya sophia, gulhane park topkapi paace, 15 mnts to the galata tower, 7 mnt to spice bazzar and grand bazzar, so it was a good location for a very good hotel the ERBOY HOTEL, thanks to every one and specially to the hotel staff

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a few minus points”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldBerlin
Reviews.Content: Very good points: Location, staff, cleanliness, shower (great water pressure and hot water all the time). rooftop restaurant. Good points: Breakfast. Although always the same, there was so much choice you could vary it from day to day. 2 computers in the lobby with a printer. Fast internet acccess. AC in rooms (although it was a bit loud) Price TV in the room, with a lot of channels in Turkish, English, Italian, Spanish, German and Russian. Could be a problem: No fridge in the room; very few hangers and only one drawer. This didn't bother us but it might be important for others. A word on the room: We had a twin room on the smoking floor (first floor), facing into the back. It was dark and there were generators outside that were very loud. I am noise-sensitive, my companion isn't. I used earplugs, which worked for me. I also found the bed a little too firm, but that is a personal preference. Since smoking was a priority for us, it was the trade-off for the darkness and generator noise. Non-smokers should avoid the first floor rooms to the back. The room wasn't very big but we only used it to sleep in so that didn't matter. All in all, we liked this hotel and found it good for the price. I would like to have given it 3.5 points but that isn't possible.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Sumaira1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Erboy Sept 12th 2011. Out first impression of the hotel was "Wow, this is much better than what we expecting". Obviously you are going to istanbul's old city, you can't expect a villa. The staff here was soooo helpful. They gave us really good advice about what tours to take and what to do. There is a printer and computers to use for free and it came very handy for us. Rooms are avg. size for old istanbul's standards. Overall very clean and air conditioned. Breakfast was also very good. The hotel is around the corner from some really nice restaurants which are open until 2 in the morning so if you in a full touristy mood, you can swing by and have some sheesha. Also, it's about 5 minutes walk from the train. We pretty much walked everywhere, sultanahmet, emanonu etc. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location and great restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: Colby1977
Reviews.Content: This hotel is walking distance to Topkapi Palace, Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosque as well as the Gulhane tram stop. Surrounded by pedestrian streets and lots of eateries. Rooms were very clean and the staff was great. The roof-top restaurant was spectacular. Definitely recommend the Erboy.

Reviews.Title: “The Best There Is in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: David-Lee C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Erboy Hotel on one of our many travels across the globe. The staff here were excellent. Friendly, helpful and very accomodating. The location was perfect, close to all ammenities and sites, within view of the blue mosque. The room was cosy and comfortable with the main thing being clean! I actually left an expensive jacket at the hotel on my return to Australia, and the helpful staff posted it back to me in Oz once they located it. Now if that isnt service, I don't know what is. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.... The Erboy Hotel is 5 out of 5. dL

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, good food and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lars L
Reviews.Content: Perfect choice for us. Walking distance to "everything" of interest, fantastic restaurant with good food on the 6th floor with an incredible view. The staff very friendly and helpful. We would choose this hotel again on our next visit to Istanbul and we can definitely highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if location is your main criteria...”
Reviews.Author: RLM1981
Reviews.Content: Erboy is in the perfect spot. So close to all the main Sultanahmet sites, handy for restaurants and easy access to the river. If you're only staying for a couple of days then it's ideal - it's walking distance to everything you'll want to do. The hotel itself is average. A room at the front has lots of noise from the street and we couldn't shut the window because the air-conditioning broke after one night. We asked them to fix it but they didn't. The rooms are basic, staff polite and breakfast is an adequate selection. We didn't eat at the roof restaurant but wished we had - spectacular is the only word for the view. Value-wise I think the hotel was acceptable but I would've been frustrated if we hadn't got a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best quality/price ratio in the city”
Reviews.Author: Maril_11
Reviews.Content: Very good location near the main sights and tramway line. I got a nice room at the top floor facing the small lanes, so no traffic noise or even prayer calls. They upgraded me to a superior room which was quite big, so I don't know about the standard. In any case it was clean. The breakfast was very nice with several Turkish specialities. In the lobby they have two computers available for guests. Actually, it might be easier to do your reservation there that at the reception. The staff is helpful but the only minus was relatively long waiting time at the reception. As I made my reservation for only three first night and then decided to stay longer, I really compared Erboy to other hotels. Many of them cost more but were a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended..will definitely book the same hotel on my next trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Dyrusa
Reviews.Content: We had stayed a total of 6 days in this hotel in late August - early September 2011. Our first consideration when we chose this hotel was its convenient location. It turned out that we made the right choice. The hotel is strategically located, a few minutes walk from Sultanahmet Square where interesting tourist spots and restaurants are located. The hotel itself is surrounded by shops selling souvenirs, restaurants, grocery stores, and even a pharmacy. The rooms are clean and well maintained. The buffet breakfast has a wide array of food choices - we had our fill that kept us going until dinnertime! To top it all, the staff are very friendly. Just wish they had more comfortable sofas in their lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A real pleasure”
Reviews.Author: ilinca_nanoveanu
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with good taste, discreet, comfortable rooms (a bit small, though), very close to the main tourist attractions (wonderful park GÃ¼lhane, Hagia Sophia, the Cistern, Galata bridge, etc). The open terrace has the most gorgeus views and a selected menu. The personnel is excellent and the breakfast tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Friendly staff, perfect location... What more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: RajivB
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful shot break in Istanbul. We were fortunate enough to get a booking at the wonderful Erboy hotel. Staff very very friendly and helpful in making recommendations for places to visit, getting around etc. Nice clean rooms, comfortable and functional. We really loved the breakfasts in the mornings and the location was perfect for walking to all the main historic sites. Catching the tram was easy too from this hotel since the tram stop is less than a minute's walk. We also loved the Rooftop Terrace restaurant at the hotel. The hotel is actually a part of a small group of hotels and guests get 10% off when dining at any of the hotels in the group. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel. 5 stars all the way! In case the hotel staff read this review... thank you for the sandwiches you made for us due to our early morning departure. Nicely made and nicely wrapped and came in very useful since our flight failed to provide us a vegetarian meal :-(

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveller555
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Erboy Hotel for 5 nights in August 2011. When we first arrived our first impression was that it was small and older. It turned out to be the best functioning, clean and very comfortable hotel. The room was small but very functional. What impressed us most was that each and every employee there makes an extra effort to please you. They just don't give you any reasons to complain. The guest relations manager Ayse is extremely helpful and caring, she went out of her way every day to check in with us and ensure we were enjoying our stay. The location is fantastic â€“ a 10 minute walk to many main sites such as the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, the Grand Bazaar and the Spice Bazaar. The Metro is practically a one minute walk away. They gave us a complimentary dinner and one way ride to the airport also as a promotion. You really feel at home in this hotel. One big bonus is their roof top restaurant. You should make the reservation for each night you stay there. Believe me you will know what I mean!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: stefhein
Reviews.Content: Perfect stay, cloose to everything you want to see. Good conection from the airport with the tram. Nice rooms very good breakfast. You can see the Hagia Sofia from the roof. We will definatly stay there again if we go back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice”
Reviews.Author: leonardovaccaro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Erboy to times: from the est of August to the 5th of August and the 14th of August. The hotel is simply beautiful. At pur arrival they offer us 2 turkish tea and they explayned us how to move in Istanbul what to see and ebete to eat. The room was very comfortable. There was a big doble bad, a bathroom with a splendid shower, an armchair and satellite tv. The room was also very clan and cleaned every day. The breackfast was server from 7am to 11am and was a mix of continetal breakfast and turkish breakfast. The location is superb! From the Erboy you can move around the privi al monument of Istanbul by foot: Aya Sophya, Topkapy Palace, Blu Mosquee, Galata Tower, Galata Bridge, Taksim Square and Beyouglu. From the airport is very simple to' reach the Erboy but I suggest to' use the private trasportation of the hotel. For a stay of more then 4 nights is free of charge otherwise it costs 40TL. What to say more... If i will come back in Istanbul, hope yes, I will choose again the Erboy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms with good service”
Reviews.Author: Tullip22
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the erboy hotel for 3 nights. We arrived late at the airport cause our flight was delayed and we had to wait in a enormous line for the passportcontrol. We couldn't find our transfer to the hotel, but after a call we found our driver. The rooms were spotless and of a good size. The only negative thing was that the little volt in the room didn't work.There was a good hot shower. The breakfast was also good, with turkish breads, marmelade, honey, olives, cheeses, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Reaonably priced and comfortable hotel in convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: chickenvspeter
Reviews.Content: The service and rooms were of good quality. There is free use of computers and wifi in the rooms 24 hours. Room service is limited but still available. Good points: - Relatively good price for the comfort - Friendly staff and porters - Very good restaurant upstairs on the terrace (make sure to book) - Very good location, close to a tram stop and barely 5 minutes walk to Topkapi and the Hippodrome (centre for attractions such as Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque). Bad points: - My room didn't really have any view and looked dated. - TV was an old and small CRT - No Shampoo (but had small soap dispenser) - no other toiletries provided - Ordered sausages and chips for 9TL (thinking of Turkish Sausages) and received spam and french fries with ketchup - Hot menu on breakfast could have been better (just chips, scrambled eggs, spam and hard boiled eggs)

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: CariocaBrazil
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in 4 different hotels in Istanbul between May and July 2011, I can say for sure the best of them all was Erboy. Location is excellent for main attractions. Room and bathroom a little small, but absolutely clean! You have complimentary tea and coffee facilities in the room.We were very pleased to have had an early check-in, as demanded (around 10:30). I would certainly recommend this hotel as it is very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: zeenhulya
Reviews.Content: It was great. The service was perfect. The personal is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice in the old city”
Reviews.Author: kuntuzangpo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 4 days to visit Istanbul and this hotel is a good choice since all main attractions (Topkapi, Hagya Sophia, Bosphorus shore, Grand Bazar) can be reached in 15 minutes on foot. The hotel is very clean and well run, my room was a standard room so size was quite small but facilities were enough and in good order (Air con, Tv, Coffee Maker) and the bathroom spotless clean. Breakfast was very varied, really a plus since Turkish food is delicious. Staff was gentle, ready to give information about the city and its attractions. 2 really nice restaurants, especially the roof top one with a view on the Bosphorus. Will go back for my next visit of this really beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Third visit and still excellent”
Reviews.Author: Harrowian
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to the Erboy Hotel. We were so happy with the value, service and location on our first visit that we have been back twice. The Erboy is the only central Istanbul hotel we have stayed in and have no reason to consider any other in future. We were picked up from the airport by a driver waiting with a name card. This transfer service (free if you book direct and stay a certain number of nights) was very welcome after a long journey and the struggle to get through the airport formalities. Tip: keep some one Lira coins for the airport trolleys. The hotel also offer a free) dinner in their highly rated Pasazade restaurant (if you book direct and stay a certain number of nights). This time we had two rooms, both of which were of a good size and very clean. The housekeeping staff did an excellent job of keeping them clean and tidy. We were so impressed by them that we left some tips. Everything worked properly. The air conditioning was very good in both rooms and definitely needed at this time of year. Value â€“ I think this hotel represents excellent value as a good three star hotel close to the main tourist attractions and the tram system. It certainly had all the facilities we wanted. Service - The reception staff spoke very good English and have always been very helpful. Sinan even managed to cope with my sense of humour and the Customer Services Manager, Ayse - was, as always, extremely helpful and she never stopped smiling! Since our previous visit, tea and coffee facilities have been provided in rooms, which was a very welcome addition. In the total of about 3 weeks we have stayed here on the three occasions, we have never had any serious issue or complaint and anything we raised with the hotel was dealt with quickly. For example, we asked for some plates and they arrived within a few minutes. Location â€“ we like the location. It is not in the noisy area of Sultanahmet but the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sophia are only about 10 minutes walk up a gentle slope. The Topkapi Palace is about 10 minutes away if you donâ€™t mind a steep incline or about 20 minutes using a much gentler route going around the Aya Sofia. The tram station is about two minutes away. The docks for the ferries are about 10 minutes walk away. The Spice Bazaar about 15 minutes walk and the Grand Bazaar about 10 minutes by tram. There are shops and restaurants nearby. In summary, I would thoroughly recommend this hotel. If we return to Istanbul again, we would stay here without question.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel and the friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jinanne
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Erboy between the 20th and 26th of July 2011, we couldn't have had a better welcome, it was very clean, our room was more than adequate with a private bathroom, air conditioning, comfortable bed and tea and coffee making facilities in the room, the hotel was located within walking distance of all the major historical landmarks, the blue Mosque was around an 8 minute walk away from the hotel, the harbour was around a 10 minute walk, and it's right in the middle of all of the restaurants and cafÃ©s in the area. There is a lovely park just at the end of the road. A special thank you to the guest relations manager who went out of her way to ensure we had a pleasant stay at the hotel, we were even waved off at the hotel doorstep when we left. Couldn't ask for better service, we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ramesh_Muscat
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff at the lobby esp Aysha was very supportive and provide you with maps, timings,metro details etc. However be specific on the room size and bathroom size. Some rooms are very small with bathrooms barely enough for one person. Visitors with children and infants should note this. Also check on airconditioning before settling down in the room. Breakfast is sumptious, varied and delicious. All major attractions are walking distance from hotel and Princess Island Ferry terminal ( Kabatas) , Dolmabache palace, Taksim Square are easily accessable by Metro from Gulhane Park station which is 70 meters from this hotel. Also you can book your Bus Tickets to places like Selcuk, Kusadasi, Goreme, Pamukkale, Ankara etc from Capa . Capa is 15 min away by Metro from Gulhane park station. All bus companies are near Capa metro station. Also Hotel Erboy offers free Airport pick up if you book your stay for 3 nights. But they did not extend this offer to us as we have booked our stay thru booking.com. Understand they extend this offer only for those bookings made thru their Hotel Website. All in all i would prefer to stay in this hotel for my next trip. However plan well in advance ( 3 - 4 Months ) for better rates.

Reviews.Title: “superb location and much nicer than photos show”
Reviews.Author: lela26
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent; you can walk to all major sights and use the tram for the rest. Two years ago I stayed in a Sultanahmet hotel to be central, and this was better. I booked it because of the location and it looked ok. It was far more than ok! Most of the rooms had been re-done and were comfortable and roomy. The entry was excellent and included use of 2 free computers. We were welcomed by a woman with excellent English who advised us of all sightseeing and travel needs. The breakfast was excellent full buffet, including honey dripping from a honeycomb!! Nice view from the roof, and meal we had there was excellent. Lots of great restaurants nearby; we liked the "Turkish Kitchen" across the street, very reasonable and good. Streets were being torn up, but upon completion it will again be a nice walking area on nearby side streets. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place at great location”
Reviews.Author: RiaBr_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Erboy for 7 nights with my 20 yr old son. Very friendly and hospitable staff, clean modern facilities and rooms and an excellent and extensive breakfast buffet (both continental and local dishes). Also the dinner in the restaurant was excellent. To my surprise they had free wifi both in the rooms and lobby, as well as 2 PCs for free use by guests.
