The customer manager, Mrs Ayse Sancak, was very helpful and made sure we had everything we needed to make our visit in Istanbul worthwile.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: DiogoAvila
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay at the hotel. I spent 5 days staying. The stay started with a free transfer on arrival and a complimentary dinner well served in the hotel restaurant, which is always welcomed by travelers who are tired of traveling. The hotel is well located and is within walking distance of the main attractions of Istanbul, plus a tram station and shopping nearby. Special attention to the reception of the hotel with a staff very helpful and able to respond to all needs and information of the traveler. There's even a person who is on hand to provide tourist information to guests. Rooms with new looks, spacious and nicely furnished. Clean and excellent organization. Breakfast varied and well served, covering items of local cuisine and more generic items. Although it has only once gone to the hotel restaurant for dinner, I got an excellent impression. Certainly return to the hotel for a new stay. Diogo A. Avila Silva dos Santos - Brazil

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: fredandheather
Reviews.Content: Erboy Hotel is in a great location, not far from the railway station and right in the middle of the old city. Our room was very comfortable and roomy. Bathroom was superb. Breakfast was terrific and the restaurant superb. We also tried another of the Sirkeci Group's hotel restaurants and it was also excellent. A great break from being hassled on the streets to come into the various restaurants. We left substantial items (bikes in boxes)in the luggage room while we went away for 4 days but this was not a problem to the staff, although they had to move them while we were away. The staff were all very helpful and pleasant, with good English.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: MaliciousD
Reviews.Content: Choosing the right hotel in Istanbul is essential. Not because you're going to this amazing city because of a hotel, but because there's so many places to go and see in Istanbul, that you have stay in the right location. Ernoy Hotel is located perfectly, close to transportation (harbour/tramvay) and very close to several major attractions. The rooms were nice and very clean. Staff were very helpful and polite. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to travellers going to Istanbul, especially if it's your first time.

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further! Hotel Erboy is FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: SharukhMirza
Reviews.Content: Regardless of the 3 star rating, Erboy Hotel is an exceptional hotel which offers a 5 star service. I am glad I did the research before booking a hotel in Istanbul, I have found a true gem of a hotel that I will definitely use again should I re-visit. The hotel is very convenient in all aspects. Some of the conveniences: - Two supermarkets nearby to buy snacks, drinks, cigarettes etc - 20 second walk to Gulhane Tram Station which is 1 stop from Blue mosque & Aya Sophia. 3 stops from Grand bazaar. - 10 minute walk to Spice bazaar (best place for buying Turkish delight). - 10 minute walk to McDonals and Burger King - 10 minute walk to the Marmara sea front! Beautiful at night!! - 5 minute walk to Gulhane park (This use to be the gardens of the Topkapi Palace). - Plenty of places to eat within a 5 minute radius! spoilt for choice! The staff is the biggest asset for this Sirkeci group.. Ayse, Jon, Mehmet, Sali, Izra and Ilyas are just a few of the staff who made this trip memorable. Thank you for everything!! Erboy is most certainly Home away from Home.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: Klaas77
Reviews.Content: we had a great time in your hotel. Every thing was excellent: the breakfast, the room, the service etc etc we'll recommend this hotel to our friends in Holland and if we come back to Istanbul we'll stay again in this hotel, so thank you very much for every thing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in nearly every way”
Reviews.Author: Casually
Reviews.Content: I spent two weeks in the Erboy Hotel and was unfailingly satisfied. The service at the desk was consistently friendly and helpful, whatever the request might have been. The rooms are smallish by American standards but perfectly comfortable. Besides free wi-fi in the rooms, they have two computers in the lobby that are fast and reliable and generally available without more than five minutes' wait (if that). The rooftop restaurant/bar gives you a terrific view of the city and is a comfortable place to relax at the end of the day. The hotel's location in Sultanahmet gives you easy access to the tram. It's also only about 8 or 10 minutes' walk from the Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace, and nearly as close to a number of other sights in the old part of the city. I plan to stay at the Erboy the next time I go to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: rhondamac_1965
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The deal also included airport pick-up, especially helpful for a late night arrival -- check the hotel web site for airport pick-up and other deals. This hotel is ideally located for a short stay in Istanbul. Close to all the locations such as Aghia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi. A terrace-top restaurant/bar also great for night view of Istanbul. Staff very helpful and friendly, rooms clean, included breakfast good for location. We enjoyed our stay here -- recommended as a good, centrally located hotel that is reasonably easily accessible for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very cosy and quiet place”
Reviews.Author: Juli2112
Reviews.Content: Hotel Erboy is located in the very quiet place though really is in a heart of historical center of the town.The first pleasant thing was a free one-way transfer which was waiting us in airport,we had a nice triple room, very quiet even though a light metro way was 2 buildings down the hotel but we didn t hear any sound from it, by the way u could take this metro in 50 m from hotel to get to Dolmabahche Palace, Taksim square and Galata Tower And of course breakfast was excellent,very tasty omlet with red peper, many different sorts of cheese, rose jam, halva and very nice sweets!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay @ Erboy (Nice: location/ room / breakfast/ staff)”
Reviews.Author: MrTG2011
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying @ Erboy. We took Triple Room, which was nice, spacious & clean. Bathroom was big. Staff were nice & helpful. Well English speaking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: Aya294
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Erboy Hotel during my visit to Istanbul on May 2010. The hotel is nice and the staff are so friendly and helpful, they provide free maps and guidance on how to go to tourist location, and they also speak very good English. The location is perfect, 5 minutes walking distance from Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the metro station. Service is really good, with a welcoming famous Turkish Apple Tea at arrival. Rooms are clean. Breakfast is rich and plenty of food. Overall experience was very good, I will again chose this hotel on my next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: budgettraveler8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Erboy Hotel for 2 nights before a trip to Eastern Turkey and 1 night at the end of our tour. In both cases we were very pleased with the hotel. First the location - it is close to many of the tourist attractions in Istanbul and you are able to walk to those attractions. The person at the front desk spoke very good English and was able to help us find our way around. They also provided free maps of the area. We were able to get to the hotel from the airport using the metro. The hotel is approxiimately a block from Gulhane tram station. The trip from the airport is approximately 1 hour using the metro and the cost is 2 tokens each way at 1.75TL per token. I saw another review that indicated that the hotel provided free transport but we were not aware of this and perhaps that is a special deal. In any event, the tram is really quite easy to navigate. We had a couple of extra bags with us and the hotel kept that luggage for us while we off on tour. The water pressure at the hotel is wonderful and the shower was great. The beds comfortable and the room was quiet. The room was very clean. There is free wifi at the hotel. We were quite happy with our choice of hotel in Istanbul. There are many places to eat around the hotel. The breakfast was OK and included with the room. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel near city center”
Reviews.Author: wilkp43
Reviews.Content: Hotel offers free airport pickup and welcome dinner depending on length of stay. Driver met us at the airport with a name card. That was priceless. Welcome dinner was off the menu. We paid for drinks. Meal was delicious and we ate there again. Staff member sat us down and talked about customs including tipping. The room was small but very good price. There are common areas with chairs if you need room to sit and talk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: doug_shaw
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel's location in the old city puts the guest within easy walking distance of many major attractions.The rooms are large and well appointed, and very well maintained. The terrace restaurant has excellent food and magnificent views.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room and best breakfast in Turkey!”
Reviews.Author: emnme09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Erboy during the first part of our trip to Turkey. We had the largest room of the whole trip, and while it didn't feel very "Turkish", it was very clean, modern and comfortable. The bathroom was beautiful and the shower had stunningly plentiful hot water. The street below was a little noisy, but the air conditioner covered that up. Little did I know that it was the best breakfast we would have, and the only chance to eat my beloved rose jam. The sheer diversity of the buffet was wonderful - so many cheeses, breads, jams, fruit, and the best yogurt we had during the trip. The terrace had an amazing view of Istanbul at night. We had some meze and raki, and I regret not eating at the restaurant. The staff were very friendly, helpful and accommodating. The shuttle vehicles were clean and new, and the service was reasonably priced. I can't find fault with anything at the Erboy!

Reviews.Title: “Pure Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Cruisestopover
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and convieniently located in the city. the staff were quite helpful and very friendly. The breakfast was simply a feast of food choices. The room was quite comfortable and airy. The only slight issue that I had was our room was one flight of stairs above the top floor, but it was well worth the trek. However if stairs are an issue for you make sure to confirm that you room is on an elevator floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Faultless!”
Reviews.Author: Vivek_Singh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in four hotels in Turkey across cities with two in Istanbul and this was the BEST. The hotel is located 5 minute walk to Tram line (Gunhale) station and is very well maintained. Has got a rooftop bar with a nice view of the city. They were highly responsive in all the communication. We availed one way free transfer from the hotel and the representative was waiting with my name at the airport. The transfer vehicle was in good condition. After we reached the hotel, the receptionist was very welcoming and spoke excellent English and handed out a city map to us. The breakfast at the hotel was superb. The room we got was recently renovated and aircon was good. The icing on the cake was the wasroom. Towels were new and fresh and the force in shower was amazing. I had the best shower here in 8 day Turkey trip. Here we made payment in cash and got seven per cent discount.. WoW! This is called exceeding the expectations. The location is ideal. In touristic terms, it's located between Spice Market and Blue Mosque, so most tourist points can be covered on foot. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: AbbeyTaylor
Reviews.Content: I was on a trip to Turkey with my family for two weeks and we traveled to many cities throughout the country. Out of all the hotels we stayed at, this was by far my favorite one. They did everything right. The beds were soft and well kept. The showers were absolutely fantastic. The maid service did a great job. The wireless was flawless. The breakfast was very, very scrumptious. It was clean, well organized, modern, and relaxing. It had a very nice location too. Close to many attractions, but not in a supremely busy part of the city. I enjoyed my stay immensely.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault it. Will return. Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Oldhippieandhim
Reviews.Content: Thank you to you and the rest of the members of staff, for making our trip to Istanbul and our stay with you a truly wonderful experience. You were all so kind and helpful from the moment we arrived. The room was ideal. Thank you. You are all so knowledgeable - any request was not a problem. The service, the cleanliness, the breakfast and facilities provided were just excellent. In fact, we cannot fault our time with you. In the past we have run bars and small hotels and know that you the staff, are a hotel's biggest asset. The Sirkeci Group should be very proud of you all and the very professional way that you run the Erboy for them.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the heart of sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: ecimadh
Reviews.Content: I must say sometimes there are certain things which make your stay great despite of some shortcomings in the property. Erboy hotel is a great place to stay for couples and couples with small families initially the room size looked to be a bit small but the staff at this hotel compensated for this. The staff was so much helpful that you feel like that you are coming back to your home. I am so grateful to the great hospitality shown by the staff at the reception and Guest relations manager . The hotel is very close to all the monuments of sultanahmet and lots of good places to eat around. Yes like other people mentioned that breakfast room indeed used to get crowded but it never happened that we had to go back. We could always find a place to sit. The rooms are a bit small but may be its like this in Istanbul. The hotel is right next to tram stop so no worries of moving around. If you plan to go to modern part of the city then it has excellent connections with tram. Hotel can arrange all the tickets and tours although i must say that they are too pricy in Istanbul but that's not hotels fault. In general Istanbul is expansive place. In short i will say that its a great place to stay and i highly recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “What a Perfect Place to Stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: TortugaSeattle
Reviews.Content: We booked for 3 nights at the Erboy, after reading so many positive reviews about the place. Well, once we got settled into Istanbul, we also felt the same. The staff is so friendly and helpful and speak English. The location couldn't be more perfect. It's on a quaint street with lots of charm, and is so 1 block from the Tram Line, and about a 5 minute walk to the waterfront. Going the other direction, it's about a 10 minute walk to the top of the hill to the most visited tourist attractions: Topkipa Palace, Blue Mosque, and the Hagia Sofia along with their parks. The Grand Bazaar is just a few blocks away. We stayed in the remodeled portion of the hotel. The room was small, but it's to be expected in such a DENSE area. It was totally adequate and comfy. The bathroom and SHOWER was amazing! Everything was SPOTLESS!! Breakfast was great. Lots to choose from and all the typical Turkish Classics. You won't go hungry. My first morning, I wanted to try Sutlatch (an old family treat of my grandparents and uncle, who were from the area), and it wasn't on the menu, but they went into the kitchen and GAVE me a bowl of it for free! Can't say enought about the place! I highly recommend the place! Oh, and for 3 nights stay we got Airport Transfer from the Airport, and a free dinner. The dinner was to die for!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: Natella
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Erboy Hotel for 4 night and loved every minute of it. The staff were very helpful, spoke great English and accomodatied our requests when were asked. I picked that hotel after reading TA reviews about it and now am glad that I did make my decision based on what I had read. The location of the hotel is exellent as it is very close to all major cites such as Hagya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Ippodrom, Cicterns and Topkapi Palace. We also walked to and from the Grand and the Spice Bazaars and the water front when there. The rooms were clean and the breakfast was plentiful of choices. The terrace on the top of the building gives you an increadible view of the Bosphorus and the mosques. Make sure to make a reservation if you are interested in enjoying the view for dinner of drinks. I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: dmcbella
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the Erboy and from the minute I walked into the door and was greeted by the friendly reception staff to the customer relations manager who provided me with maps and general information about Instanbul- this Hotel proved to be a great choice for me. The room was clean and as a single traveller the size of the room was fine (and I had a double bed-which was a bonus). The location of the Hotel was well placed between the Historical sights of the old city. I felt safe and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again. It was great value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choise”
Reviews.Author: Frank75-Vale80
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an excellent position in the hearth of the old city, walking distance from all relevant city attractions. What we immediately appreciated was the kindness of Ayse, the guest relations manager (she also speaks fluent Italian). Room and bathroom very clean, buffet breakfast very good, there is also a terrace on the top with stunning city views. Excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect”
Reviews.Author: sharonmaeK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent in so many ways: Location - 5 minute downhill to trams with access to ferry system and all historical sights or just a 15 minutes leisure stroll to most venues. It is home to Pasazade, currently ranked as one of the top restaurants in Istanbul.It is excellent; try the lamb shank dinner! Rooms/baths are simple, but substantial, immaculate, and well maintained. Staff is very knowledgeable, and enthusiastically anxious to share and help with any questions or recommendations. They want to know you, so please take advantage of this incredible hospitality, Value, amenities and special offers make this the only choice for me. No need to check further.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent highly recommend this hotel for various reasons”
Reviews.Author: TimeZ0ne
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location off the tram line so you don't hear that passing at all hours but convenient walking distance to everything. Little supermarket in the street for the odd supply, tea/coffee facilities in the room. The hotel is very clean with a fantastic self serve breakfast. The staff were brilliant, I had flight issues and the lady on the desk did her best to see if she could assist in anyway. Also a great restaurant attached to the Hotel highly recommend that too. Very pleasant enjoyable stay, will stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, simple hotel with exquisite service”
Reviews.Author: Mortenschjotz
Reviews.Content: Now home for little more than a week, I miss the kind services of the Erboy Hotel which is perfectly situated in the middle of the old historic part of Istanbul. The rooms were small and room for clothes etc. was limited, and our room needed a bit of small repairs here and there (a hinge on our closet door was missing, lamp switches a bit "unstable"). The rooms, however, were always very clean and the service in the reception etc. was spotless. E.g. the battery in the room safe had run out, but within a few minutes after calling the reception, a hotel technician came and fixed the problem. I would certainly recommend to seek the advice of the hotel's guest relations manager who provided us - as first time travelers to Istanbul - with great guidance and advice. Also make sure to use the hotel's car service for pick-up and return to the airport. Much safer and more reliable than the ill-rumored taxis of Istanbul - and the price is the same - 40 TRY for two people - we paid 45 upon arrival using an airport taxi. Finally, you should also make sure to make use of the family discount card for the restaurants of the Sirkeci Group. All are situated nearby the Erboy (or even in Erboy Hotel) and provide better meals and services that the many restaurants that eagerly try to hi-jack you for your next meal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in All Respects”
Reviews.Author: TheNextHill
Reviews.Content: We strongly recommend the Erboy Hotel in Istanbul. It was ideally located in the Old City, close to all the major attractions. It was very clean, modern, and comfortable; the room was more spacious than one would expect, and quiet. The staff were very professional, friendly, gracious, and helpful. And the rates were surprisingly reasonable. Upon our arrival we were greeted with glasses of refreshing tea and a brief but informative Istanbul familiarization talk by the charming Guest Relations Manager. We stayed for 5 nights, and such a long stay included a free transfer from the airport and a free dinner in the excellent restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, excellent location, genuinely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Molepolole
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I were on a 3-day sales trip to Istanbul. My colleague had stayed at other hotels on previous trips but wanted to find somewhere convenient for getting to the Asian side as well as the European side and not too far from the airport. Plus somewhere not too expensive. She found it! The tram which can take you across to Beyoglu and Taksim is 2 minutes walk away. The ferry to Uskudar (Asian side) is 10 minutes walk away. You are close to all the major sights, which you can see while having a delicious dinner on the hotel terrace. Yes, my room was very small but it was clean, the bed was comfortable and the shower was excellent. I shall be back in the autumn for a mix of holiday and business....provided the place is not booked up because of all the rave reviews.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel in excelent location!”
Reviews.Author: Istanbul022
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Erboy for 4 nights at the begining of our trip and 3 nights at the end. The hotel is like a boutique hotel, offering free airport pickup, a delicious free meal in their restaurant, and the staff are great!! The rooms are stylish and clean(try to get a room on the back over looking the pedestrian walkway with all the little cafes), and the great breakfasts are included in the price! The location is the best part! They are with in a few blocks of all the important tourist attractions, the Blue Mosque,Haggia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, the Bosphorous, and of course the Spice and Grand bazaars!!! The best part of Istanbul is right in this area! Explore and enjoy!!!! G and A

Reviews.Title: “No reason to stay anywhere else in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: bjw006
Reviews.Content: We have traveled extensively on both business and pleasure and would rank The Erboy as our favorite. The price was more than fair, the staff remarkable, the room (we had a triple) was superb and the location can't be beat. The shuttle service from the airport and the welcoming dinner was an added pleasure. We will go back to Istanbul and we will stay at the Erboy! An added bonus is the wonderful potter, jewelry and carpet store around the corner called the Erdem. Do yourself a favor and stop in and meet Ibrahim and Chary. They will treat you right. Go out the side door of the hotel, down the narrow street and turn right on the main street. The shop in near the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: voyagerLeicesterUK
Reviews.Content: Lovely room, very friendly guest relations; couldn't do enough for us and the restaurant is excellent ! We don't like being ripped off in hotel restaurants and this one certainly doesn't! Good quality food and good service without being overly fussy. Breakfast is good too. The terrace has a great view of the Bosphorus and the Haghia Sophia. You can eat and drink here from 3pm. We asked for ideas of restaurants to eat at and they all turned out to be very good too. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone, its location is close to the main sites; everything is in walking distance or close to the tram. Brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could've stayed here again”
Reviews.Author: cambridgechica
Reviews.Content: Thanks to glowing reviews on this site, we decided to book this hotel for the first part of our trip, and we were so glad we did! The facilities are clean, the rooms are quiet and sufficient, the location is great (many sites and Metro stops within walking distance), and the staff is super friendly. The free private transfer (for booking 3 nights or more) and 7% cash discount are a nice bonus. We also got the Family Card for 10% discount in any of their restaurants, but sadly we didn't get to take advantage of it. I did notice, though, that Pasazade Restaurant, just downstairs, had a lively vibe every night, and I hear it has good food too. If I had to nitpick, one missing piece in this establishment is a full-length mirror in the rooms. But other than that, I was very happy with my stay here. Before checking out to head to Cappadocia, we asked if there were rooms available for the following weekend, as we were going back to Istanbul for 3 more nights before heading back home. We liked our stay so much that we were thinking of just canceling our reservation at the other hotel and just stay at Erboy again. Unfortunately, they were all booked, but the man at the front desk said, "We hope you will still stop by, say hi, and enjoy some apple tea here with us." It felt genuine and sincere, and just made me a bit sad that we wouldn't be able to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, good location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: xywalker
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel in the hub of Sultanahmet - its close to all the major attractions, the tram line etc. Good pad to explore the old part of town, and close to the Sirkeci, from where you can get boats, catamarans to go to the asian side and to explore the Golden horn. Staff are good and helpful. We reached the hotel very early on in the day - but they were very accomodating and checked us in early. Staff very helpful, provided a good over-view of teh area with maps, places to see and ways to get there and good practical advise. Always met with pleasant and warm reception, whenever you bumped into any staff. We had early morning flight to catch and had to leave the hotel at 4.30am and they offered to minimize disruption by sorting out the bill the night before, and getting our taxi ready. Added benefit is that they own two fantastic restaurants in the area where you get a 10% discount if you stay here. We tried both restaurants and they were both fantastic. I also understood from fellow guests that they provide free airport transfer, if you book directly with them, but i didnt avail this since i went via a hotel website. Rooms were clean and had sufficient facilities, and were maintained and cleaned properly. Great hotel for the area, staff and value.

Reviews.Title: “Erboy Hotel - Nothing to Fault”
Reviews.Author: roger75
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of hotels here religiously on tripadvisor prior to booking a hotel and have only posted my own review once before. After staying at the Erboy Hotel in Istanbul, I am compelled to write my second review since it was such a pleasurable experience. My partner and I arrived around 19:00 from SGW airport and check in was very friendly and efficient. We were able to take advantage of a discounted rate on transfer from Sabiha Gokcen airport provided by the hotel (available if you booked online). In addition, we received the 7% discount by paying cash up front and a complimentary dinner in the Pasazade Restaurant on the second night - very attractive deals I must say. The room was extremely nice and comfortable, not to mention quiet at night - a very important point for us. This hotel has everything: location, affordability, and just great customer service. Ayse Sancak - the guest relations manager - took care of all email requests prior to us arriving in a timely manner as well as being extremely helpful for any and all of the questions we had during our stay. I cannot remember the name of the gentleman who actually checked us in upon arrival, but he also was extremely friendly as well - even offering to let us go to the room and relax while he was doing our paperwork. Breakfast is also included in the morning which was good to start the day. All major tourist sights are a 10 - 15 minute walk, i.e. Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Bosphorous. The tram line stop was literally at the corner no more than a minute walk from the front door of the hotel to go into areas that were further away such as Taxim. I can't think of one negative issue with this hotel to post. If and when I ever return to Istanbul, I will stay no where else than the Erboy.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Misha098
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Erboy hotel for 4 nights. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The rooms were modern and very clean. We were given a fantastic welcome dinner at the restaurant downstairs and airport transfers complimentary. The area is very central to all the main attractions and I felt very safe at night. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: johnphilipk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a small, but clean, great location and good service hotel. The rooms where a bit small but clean. Room service was good and food was also of good quality. The hotel is located right next to famous blue mosque and easily accessible from other parts of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with wonderful service!!”
Reviews.Author: SoumyaNair
Reviews.Content: There is no need to search for any other hotel for a wonderful stay in Istanbul. This hotel is everything you are looking for. Especially the service provided by their staff is comparable to a 5 star resort. One thing which we realized after visiting other restaurants ( Imbat, Passazade) owned by Sirkeci group is that they invest a lot of time and effort in grooming their staff as we received excellent service everywhere!! The hotel is conveniently located right at the centre of the city that all major attractions is at walkable distance. Also please do not miss to visit the restaurant of the Erboy (Pasazade) as it is one of the best restaurant serving Ottaman cuisine (advance reservations may be required). On the whole I am really happy and contended with this hotel and will highly recommend this to anyone for their stay in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “We are very content in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: rheinman
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week in this hotel and are content with it, although it is not a luxury hotel. The location is superb: to all historical sites and public transportation. The personnels are very helpful and friendly. I want to especially mention is the hotel restaurant. It is worth the price and the hotel guests get 10% discount. The food is best from what we had in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel-great location-friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: turkishairlines17
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Erboy in April 2011. We've had a family room (3 persons) which was quiet, large and clean as well as the bathroom. The first evening we had a splendid dinner at the hotel. There are plenty of cozy restaurants in the neighbourhood. It's also nearby Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya (5-10 min. walk). The staff was super friendly and helpful. We took the transfer arrangement from the airport to the hotel and it was more than OK. We would certainly recommend this hotel to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Everything perfect”
Reviews.Author: livingherenow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in our late 20s and consider ourselves very well travelled. We usually pay a little less than the 74euro the Erboy charges, but my research into hotels in Istanbul came up with no'one offering the same locaton, value and service for a lesser price. The reviews on Trip Advisor clinched it for us - so many positive things said about staff and service at the Erboy...and in our experience, all well deserved! The location was perfect - five-ten mins walk to the major sights, a picturesque part of the old town with cobbled streets, a sumptuous, generous and tasty breakfast, wonderfully warm and friendly and helpful concierge services. We called on their help for a day trip booking, a converter plug, a lighter/matches, etc. We actually felt more confortable than usual asking favours of our hotel reception and found ourselves calling upon them more than usual! We were welcomed with a cup of tea and an introduction to Istanbul when we arrived, were provided with our room keys, maps, leaflets and an explanation of all the latest deals immediately after arriving. The hotel explained their two latest deals - if we paid in cash in advance, we'd receive 7% off - it doesn't sound much, but in actual fact, it brought our daily room rate down to about 69euro, a price we would usually pay in some places. We also qualified for their one nights free dining in their hotel restaurant. It included entree, main and dessert (not drinks) and the meal was stunning - the best we had in Istanbul; traditional Ottoman cuisine, and in fact their Pasazade restaurant is the top rated restaurant on Trip Advisor for Istanbul. It's very well priced, has super service and offers delicious, interesting dishes. I'll put a more detailed review on Trip Advisor under Pasazade though. The hotel room was cleaned daily to an excellent standard, looked brand new (we were in room 2302) and had all the usual amenities, plus a kettle, tea and coffee, which can be unusual for European 3 star hotels. An extra note, our room was the only one with a proper balcony, while others had a kind of narrow fire escape space, so you might benefit from requesting our room! Other reviews I've read mention paying extra for a room that has been renovated, I'm not sure what that means. We paid the base price for our base listed room but it couldn't have been newer. An excellent stay in an excellent hotel - highly, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: dvdexter
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel -- friendly and helpful staff, convenient location, quiet and comfortable room, well-functioning and clean bathroom. I would definitely stay here again and would unhesitatingly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel and friendly staff: you feel at home”
Reviews.Author: monnikske
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 2502, it was a room for 3 persons. Very clean bathroom, very quiet to stay here. Our welcoming by the staff was very nice and friendly. We didn't expect this at all. They invited us for a cup of tea and gave us a lot of information about the area, musea, places to eat and other recommandations. The breakfast was very good, a lot of things to choose. We liked the hotel very much and hope it will stay like that.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Erboy!”
Reviews.Author: Pagz
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. The location is excellent with everything in the Old Town area in walking distance. The staff at the hotel are excellent and most welcoming. They provided one way transportation from the airport which was wonderful and then arranged our transport back to the airport after our holiday. We stayed for 4 nights and they gave us a wonderful room with a double bed, single bed, and a covertible sofa. The shower was a little tall to get into, but that's because I'm a little short :) The restaurants in the area are fantastic and offer lots of choices. We loved the proximity to Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Cisterns, Archaeological Musuem and Topkapi. It's also pretty conventient to walk to the Spice Bazaar and the Grand Bazaar as well. If you needed to, a tram stop is only 1 block away. We would definitely recommend this hotel to other English-speaking travelers and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice If Youâ€™re Willing to Spent More on Their Renovated Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ti_Chan
Reviews.Content: Initially I was planning to book other hotel but was swayed by Erboyâ€™s offers (see below). Stayed at room 2501; booked via the hotel website itself (otherwise cannot get the bonuses). Overall it was a positive experience and we would not hesitate to stay there again. Pro: - Good size room, modern design & amnenities. Very clean. - Excellent location, tram is down the road and Sultanahmet square is within easy stroll - Value for money bonuses: free private pick up for 3+ nights, free welcome dinner @ Pasazade for 4+ nights (now itâ€™s min 5 nights), 7% cash payment discount, 10% Sirkeciâ€™s group restaurant discount. - On time private transfer (not shuttle); the car smells like cigarette though; thank God the room is okay. - Free wifi. Speed is good. - Responsive to emails/queries. Cons (Nothing too alarming, but if I have to pinpoint): - Terrible currency exchange rate (we were paying in USD while they quoted in Euro); you better exchange outside/from ATM. Even rate in airport is much better! - Room key doesnâ€™t work after few days; had to go to receptionist to fix it. They did not apologize at all for the inconvenience! - If you stayed at their cheaper room; itâ€™s not renovated. Experience would not be as good. - Our room is at 5th floor but the elevator only goes up to 4th floor. We had to use manual stairs â€“ for us itâ€™s not a concern (young couple with only 1 luggage); but just FYI. Note: on our 4th leg of trip; we moved to Maywood hotel which got good reviews here simply because weâ€™re not eligible for Erboyâ€™s free pick up â€“ owh; not meeting expectations built by the hype in tripadvisor. Choose Erboy! Better choice with only 1 euro price difference!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mosaiikki
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Erboy hotel in the last week of March. Beforehand reserved shuttle service from the airport was a good and safe start to our holiday week. The hotel was very well located at a close distance from all the main sights - such as Hagia Sofia, Top Cap, Blue Mosque, Argeolocial Museum and the Bazaars. We stayed at two separate rooms and it was important that the staff was flexible enough to change the other room to a bigger and more comfortable one, as we stayed for five nights and the time in the room was important for relaxing. Breakfast was huge and good, the staff helpful, rooms clean and well taken care of. Side street, where our windows faced, was quiet. We were very satisfied with this accomodation and our time as whole in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and value”
Reviews.Author: Tompparello
Reviews.Content: Erboy Hotel was very pleasant experience. Actually we could recommend the hotel for everyone looking for clean, cosy hotel with friendly staff, great location and reasonable pricing. Positive experiences started due to reservation directly through the Hotel's own reservation system, which worked OK. I received e-mail welcoming us and giving tips and hints for our stay from guest relations manager, Ayse. After receiving the welcome note I started to bother Ayse with total of 15 e-mails. Most of those mails she answered within 30mins, which is on my opinion super fast, especially from 3 star hotel, which was packed with people. During our mails I changed room type, made some special arrangements for our wedding anniversary, reserved a car seat for our baby and transportation from airport. Everything before arrival was arranged extremely well by Ayse. With our arrival everything continued to go as planned. Transportation was waiting at the airport and was quite fluent to the hotel. At the hotel all paper work was done for us while we were sitting an enjoying ice tea. Ayse shared us the highlights of old city, gave us a map and opening hours for the targets of our interests. When going our room everything was as planned - wine open and huge flower bouquet on the bed. Great start. The room itself was in style and glass following "scandinavian style". Very nice materials, good quality air conditioning, large room (superior), fridge. That room could be placed in any new Scandic or Hilton hotel and I wouldn't notice a difference. Already from the beginning it also was easy to notice that cleaning lady on our floor was doing excellent job - that I can't always state about Scnadic hotels ;). Since travelling with a 4 month old, we ended up to use hotel restaurants more than we usually do. The quality of food was actually positive surprice, and especially the service on the roof terrace was outstanding. The whole crew was great, and for example dancing our boy on bar table, but still biggest affect on us did the fellow with moustache (sorry, forgot the name). Our very best for the whole team on the picture! Some people have stated here that breakfast could be better. I agree, but still there was nothing missing and comparing price, stars and variety of food I think the combination is good. Since other elements were higher than our expects, maybe breakfast was just on our expectations - and our expectation are not too modest I must admit. As a conclusion I would say this is one of the nicest hotel experiences I've had. Erboy meets the standards for 4 star hotel, which is not the cases every time in 4 star hotels in Europe. Staff at Erboy were willing to go that extra mile for making our stay extremely pleasant, as an example someone brought his/her own baby seat for our airport transportations. That describes quite well how much these people were willing to do. Special thanks to person offering the baby seat, Ayse for all the support, roof top terrace crew and to our cleaning lady on block 2, 4th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, staff, location, food, everything was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: belekvillas
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Erboy hotel, our first ever trip to Istanbul. From the minute we arrived we were made to feel welcome. Our room was spotless and supplied with tea and coffee and water which was replenished every day. The room was cleaned and spotless every single day. The buffet breakfast was plentiful with loads of choice. The breakfast room could get a bit noisy when it was full. Nothing was left to run out and there was plenty of choice. We ate in the hotel restaurant each night and enjoyed each meal we had there. The staff were lovely and friendly, my mum loved chatting with them each evening about our days sightseeing expeditions. The location is ideal, even my mum was able to walk to all the places she wanted to see, including the Topkapi Palace, Aya Sofia Museum, Cistern, Bosphorous etc. Everything is so close to the hotel. We would definately stay at this hotel again, no question about it. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: lindaindigo
Reviews.Content: a small clean friendly hotel in the centre of old istanbul.. couldn't be better placed for walking to galatea bridge and also to grand bazaar, blue mosque. topkapi palace.. has many good bars/restaurants in surrounding streets. Rooms a decent size though maybe a bit small for two.. had a view of bosphorus from my window..breakfast excellent.. staff very helpful, all in all couldn't fault it..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and a great Price”
Reviews.Author: jjtdas
Reviews.Content: During our Honeymoon we stayed at 2 different hotels in Istanbul. The other was a 4 star hotel and we enjoyed our time at the Erboy much more than the more expensive hotel. The room was clean with a fantastic shower for both water pressure and temperature. Though wireless access on the second floor was a little hit or miss, you could always connect in the lobby. The breakfast buffet was really nice with a wide variety of choices. The location was excellent since it is close to the major attractions but not over crowded. Even though the hotel is non-smoking you can smell a hint of smoke, but it's not something that will disuade me from staying again. I wish we had stayed here when we returned to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: nuggetboy
Reviews.Content: I booked my 7 night stay at the Erboy based on my excellent experiences with their sister hotel, The Orient Express. This trip I needed something a little cheaper. The Erboy exceeded every expectation I had. The room was of decent size (for Europe), immaculately clean and with a modern bathroom. It was obvious that the room had been recently renovated. In addition to the outstanding cleanliness, there were several features I really appreciated. First of all, in every room I have ever had in Europe there has always been a shortage of electrical plugs. Not so at the Erboy. There were four easy to reach plugs available in the room. Second, the shower was a wand with fantastic water pressure. You could almost pressure blast the dirt off you. Finally, I really appreciated the fact that the bathroom had a window in it. I hate steaming up the hotel room. I also want to note that the hotel staff is very gracious and helpful. They simply cannot do enough for you. We had an early departure flight and they offered to make up a quick breakfast for my wife and me before our departure, two hours before they served breakfast. We declined but the offer was appreciated. As noted by so many others, the location is fantastic. Close to all the major sights, a market across the street, great restaurants all over the place, close to the tram pick up and even in walking distance of the ferry pick up. We really enjoyed our stay at the Erboy and will definitely stay there on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: dentonmike
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights on the way to Cyprus. The hotel is well positioned for the central tourist attractions in the Sultanahmet area and about 100m from the tram stop for GÃ¼lhane. EminÃ¶nÃ¼ is a short walk away for ferries and boat trips. The food and atmosphere in the restaurant is good and the prices reasonable for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great position, friendly staff and great food.”
Reviews.Author: stumpy229
Reviews.Content: Seven ladies 'of a certain age' could not have been better looked after. The hotel was in an excellent position from which to visit the historic sights. The food in the Pasazade restaurant was very good and even on our check out day the breakfast ( At 6.30) was excellent. The rooms were very clean and of a resonable size. The staff were all very friendly and we would certainly use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Warm, welcoming and excellent value in the heart of historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: maaikemaria
Reviews.Content: The hotel is all you wish when you are traveling solo, with family or with friends. There is a range of rooms available, moderately priced and very well situated on a cosy street in the centre of old Istanbul. The family- run hotel is part of a group of quality hotels. I was impressed by the warm atmosphere and the genuine commitment to make the guests feel at home. Rooms are clean; beds are comfortable; coffee and tea making machine is available in the room; and major historic (and modern attractions) at walking distance. Well connected with public transport. In spring, summer and autumn the roofterrace provides great views and creates the right atmosphere to unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeoHL
Reviews.Content: Located in heart of old city, close to everything you need to see. The hotel is very basic but very decent. Good service, staff willing to go the extra mile. Rooms are quite small and simple, but offer everything you need. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “really good accommodation”
Reviews.Author: alex-pol-elli
Reviews.Content: really nice hotel with good breakfast and very friendly staff. the location is perfect for sightseeing. we were very very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Quality and a bargain.”
Reviews.Author: feldy1983
Reviews.Content: We found the Erboy hotel after our initial hostel let us down. We were shocked at how cheap our triple room was (just over 40 euros a night). The beds were comfortable and the staff extremely helpful and not at all pushy. The breakfast buffet could have been a bit more imaginative and our triple room had a double and single bed instead of three singles but it was an absolute bargain at the price!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: aikamatkailija
Reviews.Content: The hotel Erboy was just few minutes from the main sights of Istanbul. Room was spacious (we had 3 persons room), clean and service great. Breakfast was good, fresh and plenty of selection. Special thanks to the reservations manager who offered us good&useful tips and fulfilled our every little request. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stop here, great location, staff are fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Jooliejules
Reviews.Content: First time in Istanbul for the 6 of us. The Erboy was a real find and would not hesitate to stay here again. The Staff were so friendly and Ayse the Guest Relations Manager could not have helped us more. The hotel is in an ideal location for everything. The rooms are clean although the bathrooms a little on the small side. For a great base it was ideal. To make it even better the Pasazade Resturant (No. 1 on trip advisor) is just a few stairs away. Eat here it is wonderful. The Ottoman style food is cooked beautifully and the service from all the staff was outstanding. I do have to mention Ezra, she made our dining experience charming and fun.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: moroz
Reviews.Content: The Erboy hotel was an excellent base from which to sightsee in Istanbul. The location is perfect, just a short walk to the Topkapi, Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque etc. The reception staff were the friendliest and most helpful of any we encountered in three weeks of traveling around Turkey. The room was a little small, but spotlessly clean, with fast wi-fi, tea/coffee and bottled water provided, and a comfortable bed. We have already recommended this hotel to several friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, wonderful service...”
Reviews.Author: aikaram
Reviews.Content: It is my 3rd stay at Erboy hotel. First time I have chosen this hotel for its location in historical center of Istanbul, close to the top places of interest â€“ Aya Sofia, Blue mosque, Basilica Cistern, Topkapi palace. But during my stay at the hotel I highly appreciated the hospitality of the staff. Just after arrival Ayse Sancak, the tourist guest manager, serves you an apple tea, provides you with the map of the historical part of the city, gives the information concerning the most interesting sights and advices how to get there. The room was rather small but clean and you can find all you need there, even if youâ€™d like to drink some tea. The breakfast is good enough. Two restaurants of the hotel, Pasazade and the roof top restaurant are worth to be visited: the food is tasty and the prices are reasonable. While have a dinner at the roof top restaurant you can enjoy the wonderful view. Two computers with free Internet access are available in the lobby. There is another advantage of the hotel location: the Eminonu Ferry Boat harbour, where you can take a Bosphorus or Golden Corn round trips, is within the easy walking distance from the hotel. There is an area with a lot of restaurants and gift shops around. I surely recommend Erboy hotel to all my friends who are going to visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: turkish-cypriot
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a week in Istanbul and would like to say that Hotel Erboy was one of the best hotels that i have stayed in in Istanbul. The staff were very friendly and helpful, rooms very clean and the food was excellent. This hotel is five minutes walk from Gulhane station just off the main road. Its very close to all the famous attractions and has nice panaromic view of Istanbul from its roof top restaurant. i would highly recomend this hotel and all the hotels of the Sirkeci group of hotels as this is the second time i have used this group of hotels so if you see that the hotel belongs to the Sirkeci Group than you can't go wrong. This hotel also has free internet access in the rooms and several computers downstairs in the lobby which are free for all the guests to use. The rooms also have safes which are free of charge where you can keep all your valuables safe. On a finishing note i highly recomend this hotel which i will be using the next time i am in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: sharloe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! The staff is very nice helpful and informative. The hotel is very clean, nice and it has free fast internet. Breakfast is good and the best thing of all is that it is in the middle of everything. It is a block away from the Tram (public transportation) and a walking distance from most of the top sites to visit in Istanbul. For many people the rooms are small but truly the rooms have all you need and if you are on vacations in Istanbul..you should not stay in your hotel there is a lot to see!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service like you've never seen it before”
Reviews.Author: mrmpiper15
Reviews.Content: As soon as we got there, they sat us down and asked if they could help us decide what we wanted to do while we were there. We gave us some tea and were so helpful we almost beside ourselves. Although the rooms are small they were very comfortable. The location couldn't be better. Also, we ate at about 7 different places. The hotel restaurant was the best food and service as well.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, well located”
Reviews.Author: Jim_Pickrell
Reviews.Content: At about a hundred dollars a night, the Erboy is a reasonable choice, though not the cheapest place in town. Staff are uniformly very friendly and generally speak at last some English. The location is excellent, rooms are clean, and the breakfast is a nice buffet with lots of choices which I enjoyed. From the airport I took light rail and then a streetcar to get to the hotel, and only had to walk about half a block from the Gulhane streetcar station right in front of the walls of the Topkapi palace. It's an easy walk to the spice market or Hagia Sophia or down to the waterfront to the bridge to Galata. The only downside to this location is that all the restaurants nearby are tourist places that shout at you every time you walk by and charge way too much for mediocre food. Free internet worked fine, computers available in the lobby if you don't have your own. The rooms are a little small and the bathroom small but clean. While the facilities are good it is not a social place; guests do not seem to talk to each other. Maybe it's just the days I was there. Tip: this hotel belongs to the Cirkasi chain which owns about four other hotels in the neighborhood. One of them has a pool and they might let you use it if you ask. Also, I've heard that the restaurant here is pretty good, though I only had breakfast, and ate my other meals at other local places.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice, and L3 (location, location, location)!”
Reviews.Author: K_b0y
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in a clean but rather small single room with all functioning amenities. The hotel staff spoke English (phew!) and were more than willing to help with tourist info. Located in a touristy area but can't beat the location - one block from Gulhane station and two blocks from Hagia Sophia! Would definitely stay here again if traveling solo.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect spot for a stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: PeterandPatricia
Reviews.Content: A very welcoming hotel with staff in all areas who are friendly and willing to assist....and a warm welcome from guest relations staff .Perfect location , in walking distance to major sights, transport ,etc. We stayed 5 nights and so had a free dinner and airport pickup included.......both delivered as promised. Hotel's own Airport transfers very efficient. Hearty breakfast each day; comfortable rooms and great rooftop garden with glimpses over the water and Old Istanbul. We'd stay there again for sure, and will recommend it to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Svante11
Reviews.Content: Everything very good exept that it is a little bit to easy to hear from the corridor (better door)

Reviews.Title: “good place for a meeting coupled with some sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: jef-ind
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Erboy together with several colleagues who had convirged in Istanbul for a short two-day meeting. It is located in the historic part of the city, just a block from the walls of the Topkapi Palace and 10 minutes' walk from Aya Sofya. It is in a very touristy area of town with dozens of hotels, restaurants catering to tourists, etc. Yet you can't beat the location, with an easy walk to most major sights, the tram system, the Bosphorous, etc. The rooms were small but clean and the staff were extremely accomodating. The buffet breakfast was not the best I've had in Turkey, but it was certainly adequate. The attached restaurant was very good and gave a 10% discount since we were staying in the hotel. They also had a nice meeting room. Would recommend this to anyone staying in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and everything else”
Reviews.Author: BenPhoenix01
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. The people who work here made my stay excellent. I had the internet connection problem, which turned out to be specific to my laptop. when the issue just occured, the guest relation manager, ayse was very kind and offered the best service i can only imagine. I was offered another room which is nicer cuz it is a suite, lended a laptop for me to work on. Salim helped me the whole way too. At the end, they even went extra to change the network setting and eventually made my own laptop to work. Besides the clean nice rooms, approximity to all the attractions, the people who work here is truly excellent. will come back to stay anytime i am in istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and staff - I will be back”
Reviews.Author: NaninaBG
Reviews.Content: I visited Istanbul in December 2010 and stayed at the Erboy Hotel for 4 days. My impressions of the hotel are very, very good. Before my arrival I was contacted by the e-mail by Ayse Sancak, guest relations manager of the hotel, so I was able to get all the necessary answers for preparing my trip as good as possible. I have to single out Tolga from the front office team, who is very kind, efficient and professional. The other hotel staff is also great, professional and helpful. I also benefited from the promotions offered for making a reservation via the hotel website: free transport from the Ataturk airport for 3 or more nights stay, 7% discount for paying in cash upon check in, welcome dinner for 4 or more nights stay and a family card for 10% discount in Sirkeci group. Ottoman cuisine Pasazade Restaurant in the hotel is very good, with reasonable prices and friendly staff. Room was very clean, quiet and comfortable. Nice surprise is a water boiler with a complimentary tea and coffee bags that you can prepare and enjoy quietly after an exciting sightseeing day. Room has a safe box (a laptop fits in - although I have to say I felt very safe at the hotel due to kindness and professionalism of the staff, so I didn't feel like using the safe box). Buffet breakfast is of very good quality, much better than one usualy gets in the hotels. Generally, value you get for the price at the Erboy Hotel is very good, at much higher level than in 3 star hotels. Location of the hotel is very convenient, in a quiet and safe Sirkeci area, within a few minutes walking distance from Sultanahmet Square. If you are tired to walk, from the GÃ¼lhane tram station near the hotel you can easily reach most of the interesting spots both in the Old City and BeyoÄŸlu. The EminÃ¶nÃ¼ dock for Bosporus cruising is also within walking distance or easily reachable by tram. I will definitely go back to Erboy Hotel and recommend it to friends. As a lone female traveler, I felt very safe and at home. Erboy Hotel service and staff contributed a great deal to that.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful base for visiting Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Alethea S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Erboy for 3 nights prior to traveling around Turkey. The location is perfect for exploring the city by foot or tram. The complimentary breakfast is plentiful and good quality. We also ate dinner at the hotel's restaurant one night and it was the best meal we had by far and reasonably priced as well. To save money, we were able to book a "family room" which had one double bed and two single beds and slept four adults comfortably. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone! Also I recommend using www.TurkeyTravelPlanner.com as an excellent resource as well as discounts for your travels in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in all respects”
Reviews.Author: GraceNewYorkState
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying at the Erboy for all of our 8 nights in Istanbul. We had originally planned leaving Instanbul for a day trip but enjoyed our accomodations so well that we stayed the duration there. We booked the room through the hotel which included a pick up from the airport. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location is convenient walking distance to all the major sites. The transit is located a few hundred feet away for more distant traveling. The hotel's restaurant as well as the other Sirkeci Group restaurants were fantastic. We visited 3 of them. We also took advantage of all the perks that our offered with a four night stay or more when booked through the hotel. Breakfast buffet was very good also. Overall a very comfortable stay and would definitely stay there again if in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The great reviews are legit--Erboy is a super choice!”
Reviews.Author: Ithakan
Reviews.Content: Before we went to Istanbul for a week for our anniversary, I was nervous because many of the glowing reviews of Erboy had been posted by people with only one Tripadvisor review, and I'd heard that some hotels offer their guests incentives to post positive reviews, so I wasn't sure all the hoopla was real. Well, it is. Erboy DOES NOT solicit positive reviews from their guests. When we returned home, we got a polite email from the hotel, asking about our flight and inviting us to post our opinions on Tripadvisor. There was not pressure whatsoever to make a positive comment, nor was there any incentive to be less than truthful about our stay. So here's my two cents' worth: Erboy is a great value, in an absolutely perfect location for enjoying the Old City, and every positive comment about the staff and the food at Pasazade Restaurant is right on the mark. There are plenty of reviews about room size, etc., so I'll post some less common factors: We qualified for a free shuttle and chose to use it on arrival. If for some reason your shuttle driver isn't there to meet you (this happened to us), the staff at the information kiosk just beyond the ground transportation greeting area will phone the hotel for you. Brita filtered water and the makings for tea are supplied in the room, and these were restocked each day. If you want inexpensive bottled water (or other drinks or snacks), pop across the street to Unal Market. There's also a pharmacy across the street should you need it. We had a small balcony (Room 3302) and the windows were absolutely soundproof. Although the hotel is very near several mosques, we were never disturbed by the early morning calls to prayer. We were also very near the elevator, but since we were only a couple floors up, most people used the stairs. The elevator noise could be a problem on upper floors; if you're worried about it, just ask. The staff are great! Engage the staff in your plans! Aysa and Jada were both a great resource, and in no time had us oriented to the city--and confident enough to use public bus transport for many of our excursions (an entertainment we're glad we didn't miss). Our bed was VERY firm, and instead of a full comforter or spread had only a narrow strip of decorative fabric at the foot. We found that the air conditioner/heater worked very well, so it wasn't a problem. The only downside was at times an unpleasant smell from the bath, but it wasn't bothersome enough to complain about. If we had said something, I'm sure the staff would have found some way to deal with it. I hope you have a great trip--we loved Istanbul, and we're already planning our return. (Yes, we'll be staying at Erboy.)

Reviews.Title: “Want to see most of Istanbul in short time and stay in nice place? Choose Erboy!”
Reviews.Author: Kasth0r
Reviews.Content: First, location: SIrkeci is in the very center of "everything"! Just beween Topkapi, Sultanahmet area, Grand Bazaar and pier from which you can reach more distant areas of this special city. Couldn't think of better place to see as much as possible in always too short time you have to stay here.;) Standard of the hotel is well beyond 3 (Turkish) stars. Rooms are rather small, even for European;) but assuming that you didn't come here to stay in the room they have everything traveller need. They are decently furnished, clean and well equipped (beside fridge i missed from time to time;)) One weak thing is thin walls that makes every flushing water easily hearable, like it happened in your own bathroom ;) Staff is really helpful, kind and well speaking English (regards to Ayse :))! I didnt have a single issue they wouldnt be able to solve :) To conclude: i recommend staying in this hotel to everyone that really care about seeing the city, for very reasonable price and in good atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a traveler needs”
Reviews.Author: AnirbanSen
Reviews.Content: We reached Hotel Erboy from the Istanbul Airport in the taxi they had arranged for us. Although we took a little longer to get the visa and clear immigration, they taxi they sent patiently waited the extra hour for us at the airport. Tired after our dawn flight from Delhi, we were happy to be welcomed into the hotel with apple tea. We had requested high floor in our reservation, and was given a room with a view of the Bosphorus and the Topkapi Palace (although an adjacent building's height partially blocks partial blocks the view of the Bosphorus). The service is friendly an attentive. For being given a free dinner voucher to wheelchair service (for my mother who is suffering from knee problems), they pretty much helped wherever they could. The room is a little bit small for three people, but it was warm and cosy. The bathroom is clean and looked new - although climbing into the shower's 2 feet partition can be a challenge for some. Hotel Erboy is located a block away from the tram station Gulhane, close to the Topkapi Palace. One can pretty much walk to the Sultanahmet area in one direction, or to Eminonu ferry station in the other. The alleys behind the hotel are quaint and replete with boutique restaurants and cafes. Explore the alleys a little further for cheap, good eats. The roof-top bar is not always open due to weather, but when it is, it is perfect for some wine or beer and catching up to the days activities. One can then proceed to the main restaurant at the below-lobby level. The food is good, but not great. The breakfast spread is probably the fanciest kind you would find in Turkey with a good spread. All in all, I would definitely stay in this hotel if I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “When we return to Istanbul, we're definitely booking here again!”
Reviews.Author: supadupastef
Reviews.Content: Hotel Erboy made our honeymoon in Istanbul perfect. We combed through TripAdvisor for a hotel with great reviews, good location and a fair price. Major score with this hotel! We made an online reservation via Erboy's website (www.erboyhotel.com/en/) and immediately received an email from the front desk, who assisted us with our all questions (e.g. the new public ferry schedule, exchanging money). We landed a deal for free airport pickup/transfer - vital after our 19+ hour journey. Our driver was on time, friendly, helpful and expertly whizzed through crazy traffic and pointed out sights. Also, since we booked a certain number of nights, we also enjoyed a free dinner at their PaÅŸazade Restaurant, featuring Ottoman Cuisine (mezes were scrumptious). As soon as we arrived, we were greeted with hot apple tea and presented with an orientation to the city by the super sweet Jada. She was very patient and answered all our random questions. We stayed a corner room on the 5th floor, #1507, with a gorgeous view of the Hagia Sophia and Ebusuud Cadessi. The street noise wasn't a problem and air conditioner worked very well. Ample closet and drawer space, a room safe and a welcome bottle of wine! There are two computers in the lobby, with free internet. Erboy's location couldn't be better. It's in a safe and vibrant area, with lots of eateries and shops, and a super close walk to all the beautiful sights. We can't say enough compliments about the staff - they are all stars! All this PLUS a DELICIOUS & FREE continental breakfast every morning! Fantabulous variety of fruit, breads, cheeses, cereals, sausages, etc. My favorite were the fresh honeycomb, yogurt and potatoes. There are ample tables to seat yourself. Coffee, tea and water are available. Be sure to also try the terrace restaurant at sunset. It's advisable to make a reservation the day before for the best table - request one around the perimeter to enjoy an amazing panoramic view of the city. By the way, as a guest, you'll also receive a "Sirkeci Group Family Card" with entitle you to a 10% discount to Erboy's restaurants as well a couple others at their sister hotel. We will 100% book here again when we return to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great for the money”
Reviews.Author: the_mashtons
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Erboy for 4 nights in September, and were immediately impressed by the location; within 10 minutes walking distance of the Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Basillica Cistern etc, and literally a minute from the tram stop. Staff were polite and friendly, and the hotel was clean overall. Our room was a good size with fabulous air con, although the room and bathroom could benefit from some modernisation. The breakfast selection was adequate, although the menu somewhat limited. The Erboy is by no means luxurious, although represents comfort and great value for money, and we would recommend to anyone looking for a base from which to explore the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Aleksey_Varzhel
Reviews.Content: Good location. 5 minutes on foot to the Sultanahmet square. 1 minute to the tram. The room is not big but clean and cosy. What surprised me was a ceiling. It's quite low. I could easily reach it by hand without jumping. However it looks like all buildings it that area are the same style. The breakfast is good beside one point. All types of sausage they have are just like plastic food :) All rest, especially buns and croissants, was really delicious. The staff is really hospitable ! So considering all points I would highly recommend this hotel ! PS they provided us with a free taxi from the hotel to the airport. This option is available when you stay 3 nights and more.

Reviews.Title: “Who could ask for anything more!”
Reviews.Author: DiDab
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here for a City Break in Istanbul. Fantastic location - within walking distance of all the major attractions. Staff were exceedingly helpful and approachable. Breakfast was ok, nothing special, but perfectly adequate. Would definitely return to this hotel and in fact we do intend to do so when we next go to Istanbul! Looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “This was a great place to stay.............”
Reviews.Author: nana079
Reviews.Content: We have been to Turkey a total of 5 times now and have stayed in different hotels several times. This time my husband was going to a conference in convention center north of Taxiem square. The hotel was very close to the tram line which made it easy for him to get to his meeting each day and also for me to run around town. Their english was quite adaquate for all of our questions...............The food in the restaurant was very good, more of a full meal instead of kebab and kofte.................Lots of eating options in the area also............We were on the back side of the hotel and it was very quiet...............COFFEE was GOOD!!!!!!!!!!!!!! unlike some hotels............Within walking distance of all the sites on that side of the river and also within walking distance of the water if you want to take a ferry or a boat ride. The bridge is right there if you want to walk on the other side also.............We were there for a whole week and I would definitely go back.............It was a great week....................Thanks to everyone at the Erboy..........

Reviews.Title: “Erboy Hotel - 4 star quality at a 3 star price!”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Willson
Reviews.Content: Great little place! We stayed five nights in total, found that the staff were helpful and attentive. The hotel is far enough from the mosques that we weren't woken by the morning call to prayer. Great value for the money - I would definitely stay there next time I'm in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice value - Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Vivi_y_Andres
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Erboy hotel for 3 nights (Oct 6-9 2010). The hotel location is very convenient to the major tourist/historical attractions of Istanbul's old city. You are about 5 minutes walking distance from the Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque. There is a tram station 300 ft from the hotel. We used the tram to the to and from the Ataturk airport, 6 Turkish Liras per person with 1 line transfer, not bad. The hotel staff was very welcoming and were very helpful and professional. The hotel offers free Wi-Fi and the breakfast was good overall with a reasonable selection. The restaurant was nice located on the ground floor. Unfortunately we didn't check out the rooftop bar due to bad weather. Overall this hotel is a good value, service is quite good and the rooms are basic but nice. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “A most perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: jutta_schoof
Reviews.Content: We were met by the hotel's taxi at AtatÃ¼rk Airport, taken to the hotel, checked in and were very happy with our comfortable room. The service alround was excellent: friendly and professional, and we were assisted in every way we needed. The food was also so good that we dined every night of our five-day stay in the cosy Pasazade Restaurant - apart from the first night when we dined in the terrace restaurant on top of the building with stunning views of Istanbul and the Bosphorus Bridge. The hotel was recommended to us by two sets of friends and we will definitely recommend it to other friends and we hope to be back one day!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for a few days”
Reviews.Author: toniajam
Reviews.Content: Near all the important places (Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi...) and also to the tramway (1') and ferry (Galata,5'). Good service in the hotel, which is quiet and clean. Wonderful breakfast. If you stay 4 or more nights they present you a free dinner, only paying the drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hippo04
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and got a free airport transportation. We were lucky to get a end-of-the-hall room in the new wing, which was larger than standard room. Spacious room and bathroom, also very clean. Free and good wifi reception, fridge and coffee/tea making facilities. Breakfast was ok. Staff was very nice and helpful. Location was top notch too. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: MsFancy101
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Erboy, and when we were first shown to our rooms, we were a little disappointed by how small they were. Once we'd got used to it, we noticed just how clean and well placed everything was. The staff in the hotel were friendly, helpful, and humorous; I think that's the perfect quality for people in a service industry! The setting of the hotel was also perfect; it was a lively area, and everywhere we wanted to visit was easy to get to from there. And the hotel's restaurant, Pasazade, was exceptional in every way. We were given a 'family card' which meant that we received a discount in any of the restaurants of the Sirkeci group - what a clever idea! We certainly made use of ours. One of the nights we were there, the rooftop bar was open, so we had a drink there. Lovely views from there. My only issue with the hotel was that our room was opposite the lift, and the noise of the lift being used woke me up a few times at night and in the morning. To be fair, when we complained about it, we were offered another room, but we decided to stay there as we wanted to stay on the same floor as my father. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: thompson2002
Reviews.Content: We went on a 30 day trip all throughout Europe. The Erboy was the best hotel we stayed. Friendly service, clean, great location, and very good bargain!! The restaurant on the rooftop had amazing views and we had the best food on our entire trip. We ate there twice in 4 nights, it was that good! The rooms were modern, clean, and spacious. I couldn't recommend it more highly!

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel, dunno wot all the hype is about...”
Reviews.Author: vinn_2k
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 25th and 26th september. While I must say its location is good, walking distance to Spice Market, Haga Sofia and all the souvenier shops, I got a real shock when I entered my room after a long flight from Bangalore to Bombay, Bombay to Doha, an 8 hour wait there and from Doha to Istanbul.... The room was so so tiny, it was like a matchbox. The bathroom was even worse.
