I ran down to the reception to complain and was told that he would change the room tomorrow ( I was staying for 2 nights). We were so tired, that i came back and crashed for the night! The next morning however, I checked with the reception and he told me to pack my suitcases and leave the keys and that by the time I came from the sightseeing tour, I would be transferred to my new room. To my pleasant surprise, I was transferred to a lovely room with a big spacious toilet in the new wing..... ( now i realised they have a new wing and an old wing)...... And you should make sure you get to stay in the New Wing cos the old wing is not worth more than 30 Euros a night ! Now this was worth the 86 Euros a night I paid. Breakfast was so, so, nothing great ! As I was leaving early morning by bus to Kusadasi, I left word with the reception to pack a sandwich for us the next day early morning. I checked out at 4.30 am and was pleasantly surprised to see my sandwich all ready and waiting. I tried the roof top restaurant... overpriced and very small portions.... I would you rather each at the various options available outside the Hotel. By the time I went up to the restaurant, all the good views were taken. You have to reserve your table well in advance. On the whole, for 86 Euros, I dont this this hotel was worth it ! The over enthu praises on trip advisor and the rating for this hotel is all hyped and not worth the extra praises some members have given about the Sirkeci Erboy Hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Will recommend Erboy to friends”
Reviews.Author: NeilAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Erboy is situated in the Old town Istanbul, charming cobble stone streets, all very tidy & clean. Within walking distance of the main attractions and restaurants. The staff deserve high praise, nothing is too much for them. This Hotel is very well managed. The rooms are clean although bottled water would be a nice touch. The breakfast offers a wide choice, but the breakfast room is dated and tired looking. Excellent vlaue for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating and great location!”
Reviews.Author: TutRedmond
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at this hotel. The rooms were clean, the breakfast buffet was great every morning and the concierge desk was very accomodating. I would definitely recommend this hotel to backpackers and families alike. The only downfall is the noise at night (but we went during Ramadan). They even held our extra luggage while we went away for a few days on a tour!

Reviews.Title: “The friendly and accomodating staff makes up for any amenities you may feel are missing”
Reviews.Author: Mary-EllenCallahan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 times. The location is perfect for many of what the first time traveler to Istanbul will want to see, in other words the top attractions. The staff is very friendly and helpful and all speak English. Although some of the rooms are small, I find that if you contact the hotel a week before your arrival they can make special accomodations for your comfort. AND compared to some 4-star hotels, this 3-star is a real gem and bargain.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: matkailija54
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very helpful and friendly stuff, clean quiet room, big plus for a kettle and a refrigerator in a room. Breakfast was ok but sometimes had to wait for food and clean china. In every way good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff and good value”
Reviews.Author: bassil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Erboy for four nights end of September 2010. The Hotel is in a perfection location for most of the sights in Instanbul - Grand Bazaar, Spice market, Palace, Mosques and Bosphorus River. It is also very close to the tram line. We were upgraded and our room was very spacious, had a good size bathroom and shower,and very comfortable bed. Tea and coffee facilities are there for you in the room. Breakfast was good with cereals, scrambled eggs, cold meats, and fruit and yoghart, though busy around 8.00a.m. but nothing to worry about. We had a free one way transfer from the airport to the hotel, and it only cost 20 Turish lira for a transfer to the airport when we left. We received a free dinner on our first night and was very impressed with the meal and service. There are other restaurants around the corner also with good meals. There is also free internet service. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would definitely stay at the Erboy Hotel again. Thanks Erboy Hotel for a lovely stay. - Sid and Lesley Welsh - Brisbane, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern hotel near the tourist hotspots of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Doro64
Reviews.Content: Very clean and hotel, our room has been refurbished recenty. Furniture and bathroom are very modern and clean, but the room was quite small, but we did not care about that. Breakfast-buffet was very good, even when you come later. Very good restaurant at the roof with a wonderful view to the Golden Horn and the Bosporus bridge. Extraordinary good meals. You get much value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: SCEbs
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Erboy Hotel very much. The hotel is very clean and comfortable and the staff extremely friendly and efficient. We would recommend it to all our friends who plan to travel to Istanbul. Thanks to all. Erika and Ursula, Charleston, SC

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Mohsin54792
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Istanbul, made reservation thru the net. Smooth transfer to the hotel by the hotel pick up. Nice clean room, didn't have much of view though. The bathroom was clean. The beds were good so no complaints. The location is just ideal !!! everything within walking distance. The staff very courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, good value with charming staff”
Reviews.Author: jcmt
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in September 2010. Well equipped rooms of sufficient size (probably smaller than Americans are used to)for most people. However be aware that rooms with baths require a certain amount of agility since you need to be able to raise your foot above the height of your other knee to get in. But we were switched to a room with only a shower with no problem. The staff are very helpful and friendly . Special thanks to Canberk who seemed to be on duty all the time complete with dazzling smile. Maybe it is a Turkish custom but neither bathrooms had plugs for the washbasin. Excellent breakfast with a wide range of choices. However , at rush hour (8-8.30?) the staff struggled to keep up with replenishing food and china. Note that if you arrive at the other airport (SAW) which is way out to the east on the Asian side, it may take a long time to get through the traffic (2hours in our case) and the hotel do not offer a free transfer but do discount the normal fare one way. So when weighing up the airfare from London (Easyjet v BA or Turkish) add in the cost of transfers of about Â£80. Overall a good hotel, well priced (74 euro a night for us) and excellent location (tram stop 2 mins away and main sights 5-10 mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good but rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: janetea
Reviews.Content: We liked the Erboy very much. The location is perfect - walking dostance to many of the sights and to the ferries, also very near tram stop, restaurants, shops. The views from the rooftop restaurant are amazing but it can get cool up there at this time of year. Food is good wih a pretty good selection at breakfast. and a packed restaurant every night. The front desk people are very helpful and friendly and all staff seem polite and smart. Free internet too.Towels are somewhat hard but adequate and changed daily. There is a kettle in the room and a small amount of drinking water is provided. Our view was ok. Wardrobe is big enough and there is a small dressingtable and a TV with some English programmes. I found the mattress a little hard but not too bad. Sheets are clean and the room is made up when you desire. Hwever, there is only about 35 cm at the foot of the bed to walk round and if someone is sitting on their side of the bed you cannot access the wardrobe without asking them to move. The bathroom is VERY small but perfectly clean and new looking. The shower is minute and I kept knocking my leg on the soap dispenser (take your own cake soap if you prefer that. There is notjing else given except stationery and a sewing kit). However, on balance it was good value for money and the inconveniences in the room were slight. We were there for 6 nights and were not going stir crazy!! The hoel belongs to a group of 5 and you can eat at any of the restaurants at 10% dsicount. We did this and were well impressed with the Imbat restaurant with its amazing view, indoor terrace, excellent service and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, perfect location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: BogdanGabriel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located 2 mins walk away from St Sofia mosk, right in the middle of the old city. There are parking facilities in the neighbourhood, as traffic in Istanbul can be dangerous even for the most skilled drivers foreign drivers. If you came by car, just leave it in a Otopark, because it;s safe and cheap. The hotel rooms are surprisingly spacious with all the ammenities you need. There is also a roof top restaurant which has an incredible view over this part of the city. The staff even helped us get a car to take us to the U2 concert and back. This year, Istanbul is cultural capital of the world, so you need to go and visit it now more than ever :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ednam
Reviews.Content: A whole group of us stayed at the Erboy at the end of August. We were very satisfied with the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful, it was clean and the buffet beakfast was excellent! The location, in Suthanamet, was perfect too! I would come back and recommend the hotel, which has a great price/value ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jules1210
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located and a great value for the money. The rooms are clean and modern and there is free computer access in the lobby. Of the three different hotels we stayed at during our trip, the staff at Erboy was by far the friendliest and most accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: holidaymaker_39
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Erboy for 4 nights recently. Booked directly through the hotel website and received a free transfer from the airport to the hotel and a free welcome dinner on the day of our arrival. The dinner was excellent by the way: any starter or soup plus any main dish plus any desert (one of each) from the main menu free, to pay only for drinks. People working at the hotel are very nice and helpful, when we said we wanted to go to Princes Islands they told us how to get there and even printed for us a timetable of the boats there and back. The hotel was very clean and well kept. We requested rooms in the new building of the hotel, as we like when it is new, and the rooms were spotless. Tea and coffee in the rooms were replaced every day. The location is very close to main attractions in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Bern80
Reviews.Content: The Erboy Hotel is a well-located Hotel with a great air and a dedicated staff. We have relished our stay there from starting to end and can certainly suggest it to any tourist and tourist who likes to seem protected and who appreciates a good cuisine. The Hotel is frequently utilised by SRC heritage journeys from the Netherlands and has numerous persuaded customers.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and well located”
Reviews.Author: Nina S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located in the historical center of Istambul next to many restaurants and atractions of the city. Both restaurantes of the hotel are excelent. The staff is friendly and they have a "Guest Manager" just to help you with your trips in town. They have to separe areas for the rooms: a renovated one and an old one. Be sure to ask for the renovate one where the rooms are bigger, newer and more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lain_Coubert
Reviews.Content: Loved Erboy hotel. Excellent location, very smart and clean hotel with friendly helpful staff. Room was large enough and very well maintained, decorated and all the features I require of a room/hotel were present. Enjoyed 3 days in istanbul, but was was very shocked at the cost of food and drink in Istanbul. Always check prices and do haggle in advance over everything including beer and food otherwise you will pay unneccessarily inflated prices. Shops near Erboy were selling many items at lower cost than i was able to get in the grand bazaar. again, the bazaar is spectacular, but in my opinion asking prices are about 70% above what you need to pay. Be friendly and firm and you can get what you want for a fair price. remember turkey is a poor country and their average shop/ bar worker has a 12-15 hour working day for between Â£10 and Â£20 per day wages. There is no justification for charging Â£3-Â£4 for a large beer. Final note, I didnt use a single taxi and was exceptionally impressed by the trains, trams and ferries. All were easy to use and very cheap. If i returned i would certainly stay at Erboy again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: christianguraso
Reviews.Content: We've just arrive back from a 6 evening visit and would methodically suggest this hotel. The position of the hotel was great as it is located between all the foremost enticements so we were adept to walk to most of them. Our party encompassed 3 juvenile young kids and while there were no other visitors with juvenile families, the Hotel staff were highly attentive and and very helpful, not anything was too much problem particularly where the young kids were concerned.The only thing I would state is that as the partitions are rather slim between rooms so the possibilities of their friends being adept to discover their 'little angels' joking, conversing and playing are rather high! The breakfasts were large and suggested a good kind of beef and veg dishes.The rooms were clean and whereas the bathrooms were a little little this didn't actually influence on our stay. We were not anticipating to find air trained rooms for the cost we paid so this was pleasing surprise. All in all a large hotel supplying good worth for cash with good grades of clientele care.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel in Convenient Location with Professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: AleksandarTheMacedon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Erboy in Istanbul in the first week of September 2010. I had decided to stop over in Istanbul, or Constantinople as it is known in history, on my way to Australia to have a quick look around town. My plane was late by an hour and my airport pickup arranged by the hotel was patiently waiting for me. I was promptly and safely dropped off at the hotel where the hotel reception staff greeted me and carried out their duties in the most professional and friendly manner. I have to single out Tolga (I hope I have spelt the name correctly) who went out of his way to make sure I had answers to all questions I asked and had all the necessary maps and brochures. The hotel room was clean with a very nice decor, as was the bathroom. Everything in the room functioned correctly and it was evident that the hotel made sure the amenities were well maintained. The room and bathroom were cleaned spotlessly every morning. The rooftop restaurant offered scenic views of the Topkapi Palace, The Blue Mosque, St, Sofia, The Bosphorus Bridge and Old Istanbul - pure magic at night while dining. When I needed to transfer my camera's memory photos onto a DVD the hotel staff jumped to the rescue immediately together with the delightful Ayse, the Guest Relation Manager, and the youthful trainee Jada. I enjoyed my stay at the Hotel Erboy and I was happy to see the staff went out of their way to make sure I felt at home. ps. Yes, the breakfast was lovely too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: 12345holland
Reviews.Content: Hotel Erboy, I've stayed here last week for my citytrip to visit the beatiful city Istanbul. The Hotel is located near all the sightseenings and you can visit everything from a walking distance when you stay in this hotel. The rooms are clean and the hole building looks very nice there was nothing in this hotel and the restaurant that I did noy like. Really if you visit Istanbul you should stay in this hotel! Istanbul is a great place to be the most of the people are all very friendly and polite and everything on the streets looks clean you can see that everyone loves his country. On top of the hotel there is a nice restaurant where you have a perfect view and the food there but also the breakfast taste good. My special greetings to Ali from the restaurant, and in fact all the staff from Erboy hotel are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best 3* hotel I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: Kex83
Reviews.Content: Yes! If you checked the "top value first" button and you got here then this is the top value section. This hotel really knows how to sell itself. Everything is as advertised on the site (free transfer,10% discount in restaurants, free evening meal, 7% discount if cash)( free internet, free safe-deposit-box, etc). We've stayed 7 nights in Istanbul, first timers, young couple. As we arrived we got upgraded to a superior room, free of charge! The room was very clean, the bath looked new (maybe it was, since I didn't see signs of wear and tear), very spacious, sofa was huge, a/c worked very good. Location of the hotel: Super! Not crowded as Sultanahmet, but on quiet street with lots of other hotels and few souvenirs shops. 1 minute to tram stop (Gulhane), 5 mins to Sirkeci. All the sites are around you. Staff: very welcoming, answered all of our questions. Breakfast: very nice, with lots of things! it was fullfilling, each time, 7 times. Dinner on rooftop: magnificent! awsome views. make a reservation if you find it full, like i did. I highly recomend it! I will back for some more Istanbul, and I will stay in Erboy hotel again, I wouldn't even bother to search for more. I couldn't possibly figure out why would I rate any of the categories with a 4. Everything it's a 5! You just have to go there and find out why.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: alphacentaurus
Reviews.Content: Clean, in a very convenient location, quiet, and providing a very good breakfast. Very helpful and friendly staff. I would highly recommend that hotel

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't been better in Istambul.”
Reviews.Author: Luisarenno
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended Erboy to us. But, I couldn't imagine that Erboy would be such a nice place, with such friendly people, in a excellent location in this fantastic city! Specially with the price we paid... we got an excellent deal. The room was very confortable, the breakfast amazing and the staff very kind. We loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location, superb staff, clean”
Reviews.Author: angelica46
Reviews.Content: We loved the location. Walking distance to everything in the Old City. Staff very helpful and amazing view from roof top restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “simply: splendid!”
Reviews.Author: dusan_ulaga
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in hotel, tripple room (we had even 4 beds in room). We have free transfer from airport, free welcome dinner "ala card" for all, very tasty. Room and bathroom are very clean, roomy, no view (but it is hotel in centre of the city), the airconditioning worked really well. Breakfast was delightful, the location is really ideal for visiting all the main attractions, 100 m to tram, great terrace with magnificent view and service. Special commendation to the hotel staff, they are great! I recommend this hotel to everyone, excellent value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, clean, good atmosphere and they understand your needs.”
Reviews.Author: weddingcakes
Reviews.Content: We will choose this hotel again for our next trip to Istanbul, we were offered a free evening family meal, great taste, the breakfast was delightful, the location is really ideal for visiting all the main attractions, the airconditioning worked really well, room servcie every day, excellent value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: zardoz01
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Erboy in the evening and received a room which was remarkable in that they had been able to fit a double bed and a bathroom into the space. Walls were depressingly geen. Next morning I spoke to Cigdem, one of the receptionists. She was patient, tolerant and understanding and a great ambassador for the Hotel chain (did I mention pretty?) She advised us to leave our luggage in our room after breakfast and she would arrange a room swap during the day. The breakfasts were totally adequate in the hotel and there was plenty to eat. When we got back we were in large room, with balcony. Just totally awesome. It transpires the Hotel has an old wing and a new one. The room change at no extra cost made a world of difference to us. The rooftop restaurant has great views over the old city and really makes you realise that you are in fact in Istanbul and miles from home. Another world! There are many other restaurants around the Hotel. A very nice area in the old part of Instanbul. The Hotel is, as stated by other reviewers, within easy walking distance of all the attractions and sites, close to the cheap tram and all in all the Errboy was in a great location with super friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Erboy saves the day”
Reviews.Author: Madd0g39
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 5 nights at Erboy. The location is perfect for sightseeing (2 blocks from the Hagya Sofya, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cisterns, and the tram). The rooms are clean and comfortable. Air conditioner worked great. We could hear our neighbors quite clearly, however, but not enough to bother us. Not the prettiest hotel on the block, but for the price and the convenience I'd definitely stay there again. However, I special shout out to the fantastic staff. Everyone was super helpful! They took care of all of our needs including: checking in 2 hours late at 5am due to a delayed flight; fabulous postcards; money transactions; taxi and airport transfers; and they even set me up with a trip to the only 24-hour pharmacy within 30 minutes when I came down with a bad stomach virus--calling ahead to tell the pharmicist what I had and if they could help, etc.... and they sent me up some late night yogurt and beverage to help my tummy. They were awesome! We didn't eat at the restaurant there, but the rooftop looked fantastic and I would suggest reserving a table one night just for fun. The breakfast buffet didn't wow me, but there was definitely plenty to choose from. Even in a worse case scenario, the bread and jam was very delicious. Save the money for the Bazaar and the Bath and stay here! Definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: baba666
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, fantastic restaurant, beautiful view from roof terrace restaurant, such charming staff. I thank you all to bing so kind toward my 75 years old mum. I look forward to seeing you all in the very near future. Thank you again, i wish evry membear of Erboy Hotel best of luck. From London UK (A.Aria)

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location, good hotel to rest, good breakfast, great value”
Reviews.Author: kafu123
Reviews.Content: Our flight got delayed so we sent a mail to cancel for the first night. We had no problem in changing reservation for later day, and the transfer received us in the airport. The hotel has great location, The room did not have a good view, but this was no problem since we were out most of the time and returned to sleep. clean confortable beds, quiet, good air conditining, coffee and tea in the room, . and in the morning a very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - as long as you are in the renovated section”
Reviews.Author: hastingspete
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Istanbul. The location of this hotel is dead center, a five minute walk from Topkapi, one minute to the tram, five to the train station, ten to the Spice Market. We had a blast, and this hotel was a great home base. Our first night was in an older, unrenovated room which would have earned the hotel one or two stars. We asked to be moved, and the renovated rooms were as if a different hotel, Clean, quiet, classic, pleasant. The breakfast is fine, the concierge just lovely and helpful, and the front desk helpful and pleasant. Just make sure you're in a new room (ours were on the 4th floor), or go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Memory”
Reviews.Author: scotpom
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter the air-conditioned lobby from the Istanbul heat you feel you have made the right decision about staying here. Great service,friendly staff,centrally located. Two minutes walk from tram stop and another five to ten minutes to either the mosques or the spice market etc. Metered taxis arrive within 3 minutes on demand. A 7% cash discount when settling the bill is also a big plus and to finish what a lovely rooftop restaurant with great food and great viws of the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel near Gulhane and Sultanahmet, the Tramvay etc.”
Reviews.Author: pacoMexicoCity
Reviews.Content: The Personal in Erboy Hotel very agreeable, and ipso facto to give you an answer to any request, the room bigger than the staandard size, and the atention of Ayse very very nice, thankÂ´s a lot Ayse.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: viajeravoyageuse
Reviews.Content: We were originally supposed to stay in another one of the Sirkeci Group's hotels, but there was an issue in the water, so we were upgraded to this hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly, showing us where all of the major sites were in Istanbul. They even treated us to apple tea. The hotel rooms were small, but they were neat and clean. When staying in a city like Istanbul, its really best to stay somewhere like Erboy, which may have smaller rooms, but at the same time, the location is perfect, so you can really spend time enjoying this amazing city. The breakfast buffet is quite good. The other restaurants on property are quite good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very central hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dirkie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a 200 mrs from the Galatabridge, Galatatower (super sightseeing), shoppingstreet (old tram), Taksim, Sultans palace, Topkapi, Aya Sofia, lots of moskees, boattrip on the Bosphorus (eat balik with ekmek -fish/bread under the bridge or at the boats; in the evening black market)., Sulthanamet, grand bazaar(thousands shops). 4 or 5 days you need to see everything. The hotel is in al small street. Ask to sleep so high as possible and no streetnoise. The bathroom was ok. Rooms are not so big without a freeze (airco ok). Nice cityvieuw on the rooftop (with restaurant). In Istanbul you have to stay always in the older part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A great place”
Reviews.Author: Stefano_travels
Reviews.Content: Good price, great location, good internal restaurant, beautifull bar on the terrace on the top floor, staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Really central and great service + great price”
Reviews.Author: happius
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night with my mate before going down to Cappadocia and we are certainly going to stay on the way back. Ayshe the girl in charge of Customer Service was really sweet and helpful - she booked us a taxi and showed us evrything to see on a map and even gave us adresses of good restorants even tho the hotel has its own. Breakfast was wow and the view is terrific. the hotel is right slap bang in the middle of evrything to see in Istanbul so you don't have to spend too much money on buses and things. And talking of money for a clean, functional twin room in a place reall centrally located and in July 45 EUR is an amzingly good price. We were dead chuffed. Look out Ayshe, we're coming back !

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in its price category”
Reviews.Author: boris2010
Reviews.Content: very friendly and helpfull personel ; small but tidy and clean rooms ; nice breakfast ; very recommended restaurant on the roof terrace ; value for money (we paid only â‚¬ 50 for a double room !!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Yasser1974
Reviews.Content: Just returned back from a one week trip to Istanbul with my wife. we stayed in Erboy hotel and here are my comments on this hotel and the trip: - Location : Great location with a walking distance to all attractions like Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque , Hagia Sofia, Spice Bazar and Grand Bazar. - Staff : Very nice and helpful staff , Good English which is not easy to find any many other places, special thanks to Ayse "the guest relations manager" and for Sinan "the front office supervisor" . - Room : we were able to have an early check in at the hotel and the room has a perfect location in the 4th floor overlooking the main street and nice view (room 1407) - Breakfast : rich with many kinds of cheese, cold cuts , eggs , fruits and turkish delights. - Metro : just 2 min walking from the hotel "Julhane station" . all tickets are with 1.5 TL which is almost 1 Euro. by Metor you can go to almost everywhere. - Things to do in Istanbul : Topkapi Palace (20 TL) / Harem Section (15 TL) Blue Mosque (Free) Hagia Sofia (20 TL) Dolma Pacha Palace (20 TL) Princess Island (Round Trip By Boat 6 or 8 TL) from Kabatas Ferry Boat Port you can go to this port by Metro with 1.5 TL Bosphoure Trip (Round Trip by Boat 25 TL) from Eminonou Ferry Boast Port you can go to this port by Metro after 2 stations from the hotel or 10 min walking. Food : You can have your lunch or dinner with 10 - 20 TL in a good clean restaurant Istiklal st. and Taxim st. : By Metro to kabatas station and the you have to change the metro to an underground to Taxim square. (Very nice walking specially at night with many shops and restaurants) Grand Bazar : Bargain Bargain to less than half the price :) Finally, it was a good choice to go to Istanbul and to stay in this nice Hotel. Good luck for all

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Luminita48
Reviews.Content: I returned home a week ago after spending few days at the Erboy Hotel in Istanbul. It was not my first stay there and I returned with a lot of pleasure this time with my husband. The hotel has a great location and everything is accessible on foot. The hotel staff is extremly helpfull and they arranged everything for us. My brother and my mother also stayed there and we all enjoyed it. As I was coming all the way from Canada I arranged everything in advance and the Ayse was the most wonderfull person to deal with. Not only I will return to the hotel, but I told all my friends about the amazing food and service we received. I hope to be able to go back soon as I love Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Erboy was wonderful, great value”
Reviews.Author: Mitchel31
Reviews.Content: Erboy staff very professional, very safe location, right in the ancient city where everything is fairly accessible for me as a woman with a disability. Food was wonderful! Salih is a wonderful professional and a great resource and embassador for Instanbul & Erboy Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel , friendly staff service came with a genuine smile”
Reviews.Author: sullydogg
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights couldnt fault the hotel in facilities, location or staff . True to the welcoming nature of the turkish people the staff were first class , friendly helpful and eager to please. Hotel is a short walk away from old city attractions and the city's excellent public transport system. Totally recommended

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: janellpauline
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a month while studying in Istanbul. This hotel is in a great location, central to everything and walking distance to the Grand Bazaar, Hagia Sophia, and the Blue Mosque. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The restaurant is located on a beautiful terrace with a spectacular view of the Hagia Sophia and the Golden Horn. A great experience!

Reviews.Title: “What could be better?”
Reviews.Author: Chaucer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in early July 2010. That period entitled us to one free airport transfer and one free meal at one of the hotel's restaurants. Overall, I consider this hotel to be fantastic value and possibly the best tourist class hotel in the city. After the cash-on-arrival discount, we paid about â‚¬57 per night which is an absolute bargain considering the many positive features of the place: â€¢ the hotel and room are extremely clean â€¢ all fittings are new and in good condition â€¢ strong and free WIFI in the room â€¢ TV with selection of English language channels â€¢ strong air con and strong water pressure â€¢ great location - only a few minutes walk to GÃ¼lhane tram stop. â€¢ Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and TopkapÄ± Palace are less than 10 minutes walk away. â€¢ friendly and efficient staff â€¢ the hotel restaurants are excellent and unbeatable in terms of price and service. I know visiting restaurants in a new city is one of the pleasures (pitfalls) of travelling, but if I were to go back I would have all my meals at the hotel. â€¢ the breakfast buffet was extensive and with enough variety to please most people. Some of the possible drawbacks: â€¢ the room we had was on the small side â€¢ no bar fridge in the room â€¢ there was no view from the room window (except a wall) â€¢ the decor owes more to Ikea than Ottoman heritage (I'm not suggesting they have actually used Ikea products, but I think you know the look I mean). â€¢ the bed was comfortable but the bedding consisted of one sheet and a cotton cover. In summary, if value for money and location are your priorities, then I can't see how you could do better than this hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotelâ€¦ Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: khirat
Reviews.Content: I Just completed a ten days stay at Erboy hotel, and I really can't tell how much my wife and I were pleased, it was the best decision we made by selecting this wonderfll hotel. The staff are very friendly and professional, very helpful and always ready to support you. They speak English fluently, which make it easy to communicate. Our room was small, but very clean and everything was modern, and very well designed, with built in lighting and storage. Wonderful shower with great water pressure. The breakfast buffet was also very good and rich. The location is perfect, only a short walking distance to all nice and touristic places and near many restaurants. We received a free airport transfer and dinner with our stay which was an additional bonus. Special thanks to Jamila( the lady responsible for the cleaning), very kind and friendly, our two daughter loved her and also to Aysha for her good advice and guidance

Reviews.Title: “I would rate it higher than 5 star!!!”
Reviews.Author: alefiyah
Reviews.Content: We have had an excellent week in istanbul,with a good hotel it becomes even better! the staff at erboy is great ,very approachable and always answering ur queries readily.The breakfast at erboy is a wonderful beginning to a new day...its just perfect!The guest relations manager is an asset for the hotel and she is an absolute person whom you can trust...she is great and does everything possible to help u if u r in need!! The clealinesss was also great! I would end it by saying that i just loved erboy and wld definitely go back if ever i visit Istanbul again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with super service and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Michael186643
Reviews.Content: The Erboy hotel is in a fantastic location in Istanbul. The staff from the moment you enter the hotel are very friendly and the service you receive is excellent. Nothing is a problem. Ayse the lady who takes care of advising you where to go is brilliant. She will go through the map of the best locations, and what is the best way to get there. Any question you have, she will answer. The hotel itself is very clean, breakfast was excellent and the roof-top restaurant is well worth a visit. We will certainly be returning to this hotel, because of the service and attitude of all the staff. Well done to all. Michael Roche, Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “hospitable,friendly, you feel at home”
Reviews.Author: heleen12
Reviews.Content: staff very kind and helpful, excellent breakfast, location very close to historical sites. only much noise in the evening and night, not only in but also round the hotel; good proportion price/quality

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, location and service - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Andy60763
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights on vacation. As seasoned 3-star hotel travelers in our 60s, we were very satisfied with the Erboy Hotel. The location is excellent, one block from the tram line, near many restaurants and the ferry terminal, and a short walk to the mosques and museums in Sultanahmet. We received a free airport transfer and dinner with our stay, and were met prompty at the airport by a private van. When we arrived, we were given tea, maps and an orientation by the very friendly and professional staff. Our room was in the newly renovated part of the hotel. It was very small, but everything was modern, immaculate, and very well designed, with built in lighting and storage. There was a comfortable queen bed, nightstands, a small desk and a closet. The bathroom was comfortably sized with new fixtures and a large glass-enclosed shower. The room had a floor to ceiling window opening onto a quiet street and the hotel was extremely quiet. I've attached some photos. The breakfast buffet was also very good. We didn't expect much from a free dinner, but it was excellent and we recommend the hotel restaurant for traditional, reasonably priced, dishes. The hotel staff was very helpful with restaurant reservations, arranging transportation, and advice. The hotel was an excellent base for sightseeing and we found it very comfortable and convenient. It was a terrific value and we'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Excellent location,staff...”
Reviews.Author: members2
Reviews.Content: . The previous reviews say it all. There is nothing I would change. Location is brillant, the hotel restaurant was very good. Rooms are very clean. The shower was a delight - lots of water in a newly refurbished bathroom. The room was equipped with a small kettle for making coffee or tea (supplied). This was a surprise as no other hotel in the other regions we visited offered this. Within walking distance of almost every memorable sight.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, cozy, confortable, luxurious, friendly, cheap, perfect,....stay in the very center of Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: coolwhiskey
Reviews.Content: There's anything else to say about Erboy Hotel than perfect!!! I had a better experience than my previous stay in a four star ugly expensive hotel!!! Just ask me whatever and I'll answer you immediately. Cheap, good breakfast, new structure, nice, wide enough and cozy rooms, clean, friendly, very well located, 4 star services, one free dinner and one free transportation from the airport included in the web offer reservation, 10% discount in some very good and nice restaurants around the hotel...what else...really nice... If they cannot provide you something, I'm sure they'll get it for you somehow; If you need or want something just ask them, they'll manage for you! I had a really nice experience from the beginning, since the web reservation I had the best connection and comunication, untill I left. Thanks so much to all the kind staff (everyone) and thanks to the very nice and sweet Ayse SANCAK, the best Guest Relation Manager you can desire.... I really planned to write many positive things about Erboy....but now that's it...for anything else, just e-mail me!

Reviews.Title: “The Ideal Place”
Reviews.Author: dms52
Reviews.Content: We first started staying at the Erboy in 2004. Every year they seem to get better - always upgrading lobby and rooms. We find the staff very friendly, especially Ayshe who is always smiling and very helpful with any questions or needed information. Great breakfast downstairs and the roof top terrace has a wonderful view. The location is an easy walk to any of the major attractions. We look forward to staying at the Erboy again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “We have stayed at Erboy hotel 3 times, great location, very good value, helpful staff, good breakfast, worth trying out.”
Reviews.Author: gld52
Reviews.Content: We keep coming back to Erboy because it provides what we are looking for when we stay for a long weekend in Istanbul. There is now a new section with clean rooms, comfortable beds, good hot showers and wireless connection. Even with new trendy hotels springing up in the area, the value at Eroby is still hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent clean friendly hotel, good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: George43London
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from Istanbul and during our visit we stayed at the Erboy Hotel. The hotel is in a great location to visit Topkaki Palace, as well as the Blue Mosque and Ayasofia. Additionally, you are close enough to the ports and the Grand and Spice Bazaars. The hotel was very clean and tidy and our room was made up every day to an excellent standard. The breakfast was fine and a great choice of food made available to us. The staff were very courteous and helpful and were always available to provide you with assistance. As a bonus we were given a free meal at their quality restaurant and a curtesy taxi back to the airport for our departure - we did stay 5 nights, so please check with the hotel first if this offer is available to you. Finally, we were also offered a 7% discount on our hotel bill if we paid in cash (Turkish liras, Euros, Dollars or Sterling all accepted). Overall, we are considering visiting Istanbul again in the near future and we will have no hesitation in staying at this hotel again. We were surprised to see the hotel only rated at No. 50 on Trip Advisor, as it should have been much higher. Book with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Open and friendly staff, good service, excellent breakfasts, clean room, excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Tudhaliya
Reviews.Content: We were greeted on arrival at the airport with our promt hotel transfer, and again greeted at the hotel by the warm and welcoming Guest's Advisor, and given a brief overview of Istanbul with a map to keep and apple tea to drink, plus a complimentary ticket for an evening meal. The room was spacious, cleaned every day to excellent standard, and all the staff showed a willingness to help and accommodate. The hotel is situated right near the Old City, with Topkapi Sarayi,Hayia Sofia Sultanahmet Camii, the Grand Bazaar and the Sopice market all in easy walking distance, or with the Tramvay (GÃ¼lhane Istasyon} a minute away to wisk you to all of the above or across the Galata Bridge. Humour and goodwill typified the dealings of the staff, and the restaurant was good value, but if you wanted to stray, you were in the midst of the restaurant district. Every morning there was a bulletin which gave ideas to of places to visit for the day, as well as facts about Turkey and its culture. Top rate experience: we will be coming back to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: MrsGark
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Erboy very much. The location is so good - very close to the key sites like Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazar. Tram stop at the end of the street and in easy walking distance of the ferries. Helpful, friendly staff. Comfortable room. Nice roof top bar/restaurant. Loads of other bars and restaurants in immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “A smart and nice choice for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SerjK
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights with my wife and my 6 years son. The location is great, in Sirkeci, in an area of hotels, restaurants and very close to the most important places of Istanbul: Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Underground Cistern, Blue Mosque, Eminomu, etc. Very good and rich buffet breakfast (even if it was the same in every day). Some rooms are bigger than others (I had a bigger one), however we could say that the rooms are small, but enough. The staff is very nice and helpfull and they all speak great english. They installed an extra bed (free) in minutes when they saw that I have my boy with me. The wi fi worked great in my room and in all areas. Booking directly on their website brings a 7% discount for cash payments. Therefore I paid only 64 EUR/night and I was at point zero of Istanbul. www.erboyhotel.com

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Tashalina
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. Location is fantastic, staff are wonderful, this was the best breakfast I've ever had in a hotel. Our room was newly refitted, quiet, clean and large. Hotel restaurant is also fabulous, one of the nicest meals we had in the city. Book direct on their website and pay in cash to get 7% discount. We stayed for 4 nights and got free shuttle from airport (one way) and free first night meal. Going back we got tram and metro to airport. Its really quick, clean, cheap and easy. I'd recommend it rather than pay for shuttle or taxi as driving and traffic there is awful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: VadimL
Reviews.Content: Very nice and helpful personal. Good English.Real breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Doortje75
Reviews.Content: My parents recommended this hotel to me. I was pleasantly surprised by the hotels offer to send a driver to pick us up from the airport, by the friendly helpful staff, by the cleanliness of the room, by the view from the terrace at the roof, by the breakfast, by the great location of the hotel etc. etc. If I will visit Istanbul again some time, I would like to stay in Erboy Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NataliyaM
Reviews.Content: We have visited Istanbul a family and remained are very happy with hospitality of hotel. Its site in a city and as service and a food have pleased))) With great pleasure we will return here also we will advise to the friends the hotel grown fond to us!

Reviews.Title: “great friendly hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: gunnibag
Reviews.Content: The hotel arranged pick-up from the airport, and our driver was really friendly and kind. We were stuck in peak hour traffic as our flight was delayed so it took as over two hours, but didn't mind as we had a great chat to him about the city and it's people. He even bought us some food on the way! Check-in was easy and the apple tea much appreciated. The room and bathroom was on the small side, but very clean and adequate. We even got a complimentary bottle of wine! And as part of our stay we also had a complimentary meal at the hotel restaurant which was excellent. The breakfast was the same everyday but there was a good selection. Location was also good, handy to all the sights. The roof terrace restaurant was closed, but we sneaked up there and enjoyed the view while sipping wine. I highly recommend this hotel, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “For the price paid good value and superbly located - Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: EssexPalin
Reviews.Content: Not a plush hotel but didnt expect it to be, for price is good value and superbly located (dont think it could be better located? Under 10mins walk to all main sights and port, tram stop 1min away if you need it). Helpful staff and good breakfast with supplies rapidly replaced when they run out. Free wif-fi. Rooms small-ish and some facilities showing slight signs of age but again reflected in price and is a city centre hotel so you dont expect massive plush rooms. Rooms double glazed so street noise is at a minimum. Only minor fault I could find is that I personally found the beds very firm and aircon a bit noisey. Will return and recommend to others for sure! Tip: Biggest bargain has to be the public service boats that sail every 15-30mins from Europe to Asia side. About 45-60mins round trip (if you stay onboard) and only 1.50TL about 0.65GBP!!!! Very enjoyable ride.

Reviews.Title: “Best hollydays!”
Reviews.Author: umec
Reviews.Content: Hotel is the best and we recommanded it for all our friends. Breakfests are delicious.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: czarmanee
Reviews.Content: We got back from a 7-day holiday in Istanbul about 3 weeks ago but still talk about this wonderful city till this very day. We chose Erboy Hotel simply based on the positive TA reviews and true enough,it did not disappoint. Our flight into IST touched-down at 6.00 in the morning and naturally i was skeptical if the hotel would actually send someone to pick us up at the airport like they have advertised on their website. The guy was there alright, so far so good. Checking-in was quick and we were given our room immediately. Location of this hotel is just perfect. Very near to the sights,shops, restaurants, tram-line, piers and all the must-visit places..all within walking distance.As others have mentioned, the room size is small, so too is the bathroom. Anyway, it doesn't bother us as we are out most of the time. More importantly, the room and bathroom were kept tidy and clean whenever we got back to the hotel later in the day. Breakfast spread was good, fresh and plentiful but they dished out the same thing every morning so you tend to get bored after the 3rd day or so. Anyway, you can always grab something else to eat at almost every street in Istanbul. We find the hotel staff, especially at the front office, friendly, efficient and are more than willing to help us out with our daily itinerary and special thanks to Cigdem and Sinan for making our stay at Erboy a memorable one. We truly find Istanbul a wonderful holiday destination, lots of things to see and do...so 7 days in Istanbul is just about right. What else can i say about Istanbul other than...simply magical.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff, rooms, breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: jolenejentilly
Reviews.Content: Great location on a quiet street. Friendly staff. Recently renovated, so while small, rooms are tasteful. Breakfast was big and full of variety. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: GWCandMLC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed for 4 nights in this hotel as part of a city break in Istanbul. The location of the hotel is excellent being within a short walking distance of many of the main attractions, the Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, museums etc. The hotel has been upgraded recently and the rooms were clean and spacious, the en-suite bathroom was very good and everything worked. The staff are friendly and helpful with advice about local facilities, travel etc and even have a daily news sheet on what is going on and what is closed. We were on the bed & breakfast tariff and the breakfast in the hotel is excellent with a very wide selection of hot and cold options. We ate twice in the hotel restaurant, Pasazade, which serves a varied range of turkish cuisine. Although we ate at two other restaurants, this was the best and also very good value. In summary this is a very good hotel, excellent value for money and a great base in which to explore Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel !”
Reviews.Author: MDetollenaere
Reviews.Content: Verry good hotel. The modern rooms are good equiped and verry clean. The breakfast was verry good with a big choice. The staff is verry friendly and helpful. You can't have a better location as this, near the Topkapi palace. For us, this was not a 3 stars hotel but certainly 4 stars. This was for us the best hotel that we had for his price. Many thanks to Ayse and all the other people.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LindaPeek
Reviews.Content: I came here for the second time (first time in May 2008) and it was again very nice. The staff was friendly, the hotel clean, breakfast ok and the location super.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Hotel 5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: peterj2010
Reviews.Content: Reading through the previous reviewers comments I can only continue on the same theme. This is not only an excellent value hotel for the prices charged, but one that is made exceptional by the care and service of the staff. We booked originally through Expedia and because it was our wedding anniversary I asked the hotel directly for champagne and flowers to be in the room. We unfortunately had to cancel due to the Volcanic ash flight ban on the night before travelling. The Erboy agreed to waive their late cancelation fee. We then tried to book again through Expedia for the resheduled flight 4 days later but there was apparently no room at the Erboy. I however used the hotel's website where I was able to book for the required dates. Not only is this worth knowing if you want to book the Erboy, but, as others have stated the first night's dinner was complimentary - and it is was well received. (Also, if you pay cash for your booking when you arrive they give you a 7% discount on the room booking). Anyway, having booked the room, and rebooked the champagne and flowers with Ayse (the excellent guest relations manager) we were forced to cancel again when it was apparent that the airban was unlikely to be lifted. Again, we were not charged. Remarkably, the ban was lifted and I rebooked for the 3rd time, 4 hours before our actual departure! I didn't reorder the flowers & champagne as our anniversary had passed and I was giving the hotel no notice. When we arrived (after travelling by taxi in a very busy Istanbul - the streets are manic and the driving is atrocious!), we were greeted by the very pleasant hotel manager who was as pleased to see us as we were to be there. The hot apple tea we were given on arrival has now become a favourite of mine. The room was probably one of the the better ones in the hotel. It is not luxury but it is certainly excellent value especially for Istanbul. We went out for our first walk through the bazaars and when we came back the room had a lovely bouquet of flowers and champagne on ice (and a few other nice personal touches that were certainly gratefully appreciated). The complimentary meal in the evening was very nice and we booked the following night in the sister hotel restaurant Imbat. There, we also had a very pleasant meal, although we did wait some time for the sweet menu - the reason being, was that they had prepared a lovely surprise sparkling cake and announced to the restaurant that it was our 25th anniversary to applause - another very nice touch that made it a very special evening. These are just examples that highlight that service is the key differentiator that makes this hotel the one to choose if you want a good value 3 star hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with fantastic, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Harrowian
Reviews.Content: Apologies if this is a bit long but.... We originally stayed for 5 nights but came back for 7 more after the volcanic ash disruption. As part of a promotion (free one-way transfer, one dinner at the hotelâ€™s restaurant , a discount for cash and 10% off in any of the hotel chainâ€™s restaurants) we were transferred from the airport when we first arrived in Istanbul. This was quick and comfortable. When we got to the hotel, we were offered apple tea which was very welcome and, after our travels, very much appreciated. During our two stays we experienced three different double rooms. The first was fairly small, in line, I understand, with other hotels in Istanbul. I was woken up by noise from one of the lifts and asked if we could change rooms. Without hesitation, they said we could and asked us to pack up our belongings and leave the bags in the room when we went out. When we returned from being tourists for the day, our bags had been transferred to the other room. We had, in fact, been upgraded to one of the largest rooms. We really liked this room which appeared to have been recently renovated. There was a small LCD TV with 5 English channels (3 news and two movies). The bathroom was a good size though the lighting in it could have been better. Having completed our holiday we went to the airport. Our flight was the first one to London to be cancelled because of the volcanic ash cloud. The airline took us to a 5-star hotel which we disliked because of its location outside Istanbul and its terrible service. We put up with it for 2 nights and then went back to the Erboy until we could fly back a week later. There were many people stranded by the air travel chaos but the Erboy, to its credit, did not try to exploit people by raising its prices. When we arrived, we were again given apple tea and they reminded us (without any prompting from us) that we were again eligible for the free dinner. On this occasion we again had one of the recently renovated rooms which was of a good size. We felt lucky to get a room at the Erboy which seemed to be filling up with people stranded by the ash cloud chaos. The staff are excellent and it is the service which really impressed us. I would particularly compliment Ayse (pron: eye shay), the Customer Relations Manger and Sinan at the front desk both of whom treated us very well, more like friends than customers. We decided to wait out the airline problems but I saw Ayse spending a lot of time helping others with travel arrangements. The other staff were also very good and by the time we left we were happily joking around with them. When we did leave, Ayse and others came outside and saw us off (and that is definitely a first in my experience of hotels!). When we arrived the second time, we asked Ayse for tea cups. We received these within minutes. However â€“ and this is what set the service here apart â€“ we also received plates and full sets of cutlery without us even asking! The location of the Erboy is excellent â€“ very close to a Tram stop and a gentle slope between the two. It is also only about 5 minutes walk to St. Sophia and the Blue Mosque and in a quieter area than touristy Sultanahmet. Not once did the azan (call to prayer) wake me up. Breakfast was plentiful and there was a wide range of food. It did not change much from day to day but we did not find this to be a problem given the range of food available. The hotel restaurant (Pasazade) was very good and reasonably priced. To summarise, it was the outstanding service and thoughtfulness (particularly when we were stranded in Istanbul) that really impressed us. Would I recommend the Erboy? If you want a nice clean, good value hotel without extravagance, in a very good location â€“ I would absolutely recommend the Erboy without hesitation. We would happily stay here again and look forward to doing so.

Reviews.Title: “'' Better hospitality than the Erboy hotel we couldn't wish''”
Reviews.Author: mayrinka
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in Istanbul we stayed first in the Ilkay Hotel. This Hotel and the Erboy hotel are in a same group called ''Sirkeci Group Hotels''. We enjoyed both of hotels and it was provide of a excellent way of hospitality. During our trip there was the Iceland vulcano erruption that made us being stuck in Istanbul. During this time the staff did a lot for us to find any possibillities during the stay. I would like to thanks everyone from the stuff and in these hotels i found the best hosipitality we could get.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for better”
Reviews.Author: broadstep
Reviews.Content: We arrived a day before the volcano erupted, for a 1 week stay. Like most people we thought the problem would be short lived. When it became apparent that things were very serious we greatly appreciated the free internet access for guests and the satellite TV was a great help . The staff couldn't have been more helpful. In the end we were fortunate and managed to travel home on our original date. The Hotel has just undergone a renovation programme and the bedrooms and bathrooms are very modern and clean. We had a very spacious room. When you arrive you will be given a card, which entitles you to 10% discount at any of the restaurants in the 4 other hotels in the chain. The food is wonderful and service excellent. The house red wine is extremely drinkable!! We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. One word of warning -- Sabiha Gocken airport is horrendously expensive. DO NOT rely on duty free here, cheaper in the UK. Food and drinks there also vastly overpriced. Don't know about Ataturk.

Reviews.Title: “balance of price and quality is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: christa-wim
Reviews.Content: I adm very happy to have chosen this hotel! I told the staff i had a health problem and the gave me a new room with a brand new bed! I had wonderful nights after the long walks during the day. Meals were ok, breakfast too. The food is local but there is enough choice for everybody. I should recommend this hotel to everybody who is not looking for "luxury, but a pleasant , good-priced hotel with a splendid location, near a tramstation, very central of every interested place! thanks to the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean and safe”
Reviews.Author: ninakukka
Reviews.Content: This hotel I'm surely going to return to. Could not think about a better location than as a neighbour of the Topkapi palace and with a short walking distance to Hagia Sofia, the Blue Mosque, the Spice Bazar and the ferries. And tto the tramway stop Gulhane you walk just in 2 minutes. The interior of the the hotel in nothing fancy but it is very clean and quiet with a view over to the governor's yard. As I booked my room for 5 nights directly through the hotels home pages I got a free shuttle from the Ataturk airport and a free dinner at Erboy's very good restaurant at my first evening. Perfect sercvice. The roof restaurant wasn't yet opened unfortunately because of the early and cold spring days. But I had i look and the views over the ahrbour and the old city are phenomenal!

Reviews.Title: “Staff are friendly and helpful making it a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: canbec
Reviews.Content: Great location for seeing all the major sites, clean, comfortable, all in all, great value. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, one to remember”
Reviews.Author: worteltje
Reviews.Content: We, me and my to kids from 12 and 15 years, stayed here for 8 days. Each morning we had a fine breakfast with plenty of choices. Everything was nice and clean. Each evening when we dame back, our room was very nice cleaned. A pleace to come back !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and very good hotel with super location”
Reviews.Author: HappyGuestsStockholm
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife travelled with some friends to Istanbul staying 4 nights at Erboy. We all found the hotel very nice with friendly personnel and nice rooms. The only comment on the room in the new part of the building would be better lighting over the mirror in the bathroom and more and bigger hooks for towels. Breakfast very good and restaurant for dinner very good. Location of hotel was super - close to all major attractions - walking distance and also with the tram station just close to the hotel. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and good hospitality”
Reviews.Author: andredidi
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Erboy with our family (2 parents and 4 children) and we had a good time. Breakfast was plentiful in a nice surrounding. Not too busy street and lots of restaurants and shops on walking distance. All the the touristic highlights are also at walking distance. If you go to Istanbul, you should stay at the Erboy. Good balance between price and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good price and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: SergioBilbao
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if you want to spend several days in Istanbul for sightseeing. It is located in the area of Sultanhamet, within 5 minutes walking distance to Topkap Palace, Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. The area is very safe and quiet. The service is excellent, all the staff are very attentive and wiling to help. Breakfast is good although lack variety of fruits.

Reviews.Title: “An easy stay that allowed us to focus on the sights of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Hinchleywoodlander
Reviews.Content: A very welcoming and helpful team made us feel at home. The location was excellent and close to all the main attractions. Our room, overlooking a quiet sidestreet, was new/newly refurbished, and was kept very clean. The food (vegetarian) was good. There was a willingness by staff to help out with any about-town difficulties (eg transport, opening times, etc.) Occasional 'slip-ups' (eg overlooked in the in-house restaurant) were more than compensated by a determination to make up for them. Overall the hotel provided excellent value for money. We hope to visit again and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “clean, friendly hotel which offers value for money”
Reviews.Author: KipperEpsom
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was excellent and close to all the main attractions. The room we were given was new, very clean and overlooked a quiet street. The food was good and overall provided excellent value for money. We would definitely stay again and would recommend hotel Erboy to others as a first choice hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “An ideal hotel for easy access to the important sites in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: EnglandBookworm
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel, the staff were very welcoming. The hotel is situated in a very convienient location within easy reach of Topkapi Palace, The Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar. The restaurant downstairs had a good range of food (I am vegetarian) well prepared and served by pleasant and interesting staff.We would definitely recommend it and have already done so to a friend who may travel to Istanbul later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, helpfull staff and well maintenced hotel in the old city center”
Reviews.Author: kkhhcc
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel near the ancient monuments and musea and on a walking distance of the several bazaars and the galatabridge to the "new" part of town. Rooms were recently painted and refreshed and currently they were doing still some renovations. The staff was very helpfull: exchanging money without commission, a thee on arrival, toeristic information on the opening/closing times/days of the most importent sites during our stay. Some suggestions about restaurants in the area with typically food and fair prices. The hotel is part of a small group with a few restaurants and hotels in the area. >On arrival you get a discount card for all these restaurants and a guide with info about these and other restaurants and if you show this book in one of these restaurants you even get some extras.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: wazza2904 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This is what this type of tourist hotel should be guest relations are superb and rooms are comfortable, bathrooms a little on the small side but very clean. Breakfast was very good. Winter bargain rates are outstanding

Reviews.Title: “Best location top hotel”
Reviews.Author: emrahpiro
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Erboy hotel and what a great hotel it was. The location was excellent it was near all the historical places of town and it was also a 2 min walk from the tram stop which links you to all the main places of istanbul!! The breakfast was great and rooms were very clean. overall a fantastic place

Reviews.Title: “Five days in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Anatidae
Reviews.Content: The staff was always friendly and ready to help. The rooms werd well maintained and very clean, with the standard comfort. The hotel is situated on a top location, at walking distance of the most important historic monuments in the old town. It was the third time we went to Istanbul and the best hotel of the three hotels we stayed in. If we return to Istanbul, we would without hesitation choose to go back to the Erboy Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: RYousaf
Reviews.Content: I travelled here in July 2009 with some friends and it was the reviews on tripadvisor which helped decide on choice of hotel. I am relieved I did base my decision on the reviews I had read. It is a friendly hotel and was tailored to our needs. The staff were very useful in directing us to the sights and how to get there. When we first arrived our triple room was VERY small and we asked if we could change to a more spacious triple room and the hotel was more than willing to change rooms for us, very accommodating. Rooms were clean and well kept. The hotel provides free internet with computers provided. Only down side I can think of was the breakfast, I got tired of the same breakfast each morning but kept me going for few days. It was within walking distance to the Topkapi Palace, Ayasofya (Hagia Sophia), Sultanahmet (Blue) Mosque which I was very pleased about and even more pleased how close it was to the Grand Bazaar. The tramway stops are again within walking distance. Everything is near including the harbour for sightseeing cruises. And still the hotel itself is in a quiet street. Overall location was ideal. To summarise Erboy hotel met my expectations in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: hanisze
Reviews.Content: We were at Erboy for 2 nights in January and enjoyed our stay there thoroughly. The hotel is about 30 minutes drive from the Atartuk Airport by taxi (costs about TLR35-40). Many good things have been said about this hotel and we could not agree more with what has been written. This is certainly a hotel for all visitors who wish to stay in the central of Istanbulâ€™s attractions without spending too much on their accommodation. The rate is very reasonable for its standard, with breakfast included. The room is of reasonable size by European standard and you can get free wifi in the room with your own laptop, hairdryer, air-condition, central heating and a flat screen TV. Our double bed was very comfortable and most importantly, the hot water in the room was strong and the room is clean. Another selling point of the hotel is no doubt its strategic location â€“ it is only a 5-minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia Museum, the Undergound Cistern, Topkapi Palace and the Hippodrome. The hotel is also about 100 metres away from the tram station of Gulhane and you can take a tram from there all the way across Galata Bridge to Kabatas and then change to take the funicular to Taksim and experience the night life of Istanbul at the very lively Istiklal Avenue. There are also many restaurants and shops around the vicinity of the hotel and we were spoilt for choices! We would strongly recommend this hotel to visitors who do not wish to splash a fortune on their accommodation in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again. The best option for its price”
Reviews.Author: VeryFreqTraveller
Reviews.Content: Really good location, nice breakfast, helpful staff, clean throughout, fairly small room but large compared to NYC and London hotel rooms, good restaurant (try the lamb stuffed with pistachios), they offered free airport pick-up and a free 3-course dinner for two people because we stayed more than 5 nights..... couldn't expect more from a 3* hotel. Would definitely stay there again. I highly recommend Erboy hotel

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul's best situated value 3* hotel”
Reviews.Author: greywanderer2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times with small group tours (they do not take large groups), and with my partner, many times. It is hard to find a better value, 3* hotel in Istanbul which is equi-distant from the main sites in Sultanahmet like Aya Sofya, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace, and the waterfront ferry area; it is only a couple of mintues to the tramway enabling visitors to explore further afield. The rooms vary in size slightly; but none is small. The hotel is well maintained, clean and comfortable. Rooms are refurbished regularly, particularly bathrooms. In a city centre it's hard to find quiet rooms, but these are well insulated from any street noise (quiet at night) The breakfast buffet is 4* with a wide choice of cold dishes; and some hot; fresh , quality ingredients are used. The small bar area offers Happy Hour drinks and snacks. The Pashazhade Restaurant offers an imaginative and varied Ottoman style menu, and the service is excellent. The staff generally are professional and customer service is uppermost; many of the staff have been there many years, testimony to the owner's ability to train and look after his staff making sure every customer is a person and not just a number as in chain hotels. They know their city and are happy to advise, organise visits, restaurants, book tickets, arrange transfers etc.. After Sultanahmet, the Sirkeci area is a thriving place to be, with its many restaurants, shops and local entertainment., all thanks to the rejuvenating effect and success of the Sirkeci Group of Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: tripplanner4Chicago
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay to be within walking distance of all the major historical sites in Istanbul. It is also surrounded by excellent restaurants and one of the best is right in the hotel. It is a quick walk to the bazaars and train station. The tram is also very close by and you can walk to the port and catch the ferry. The rooms are clean, quiet and about standard size for Europe. The neighborhood is safe and the staff are extremely helpful with all details and excursion planning. One of our bags came late and the hotel picked it up from the airport and delivered it to our room. What a great surprise. The hotel is linked to 5 others and we were given a discount card that we could use at the related restaurants. We found this hotel on trip advisor and were not disappointed. Have fun in this beautiful and modern city!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Deodatienne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Erboy hotel twice in 2009 (september and december), and we will be back in 2010. The hotel is well situated on a quiet street, near to the historical centre. The staff were very efficient, friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC - Nothing too much trouble; will be returning again for sure!”
Reviews.Author: phoenixhull
Reviews.Content: This is my third visit to this interesting city in two years. During my last visit I stayed in one of the new breed of "boutique" hotels; forget it. I TRULY suggest you be a guest of Erboy. The breakfasts are of the best quality and there is plenty of it too, not rubbish food either! Do visit as soon as you can before the city prices rise further (it's still good value there now) because of the 2010 status "city of culture". My friend had booked us a double room for neglecting to state we were just 2 female "friends", so a double bed had been allocated. As soon as the receptionist saw us he asked if we would prefer to swop it for a twin without us even having to ask. The en-suites are very good, showers that actually work and hairdryers too. Comfy beds and clean pillows even. Everything is within a short walk from the hotel and there is no need to ever use a taxi. Even the feri-boats connecting east to west (Europe to Asia) are a short walk away. Atatrk Int. is the closest airport to Istanbul but if you fly into the Sab. Go. airport which is well outside Istanbul (but easyjet, so cheaper) it is still easy to reach the hotel for total of 3 turkish liras (Â£1.30p) by using public transport. Leave a/port, jump on local bus just outside signed to "Karakoy" pay fare of 1.5 liras. Leave bus at terminus at Karakoy. Hop off bus and straight onto ferryboat to "Eminonu" fare 1.5 liras.These both run so frequently that there is no need to consult a timetable. Leave ferryboat and walk 10 mins(if you don't know the area then follow the tram lines up from the normal train main station) to hotel or if lazy get the local tram for one stop only! 2 mins maximum walk from tram stop,named "Gulhame", and you are inside Erboys' welcoming reception. Go tomorrow! Don't bother with the main normal trains in Istanbul, or Turkey in general, as they are not much use at all and it is easy to get anywhere using public buses etc. Last year I began in Istanbul (solo 64 yr old female) and backpacked for 7 weeks covering Ankara, Antalya, Adana, Antakya, Cappadocia, Goreme (not to be missed) etc.etc. and even when I was very close to the borders of Syria and Iran I felt safe. Just remember basic common sense.

Reviews.Title: “good internet site with deals;great location,healthy food;good value!”
Reviews.Author: Badbones
Reviews.Content: In an Istanbul that increases in price every day, the Erboy is one of the REAL bargains that remain there. Some of the backpackers have increased their prices for rooms that are simply not up to it anymore; which forces lone travellers to look elsewhere...and a good alternative is the Erboy. Have a look at their easy to navigate site for deals.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Betta-Milano
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel to everybody! Location is absolutely great, you can go by feet to visit all the most important monuments (Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Aghia Sophia are less than 3 minutes away), and there is a tram stop very close by. Rooms are note huge, but they are clean and quite (no problems with the Muezzin at 5 o' clock in the morning from the Mosque), breakfast is very good and included in rates, but what I would like to point out is the service. Absolutely outstanding! We had a 3 nights stay, and got the transfer from the airport by car free. When we arrived at the hotel, a very nice girl (the guest relations manager) offered us a cup of tea (elma chai, the apple tea you will find everywhere in Istanbul) and explained us where we were, where to go, what to see, where to eat... It was the first time! she has been so nice and helpful I really want to thank her! Last but not least, the rate was incredibly affordable! If you are planning a trip to Istanbul, consider the Erboy hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, near to all attractions”
Reviews.Author: AnnarellaTurin
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the staying. The hotel is in a wonderful location, near to all main attraction, clean, wonderful staff always ready to help. Great breakfast, lovely to have free wifi in the hall. really enjoyed it

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, above all the staff.”
Reviews.Author: muschio
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. The staff is professional and friendly. The two restaurants serve excellent ottoman food.
