The location is at a walk distance from the main attractions, tram stops and boarding piers. There is a free internet point. The view from the terrace restaurant is wonderful, especially at night. Grandparents were enthusiastic too. The only half-negative aspect is the small size of the bedrooms, but they are clean and silent.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and attentive staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: Panteleon Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We were greeted with tea and an introduction to the main sites of Istanbul which set the tone of an enjoyable stay. staff were always friendly and helpful. room cleaned daily to high standard. Breakfast more than adequate. Location is off the main road and there was no significant traffic noise. The main sites, Agia Sophia etc only a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: GloucestershireHejo
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely friendly hotel close to all main attractions in Istanbul. The breakfast is brilliant and we did not eat again until evening. The hotel restaurant in the evening served really good food at great prices including the wine. Unfortunately on our last day my mother slipped and broke her arm. The hotel recommended which hospital we should visit and without being requested to organised a taxi to take us there. All in all a real find, who cares if the rooms are a little on the small side, they were always spotless and when in Istanbul one does not stay in ones room! Would definately recommend this lovely hotel. Congratulations to all the staff who run it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Gurumai
Reviews.Content: Reviews were good, but one never knows for sure. Location was excellent close to transportation, nice area. Convenience market across the street, good restaurants in hotel. Walking distance from Topkapi Museum, Haya Sofia, Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar. Roof top restaurants have a fantastic view of Topkapi,Haya sofia lighted are night also the bridge that unites European Istanbul and Asian Istanbul. Only drawback was air conditioner in room did not work well and we have a couple of hot days. But definitely recommend and go back to Erboy Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in heart of historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: sydneybee
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, the staff very helpful and the room serviced to a high standard daily. The buffet breakfast was varied and catered for all. All the big attractions were within walking distance from the hotel as was the tram stop and the harbour for boats to Asia. My only negative thoughts are that there was no kettle in the room and that towels were always replaced daily rather than when the guest decided they wanted a replacement.

Reviews.Title: “Happy. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Mrs-Karlina
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Erboy for 4 nights. Excellent location -2 minutes by foot to Topkapi, less than 10 mins to Blue Mosque & Aya Sophia. Only a few steps to tram stop. The room is very clean, buffet breakfast is excellent, staff are nice. The negative things are (just minor things, really): no kettle & fridge in the room. Other than that everything is superb. Free Wifi from the room, or use their computers for free in the lobby. AC works well. Restaurants (down stairs & roof top terrace) are boh excellent, price not much different with other resaturants. Don't miss the terrace one, the view is beautiful -overlooking Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and Suleyman Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Romy60
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in mid October. When we arrived our room was not quite ready so whilst waiting we were served with apple tea. The room was small but the bed very comfortable and the room neat and clean. The location was excellent for getting by foot or tram to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, The Grand Bazaar etc.. We made use of the internet facilities in the foyer and enjoyed the breakfast - plenty for all tastes and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: alalas
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Erboy and it delivered everything we expect from a good hotel: excellent location, walking distance from main Istambul touristic points, good breakfast, large room (except for the shower cabin, that could be larger), really good restaurant, great terrace and terrific service. Ayse, our hostess at the hotel, gave us maps and explained everything about the city, with great tips that helped us to enjoy this great city. They also helped us with reservations for restaurants. I really recommend Erboy, itÂ´s a great cost/benefit choice.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: krakenish
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Erboy last week for 4 nights after checking out reviews on TA. The hotel was even better than expected, with a good sized room overlooking the street, bedding changed frequently & fresh towels everyday, but I wouldn't fancy a room facing the yard! a bit dark & no view at all. The staff were top notch, the breakfasts were very plentiful & varied with something hot every day, usually scrambled & boiled eggs & sausages (frankfurter style ) + chips ! toast, fresh fruit, yoghurt, bread, ham etc etc. Eating out places in the pedestrianised street at the rear of the hotel were good, but more pricey about 80 TL for 2 (incl. a drink each), further along at the locantas you can eat real turkish food at half the price but no alcohol. The hotel terrace restaurant was splendid with amazing views over Istanbul..don't miss it ! Opposite the Erboy is the Maestro pizza & pasta parlour... very reasonable, Mehmet is a real nice guy, but again no alcohol. there is a pub (sports bar type) at the end of the street.....we bought a half of Efes pils + a glass of white wine for 18 TL !,we sent the wine back as it was undrinkable, the manager offered my wife a free glass of red which was OK....fair enough. It is only about 400yds to the ferry terminal & the same to the two mosques & Topkapi so the hotel is in an excellent position, overall we were well pleased with everything & can recommend this hotel & indeed Istanbul wholeheartedly.... PS. don't miss the Bosphorus trip on the Ferry & get there about 45 mins early !

Reviews.Title: “Reccomended”
Reviews.Author: Ovisan
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to use the services of the Erboy Hotel at the beginning of October. Very well trained stuff. Everybody speaks good to very good English. We have arrived at 12 PM but the bar at the las floor was opened, almost waiting for us and we enjoyed the view until 2 AM. Nobody sent us away suggesting that it is late, although the closing time was 12 PM. Furniture a little bit old in the rooms but very good and nice looking bathroom. Clean ! Cleaning staff speaks English. 2 computers in the lobby connected to Internet. Really friendly stuff at the Reception. Quiet close to the Hagia Sophia, the Sultan Ahmed Mosque (also known as the Blue Mosque) and to one of the entrances to the TopkapÄ± Palace. 100 % Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: SwannTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Nov 2008 with a friend. Location is in the touristy part of Istanbul, within walking distance to many of the great attractions and close to the train stop. The hotel staff was great - concierge sat us down on the first day and helped us plan out our three days in Istanbul to maximise the visit. She kept checking in with us to see how everything was going, and offered excellent advice and recommendations on local restaurants and shopping venues. The rest of the hotel staff were great - helped us out with a number of things. Breakfast was very comprehensive and yummy - eggs, fresh fruit, toast, pastries, yogurt. Rooms were comfortable and we were upgraded to a triple so we had room to spread out a bit. Very clean and comfortable. Nothing fancy, but great value and excellent service! Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant place!!”
Reviews.Author: Fifone
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the best possible location there is! Everything is near, the major sights, nice restaurants, tramway, the harbour for sightseeing cruises. And still the hotel itself is in a quiet street! The staff is absolutely fantastic, the most friendly, nice and helpful. The hotel is clean and the rooms are comfortable. Food is excellent and the breakfast was huge! I definately come back here next year with my friends again! Fabulous time here!!

Reviews.Title: “an oasis in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: budcat
Reviews.Content: In easy walking distance of all the main sights and the perfect antidote to the hustle and bustle that is Istanbul. Quiet, clean rooms. Fantastic food, friendly, helpful staff and an amazing roof terrace. I would recommend this hotel unreservedly and plan to return again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Ä°stanbul among 3 *'s”
Reviews.Author: mr_pro
Reviews.Content: This is my second staying in Erboy Hotel. The location: It is situated at the heart of Old Istanbul. Blue Mosque facing to Hagia Sophia are in 10 minutes walking distance. Famous Eminonu Square, New Mosque, Spice Bazaar and Covered Bazaar which are famous historical interest zone in the vicinity nearer than a mile. Galata Bridge and famous fish restaurants are very attractive and fun especially in nights. Fish&Bread is offered in the boats fixed to quay, really a great fun. The old fashioned channel passenger boats are still running along and acrossing Istanbul Channel. Golden horn is also in close distance to the hotel. Hotel overall: Very good, polite and professional personnel from front-desk to room service, high quality breakfast both in content and service, regular daily room service and changing linens and towels, sanitized WC, all time hot water available for bath, free internet on lobby, problem-free elevators, fantastic roof-restaurant and bar especially in the night, spectacular Istanbul night view in the panorama. And, superb restaurant especially for dinners. Delicious food and good wine service. The only negative side for Erboy Hotel is the size of the room. The rooms are small. But, clean, tidy, practically designed and decorated. For staying at Erboy Hotel, it deserves every penny to what you will get.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Egram12
Reviews.Content: Erboy hotel a value for your money type of hotel. Not only is it located near most of the famous sights in Istanbul it is also 5 min away from the nearest Tram station that brings you to almost any part of the city. This is one hotel I'll definitely go back to. Very clean and the service is great. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: DurbanJoan
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel, 5 star breakfast in separate breakfast room. Stunning restaurant overlooking the street. we were given a free dinner and one way transfer from airport as part of our 3 day package. Professional reception staff, who spoke perfect english. we were able to book bosphorous boat trip from the hotel.walking distance to all major sights including "hop-on hop off " tourist bus. Beautiful roof-top bar / restaurant. We were 2 ladies travelling together & felt very safe at all times.even walking round the various restaurant/ coffee bars in the evening. Nice class of guests styaing there, from all parts of the globe. A real gem

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jenshirt
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, in the heart of everything you want to see in Istanbul! A short walk to all the major sights and the spice market. A quick tram ride to the Grand Bazaar. The hotel had very good breakfast and two restaurants that were very good for supper. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean, the rooms were small but comfortable, with A/C and large opening windows. The view of the Bosphorus from the roof restaurant was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tricky60England
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights, very friendly and helpful staff, good location for visiting all the sights. The room was clean, there was a good selection for breakfast and both restaurants had good menues, the view from the terrace restaurant was superb.We had a free transfer from the airport to the hotel and a free welcoming evening dinner which could be taken any night of the week. There is fee internet provided. Will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be refurbished but ok for a night's sleep!”
Reviews.Author: gaynorchin
Reviews.Content: We checked into Erboy with friendly staff. The hotel lobby is spacious and provides free internet with computers provided. Our room was spacious with 2 single beds joined together to make 1 bed which was not good! They provide an air-conditioner and tv. Our room had a small window which was just outside the fire escape! The lighting in the room needs to be addressed as it is not bright enough. Overall the room needs to be updated as it was old and dingy. The bathroom has been newly renovated but the ceiling is made of metal slats not placed properly as any noise from next door you can hear very clearly the people having a shower or coughing!!! It is a good location just 1 min walk to the Gulhan train station and you can walk to the Blue Mosque, Topaki Palace, Aya Sophia and Basilica Cistern. Breakfast was hectic as there were alot of ppl and so it's a scramble to the buffet with a quick jolt to start the morning! Overall if you want a clean and safe place to stay with a bed then this is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Never stayed here.”
Reviews.Author: texastrojan
Reviews.Content: Well, I didnt actually stay at the hotel. I had booked 2 nights based on reviews here, but something unexpected happened. First off, the cabbie taking us from the airport to the hotel tried to rip us off (i.e. charging the "night" rate during the day--same thing happened in Athens, so be mindful!) and I was 99.9% sure I sniffed out the scam, but to be sure, when the cab pulled up to the erboy, I literally ran out of the car, and asked the front desk staff how much the ride should cost. Of course, the driver had tried to overcharge us, and when he saw the staff member walking out with me, he quickly chopped of 15 lira from the tab. :) Anyways, as we were checking in, the staff told me I could take a free upgrade to a 5 star hotel right down the street, which just happened to be rated # 1 on this site out of 352 hotels in istanbul, the Sirkeci Konak hotel. I was skeptical and almost turned down the offer, thinking it was a scam, but Im glad I didnt. I will also write a review on the Konak, but based on the help with the cab and free upgrade I had to leave a positive review for the Erboy! (and btw, the restaurant on the first floor serving "Ottoman Cuisine" is mediocre at best. Just my two cents)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in a quiet street with excellent location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Okedoke21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and arrived at around 7.30am and were told that as they were full the night before that we would have to wait until a room become free. We were promptly offered breakfast even though this was not included as we had arrived before check-in. The room was clean although a little outdated but in a perfect location near the tram and all the main tourist sites. Breakfast was plentiful and was always being topped up and the staff were always helpful and friendly. The only thing was the smell of smoke in the lobby but our room was non smoking. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Great Staff - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Kruemmel
Reviews.Content: Not only is the hotel situated near some major sites like the Topkapi, Blue Mosque, and Hagia Sophia but its location makes it also easy to explore Istanbul on foot. The hotel is clean, the rooms are comfortable. The staff is absolutely fantastic. Everyone has been very friendly and helpful without being over-bearing. I recommend this hotel to all travellers.This was my first time in Istanbul and I know I will come back soon. And I will stay at Erboy again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: erika2205
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel just last week for two nights with my partner and a couple of friends. The hotel is in the best possible location there is for sighseeing. 5 mins walk to the train station, half an hour to the airport (35 euros in a cab), three minutes to Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque as well as to the Topkapi Seray. Staff are incredibly nice and helpful. I requested early check-in and this was well arranged for free. We got a double room as requested. The room was very clean, the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was adequately stacked with toiletries and towels and the shower was nice. Breakfast was just wonderful with turkish delights, english breakfast, tehina, halva, as well as continental breakfast, and it was all complimentary. Internet in the lounge was greatâ€¦ all in all very good value for money as well I very much recommend the restaurant right opposite the hotel as well - excellent food and service. I am afraid I don't remember the name but can't miss it as it's right outside the door.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and fantastic roof top terrace”
Reviews.Author: Anpe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Erboy for five days in August. Staff at reception and in both restaurants were very nice and welcoming. I got sick while being in Istanbul and they prepared special food for me in the restaurant. Roof top terrace open from 14-02 is fantastic and the best roof top terrace we've been on during our total of seven days in istanbul. Ww spent two days in IST later in August and picked another, more expensive hotel (Best Western Empire), just to try something else - but Erboy is definitely much better in service, location (on a less noisy street), breakfast and restaurants. Aircon worked impecably and our room was spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: eastbournetravel
Reviews.Content: Don't be misled by the slightly smokey and worn air to the reception area of Erboy - this is a brilliantly positioned, clean and well-run hotel. The rooms are fine, beds comfortable enough and the staff very friendly and helpful at all times. The location is the real winner - close to all the major attractions in Istanbul and all in walking distance. the rooftop restaurant produces good quality food at really good prices, and the views are stunning. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jay47England
Reviews.Content: We were picked up from the airport by the hotel as we were staying there for more than 3 nights. When we arrived in the hotel the Receptionist was very pleasent and gave us all the information we need to know. We also had free dinner the first night as a part of the package. It was close to most tourist sites and was easy to get to any place as the tram stop was only 2mts walk away. The staff was curteous and always helpful . The room was comfortable and most of all very clean. bed linen was changed every day. (We were there for 5 days) We had a excellent view from the room we stayed in. I will recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service; Good location; Very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: how2namit
Reviews.Content: I visited Istanbul during the Thanksgiving weekend. I stayed at Hotel Erboy after considering several other places nearby. I'm glad I picked this location. The Guest Relations Manager (Ms. Ayse Sancak) patiently helped me with my questions prior to my reservation. This helped me decide on the property. She set a fine example of great customer service. Once I decided, she helped me with the directions to the property. I took the tram from IST airport and Erboy was very easy to find after getting off. Upon arrival, I was greeted with an apple tea on the house. Ms.Sancak was there at the reception when I arrived. Though I had planned my itinerary for the duration of my stay, she offered her opinion about the key attractions, changes in timings, closings due to construction etc. She also ensured I got the specific room I asked for, that was away from the elevator and had a window view to the Bosphorous. Thereafter, she handed over responsibilities to the reception staff. They worked as a team and ensured my stay was comfortable. Now, to the specifics: 1. Breakfast: Good variety that suits both regional and international travelers. Continental breakfast was part of it as well. I stuck to the continental stuff, not wanting to experiment when I had busy days ahead. The coffee was exceptional. There was a variety of breads to choose from... along with a variety of fruits. 2. Dinner: I was offered one free dinner as part of my reservation. I am a vegetarian and had my doubts before I dined. However, I found enough options and had a filling dinner. Food was served well. 3. Room: The room was sufficient for my needs, though it wasn't the same size as what one would expect of a 3-star hotel in the US. The bathroom area was particularly small, but served the purpose well. The beds were comfortable - my room had 2 single beds. TV was 19" color TV that had mostly local channels and some news channels in English. I didn't bother much with them other than catching a few minutes before hitting the bed. 4. Additional perks: They also offered a free ride back to the airport. This was convenient for me as I had an early morning flight. Overall, very nice place to stay that enhanced the vacation. Also, Erboy is very near to Aya Sofia and Topkapi Sarayi. I'll surely stay here again if I get a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Greggbb
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We were 4 friends visiting Istanbul for 5 days. The breakfast was good and most important was the location. This place was central to everything, and safe too. The food here was really good in the top restaurant and the coffee was incredible. The front desk was cool and we could see the Blue mosque from our bedroom. I was sharing with a female friend and she got no hassle here, where as in Morocco the hassle for women in the centre was a lot worse. Free internet was great. Can't knock this place for value in the slightest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: DancingMachine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Erboy for a dance festival from July 4 - 13, 2009. The rooms were basic and very clean. The hotel food and location were excellent. The desk clerks & customer relations staff was SUPERB! After I returned to the U.S. I found that I did not have the cables, chargers & adapters for my video and digital cameras. I contacted The Erboy by email and received a swift reply from Ayse Sancak, Guest Relations Manager, telling me that they had found the cables in my room and would be happy to send them to me. Then Ayse worked diligently to find the least expensive and quickest mailing method to return them safely to me. I paid less than the replacement cost of the cables & charges for DHL to return them to me in less than a week.They were carefully packaged in bubble wrap. Thank you Ayse for you attention to detail and to the staff at the Erboy for caring about my belongings!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....”
Reviews.Author: NasimaBegum
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located within a short 10min walking distance to all the attractions in Sultanahmet eg Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, Topkapi Palace and Gulhane Park Staff were very friendly and helpful. They recommended a few places for us to visit. A quick walk down the street brings you to the tram station, which is the quickest way of getting out and about (we discovered it with a little help from a local). Rooms are basic but clean. We booked a triple single and the room we got was very small (You wouldn't be able to swing a cat if you wanted to). After speaking with the manager, we were given a more spacious room within 2 days, which wasn't too bad. At breakfast there is a large selection of food on offer. From assortments of bread/pastries, cereals and hot food. So there's no chance of anyone going hungry. There's a computer in the lobby for guests. The hotel has a few restaurants but unfortunately we were unable to try them as we were out and about. We are already looking to go back next year and plan on staying at The Erboy.

Reviews.Title: “Many cuddles from the Erboy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daniob
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in the Erboy, the hotel staff was always kind and ready to be of great help to the costumers'requirements (they prepared also a breakfast for us at 5.00 a.m before leaving to the airport), with cleaned rooms (a bit small) and excellent location in the historical center. Perfect also the welcome dinner at the PaÅŸazade Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but perfect location”
Reviews.Author: AngelaDimit
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very smal, we booked a double bed but we got 2 single beds....the room is clean an the bathroom also. The hotel has a good restaurant, the breakfast was perfect. The location is perfect, in the middle of all the highlights in istanbul. ALmost everything you can walk (in sulthanamet), a taxi ride is not very expensive but one time we got ripped, check your money and also discuss the price!! So a good hotel for a good price!

Reviews.Title: “Room was not what we asked for, twice! Expensive for what it was. Average.”
Reviews.Author: BusLeisTrav
Reviews.Content: We booked a double and noted we needed a double bed, but were given a room with two single beds. They fixed it promptly, but ended up moving us to a smoking room instead. The room kind of smelled. The shower was very tiny, but that wasn't a problem for us. Upon arrival they served us apple tea, which was nice. Wifi was provided and worked and there was a computer in the lobby that was usually available. Breakfast was pretty good. Location was good enough. If it weren't for the mess up with the rooms, I maybe could give a higher review. It was also a little pricey for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “best welcome ever”
Reviews.Author: igheorghita
Reviews.Content: Hi, we just arrived back from our 8 days holiday in Istanbul. We stayed at Erboy Hotel and we were delighted by the extremely friendly and helpful staff.. we actually felt as if we were welcomed by friends! For example, the supervisor spent every morning 10 minutes with us to help us plan the day and catch the good deals of Istanbul. Besides the staff, the next nice thing about Erboy would be location - in a very central, yet unexpectedly quiet spot. Other services - cleaning, air and food - are very good for this price range. In a nutshell, we would definitely recommend Erboy to anyone who doesn't look for a indoor Istanbul experience, but just for a more-than-fair place to sleep well and get up in, served by extremely nice people.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of a hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Sue1956
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this great little hotel. On arriving in Istanbul at 1.30am we discovered our bags had been lost by the airline. The staff at the Erboy went out of their way to help us recover our luggage. Without their help we would not have been able to connect with a tour we had organised. The Erboy is a great little hotel in a great area of Istanbul. You can walk to all of the important sights. The restaurants, especially the one downstairs, served the best food in Istanbul. And the staff is 1st class. I would recommend anyone visiting Istanbul to stay at this great little hotel. It is small but very, very clean and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fits the Bill”
Reviews.Author: TikiRoo
Reviews.Content: When you travel from Sydney to Istanbul via, Singapore and London in one hop, you dont want the hotel to dissapoint. A welcome smile , apple tea and quick city info guide was our Erboy introduction. OK, we got 2 single beds instead of a double, however they would change us the next morning. Got the choice of 2 rooms, small by our Australian 3 star standard, bathroom lighting was poor to average and an inconvenience of no fridge and tea making facilities, but thats what you get when you travel. Good breakfasts, clean rooms, opening windows for fresh air , great staff throughout especially John on the front desk, terrific location for tourists like us that are out after brekky and return late in the evening, for a rooftop beer and coffee. Thanks Erboy just another good thing from a great city, Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mollisue
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for around two and a half weeks altogether and it was the great! The staff were all really friendly, and happy to assist with anything you might need. The rooms are nothing special, but they are clean and have good bathrooms (we stayed in 3 different rooms by the end). There is a cute little bar which is usually empty unless you go there yourself, and there is free internet in the lobby. The hotel is in a FANTASTIC location, just a short walk to all the historical attractions (or close to the tram if you prefer) while if you head in the other direction you get to the water and can walk over to the Asian side. There are lots of good restaurants and food places, as well as a supermarket and laundry service close by. The breakfast is OK, basically just cheese, bread, fruit and cereal, but they do also have some hot food such as sausages and potatoes. All in all, a great hotel in a fantastic location in an amazing city - would definately return!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Traveller753
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. It is good value, clean and ideally located and the staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is about 100 yards from Gulhane tram stop making getting around quick and easy. Ideally located for the main attractions like Topkapi and those around Sultanahmet. I always try and stay here if I can.

Reviews.Title: “the best time ever”
Reviews.Author: CatrinaBucharest
Reviews.Content: Erboy Hotel was recomanded to me by my parents, they were there las year in December and they said: " If you ever go to Istanbul you should stay at Erboy Hotel, because it's has a good position, near the historical center, it's very nice and with good services" They were right, i loved my staying at Erboy Hotel, the room is very nice and clean, the staff is very friendly and helpful. I recommend Erboy Hotey to everybody, the price is very good and at breakfast there is plenty of food and very various. And if you come by train (as we did) it's near the train station so you don't have to pay any extra money for taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ters317
Reviews.Content: I chose Hotel Erboy after a lot of research and the main reason why I chose it, was value for money and location. We got special rates, even though it was the weekend of the Formula 1 Grand Prix, no other hotel was prepared to do that over this specific weekend where prizes rise dramatically because of this event! They also offered a free airport transfer for a longer stay (three nights) and because of the good rate we received, I was able to reserve for one extra night in order to have the room available till late on the night that we left Istanbul to fly back home. Service was good. They assisted is with transfers to Istanbul Park for the GP on both the Saturday and Sunday, which was a great help to us, as we only arrived late Saturday morning. Our room was very small (508), but had a great view of Aya Sophia! It was not to close to the elevator and relatively quiet. Breakfast was good, we had no other meals there. The hotel is within easy walking distance from all the major sites. Aya Sophia, Gulhane Park and the Blue Mosque is the closest. The Grand Bazaar was 20 min walk away and the tram is right at the end of the street. The other hotel of Sirkesi group is right on the main, noisy tram street, so Erboy was the better choice. It was also easy to walk to Eminonou at the waterside to catch ferries as well as go to the Spice Bazaar. If you want luxury don't go to Erboy, but if you want excellent value for money and a good location, book here. I will definately stay here again. I also considered other, more traditional hotels, like Empress Zoe, but have learnt from experience to go for a hotel that is practical (with elevator for one!), especially at the end of your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location !!!”
Reviews.Author: embird69
Reviews.Content: Brilliant stay at the Erboy. the manageress, Ayse, takes the time to greet all her guests with apple tea and half hour to explain where you are, where to go and what to see, it helps and is a great touch! the cleaning staff do a great job and all other staff are friendly and helpfull. breakfast was a bit continental but you dont expect a fry up in Turkey! I emailed ahead to explain we were there as a treat for our 40th birthdays and were given a lovely room, just ask, they are very accomodating! The rooftop bar is lovely, great views and a welcome rest after lots of walking (and boy did we do some walking!) Erboy is central to everything and surprisingly cheap for its location. We didnt actually get around to eating in the resteraunt but met another couple who said the food was great! anyway a fantastic time had by us both at the Erboy, and Istanbul, what a place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: Dick900
Reviews.Content: Like you I read a lot of reviews before deciding which hotel to go to. I was not disappointed, this is an excellent hotel for the money in an ideal location for the tourist attractions in the city. I agree with what everyone has said except for it being noisy. There was just normal city noises when I stayed there in June.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: HANNAHANTRIM
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights the end of June. I had read all the reports here so opted for this hotel. The location is great it is only mins from walking to the sights and all the restaurants and bars are on your doorstep. The staff are very friendly and helpful, rooms spotless, aircon works great ( we moved 3 times) buliding work going on in hotel, floor 3 we were put on, then to room 504 which is right under the roof bar and the noise night and day is terrible, also the room is so small you cannot move in it. They should not be using it for two people.Then the only room availabe was back to a room on floor 3 and it is the rooms facing the back of the hotel where the work is going on in the Erboy. Breakfast was basic, cereals, cheese, meats, boiled eggs , enough for a breakfast. The price of a drink in the hotel bar/restaurant was expensive so needless to say it was empty most of the time. There are lots of hotels in this area which are of better quality than this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent position,very good breakfast,very clean”
Reviews.Author: alitu
Reviews.Content: I choosed Erboy hotel for the position.After a 5 nights stay I concluded that it was a very good choice not only for excellent position (a five minutes walk to Topkapi, Blue Moske,Hagia Sophia, Eminonu port, Galata Tower) but also for cleanliness, breakfast (everything fresh and good quality) and very nice staff. I'll be back with pleasure any time at this hotel. Vlad/ Bucharest

Reviews.Title: “Staff embodies the Turkish Hospitality in EVERY WAY!”
Reviews.Author: ebone28
Reviews.Content: Not only was the location ideal, walking distance to the Spice Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Topgaki Palace, Hagia Sofia, but on the tram line and had easy access to the bus/train stations, too. The staff also recommended a visit to the best Turkish Bath in Istanbul, built in 1584, and they also recommended the Basilica Cistern, which was one of my highlights. The alleys near the hotel have great restaurants and hookah bars. The staff greeted me and offered my friend and I apple tea 2-3 times a day, there is free internet and a computer for guests to use and the breakfast was great. However, for booking belly dancing shows, it's better to book them through Istanbulcitytours.com than through the hotel. We saved 22 euros booking it online. I would definitely come back. The rooms are sparsely decorated but clean and the bathrooms have floor-ceiling tile. Thanks Erboy!

Reviews.Title: “It was a terrific short stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Velez19
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked into another hotel in the group but because there was building work we wer emoved to the Erboy. The location couldn't have been better with a short walk to the major attractions and the harbour and easy walking distance to the Grand Bazaar. All staff at the hotel from the manager to the room cleaner were pleasant, polite, helpful and efficient. The room although not large was adequate and the efficient air conditioner was a life saver. Overall the hotel value was very good, the buffet breakfast allowed for a fairly wide choice of hot and cold food and the small rooftop restaurant was terrific - the food was good - the seating comforatable - the service very good - the wine was good value and when we got the bill it was lower than a comprable meal at a modest restaurant downtown. Would we use the hotel again? YES Would we recomment the hotel? YES

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: uniconomelibero
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in June. The double room we've got (5th floor) boasted an impressive view over Topkapi palace and Bosphorus Bridge, and it was quite comfortable, and big enough (originally, was a triple room). Bathroom was nice and clean, although very small. Cleaning of the room occurred every morning, and breakfast was very good. We got a free hotel transfer on arrival, and on 1st night we enjoyed a complimentary dinner at the hotel's restaurant. Great food and service. The rooftop terrace boasts an incredible view over Hagia Sophia, and it is definitely a nice place to spend some time chillin' out with a beer... Staff was incredibly helpful and always kind, location is great: you'll be just minutes away from the main sights, and the Sultanahmet tram line stop is just around the corner. Basically, a great european-style hotel, not too pricey, with nice staff and a wonderful location. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: dee99Surrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Erboy hotel and would definitely stay again. I visited with my mum and daughter (who's 2 years old). The staff were friendly and very helpful. The guest relations manager Ayse is an asset to the hotel. The hotel is within easy walking distance of all the main tourist attractions. The only downside was the rooms didn't have a fridge which would have been handy for storing water especially at night. Breakfast was excellent with a variety of foods to suit everyone I highly recommend this hotel for location, cleanliness and price.

Reviews.Title: “Erboy hotel gets two thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: trailblazer_13_9
Reviews.Content: I had read some contradicting reviews about a variety of Istanbul hotels, but decided to choose the Erboy after ready some of the reviews about it. We stayed there five nights and reserved through their internet site, and so could take advantage of their offer to pick us up at the airport for free, which was great! Also the dinner offered by the hotel, which was a good meal, and very practical the first night as we were a little tired. The room was on the small side, but was clean and comfortable and had everything you need. The air conditioner was working fine. We didn't always use it and left the window open some of the time, which meant you could hear the tram passing by about a block away, but that wasn't really a problem. It was generally pretty quiet. The T.V. had a variety of stations in different European languages and was also working fine. The hotel staff is overall very friendly and helpful. They offered us some tea when we arrived. I had numerous questions and they were generally able to answer them. There is one lady who can give you a lot of advice about what to visit, itineraries, etc. However, if you happen to have a question pertaining to someone you're waiting for at the hotel, it's better to ask the others, I found, because she is not always behind the desk and may not know who's come by. The location is one of the best things about this hotel - walking distance to the major sites : Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Saint Sophia, Bazar.. and the tram is one block away for what you want to see farther afield. We also took advantage of the rooftop bar/restaurant where it's great to have a drink as you have an amazing panoramic view of the city. Difficult to think of much I didn't like about this hotel. There is a construction site next to the hotel at the moment, but we actually didn't notice the noise from this much. The hotel is a three star, but I would say it's a local rating and not quite as fancy as three star hotels in Paris, where it would probably be a good two star hotel. If you must have spacious and luxurioius rooms, I would say Erboy is not the hotel for you. But if you want good value for money and a clean room that has everything you need as well as good, friendly service then I definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 nights at the Erboy - we would definately recommend it to others!!!”
Reviews.Author: salma1980
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our stay at Erboy Hotel, the staff were friendly, the service was excellent, it was clean and good value for money. Being picked up from the airport was great as it meant we didnt have to look for a taxi etc especially as it was our first time in Turkey. It is walking distance from the blue mosque and much more. We loved it.....we want to go back!

Reviews.Title: “I cannot give it more than a "3 - average"”
Reviews.Author: yorom
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotels about 100 nights per year and I just cannot give a 4 or a 5 to this property.... BUT I must say that most reviews are accurate and that for most people this hotel is perfect. This hotel has been discussed and described extensively so I will not repeat what has been said. Instead I will factually mention the points that resulted in my rating. My room was number 504 and it had a double bed. My window was facing a building that is under major renovation and the noise level was very high from early until late. This room is located directly underneath the lovely rooftop restaurant/bar so again the noise level from the activity above my bed was bothersome until 2am every night. My air-con was either on or off and I could not adjust the temperature and its filter was VERY dirty. The decor is dated and some upgrading is needed. Other than that it is a great hotel..... I paid a very fair price via a seach on this site. As opposed to a previous post... I would stay away from the 5th floor and I would stay away from the building being renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Best three star hotel in Old Town Istanbul”
Reviews.Content: Even tho the rooms at the Erboy are compact, the shower/bathrooms are nicely renovated, the A/C works super, and the overall experience is excellent. The 2 elevators are small, but suit their purpose. The included buffet breakfast is very extensive, offering Turkish items in addition to normal breakfast items. Dinner in their restaurant was great, both food quality, quantity and service. There's even a free computer with internet available in lobby. Desk personnel always willing to assist with directions, suggestions, etc. Even tho they are a three star property, the ideal location, close to restaurants, shops, transportation, etc., and the features make it the best bargain in Old Town. You'll not regret choosing the Erboy. A genuine Turkish atmosphere in the hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, while making an around the world trip by air.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: fuzon
Reviews.Content: i stayed in erboy hotel for two nights and had a memorable time. the hotel is close to all the major attractions which one can eaily access by walking and is few steps away from tram station. it's not on a main street therefore one is spared from outside noices. my room was on the 5th floor. it was little small but very clean, there was a tv, wash room was spotless with warm water ,sheets were neat and clean .it had all one expects from a budget room of 50 euros. After walking all day the only thing one needs is a comfortable, clean room with hot water and it provided all that. I stayed in room 509, it had a nice view and there was no noice from other rooms. my recommendation is to request a room on the 5th floor which is the top most floor as you wont hear any noice from outside street. the breakfast was sumptuous, it had a lot of variety and was very delicious. the cutlery was spotless and service was fast. hotel staff was also very friendly and helpful...i would definetly stay there the next time i will vist istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: steved01
Reviews.Content: The rooms are on the small side and could do with updating but clean. That is the only negative thing I can think of. The restaurant serves great food and the house wines are decent and reasonably priced by Istanbul standards. The views from the roof terrace are spectacular and its a great place to chill after a hard days sightseeing. the Erboy is in a great location, very close to Sultanahmet Square and the tram is at the end of the street. All the staff were very freindly and helpful so all in all I would say we had a great week and could recommend the hotel as great value for money but dont expect the Ritz

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location for all the major attractions.”
Reviews.Author: skrama
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in an excellent location for the major cultural attractions such as Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia Museum, The Blue Mosque. It is very near to the excellent (and cheap) tram service, which also links to the metro to Attaturk Airport. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and spoke good English. The room we had was comfortable with en-suite facilities and air-conditioning, but the decor was plain and uninspiring. The bathroom was clean but needed one or two minor repairs. It had a great view from the roof top bar & restaurant, although the restaurant wasn't open when we were there (May). Not a trendy hotel but good value and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: kawan2
Reviews.Content: As mentioned by lots of other reviewers, the Erboy Hotel is great in terms of location to all the sights. Room is clean and the breakfast was more than adequate. Staff were helpful. Would thoroughly recommend the Erboy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value hotel, friendley helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: UkMds
Reviews.Content: Agree with all other fab reviews for this hotel. Stayed for 6 nights, rooms basic but clean and bed confortable, good shower with plenty hot water - execellant for price. Aircon worked and was effective and not too noisy. Very good free Wifi - useful for planning outings. Staff let us print out online boarding passes without charge. Breakast was very nice with nots of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again - A great find”
Reviews.Author: hmvision
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Erboy three nights in late May and I was very impressed. Value for money was excellent and I will definitely return to Istanbul and stay here. Therefore my overall rating is based on what one might expect compared to other hotels of the same price/caliber. Two friends from the US who are living in Istanbul saw the room and the Erboy has now become their new recommended hotel for visiting friends. I am a 46 y.o. female professional who travels for pleasure, and frequently solo. My younger days as a budget traveler have given way to more comfort and higher budget, but I don't seek luxury accomodations as I prefer to spend the money elsewhere. Therefore, I value modestly priced hotels that are safe, clean, comfortable and are in good locations. I love a great find and I consider the Hotel Erboy a great find. I do not recommend this hotel for those who like American-syle rooms, chain hotels, or who need 4-star accomodations to be satisfied. LOCATION: For those wanting to stay in Sultanhamet , the location is excellent. Short block from tram stop. Street not a very busy one. As solo female, I felt completely safe. Walk to Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, and Topkapi in a few min. Also can walk to Grand Bazaar, to the ferries, and over Galata Bridge to Beyoglu. Private airport transfer or taxi from airport is 50 TL (approx. $30) but the light rail/tram is easy and incredibly cheap (few dollars) and I highly recommend. No stairs enroute and I never had to lift my luggage once. ROOM: I had a room w/ two twin beds on the 3rd floor overlooking the street in front of the hotel. Basic styling but not sterile. Size was average (by European standards). Mattress firm and very comfortable with good sheets. Built-in closet/armoire and separate vanity w/ mirror and stool. Convenient wall mounted lamp over each bed w/ convenient light switch at bed level. Several electrical outlets for recharging electronics. Bathroom was spotless w/ marble tile floor and ceramic tile walls. Bar and liquid soap provided. Good shower and plenty of hot water. Some sound thru walls transferred but not bothersome. Windows glazed so street sounds (limited traffic) not a problem when window closed, but I slept w/ it open and it was fine. Room has A/C w/ remote control. Television w/ channels in French, Italian, English (incl. BBC), among others. Phone. Room service, but didn't use. Two elevators on each guest room floor. BREAKFAST: After 3 weeks in Turkey and having seen a variety of breakfast quality, this was by far the best and most varied. Besides the typical Turkish breakfast of tomatoes, olives, cucumbers, feta, white cheese, hard cooked eggs, and bread/butter/jam, there was muesli, milk, yogurt, honey, fresh fruit, selection of breads/rolls, criossants, scrambled eggs (although runny) and REAL filtered coffee - everywhere else I got Nescafe. There was the typical salami (pink meat common throughout Turkey - they don't have pork there so it's like bologna). Ignore the "orange juice" as it's orange drink, but that was typical in Turkey not to have oj - they seem to have fruit nectars in the grocery stores. Easy to get fresh squeezed oj on the street cheaply so it didn't bother me. There were other breakfast selections I don't recal. Breakfast room is a pleasant one with linen table cloths. Of note were individually wrapped sugar cubes, a first in my month in the country where everywhere I went the sugar bowl was spoonless and saw countless hands reaching in. This was a clear commitment to hygiene. STAFF: Consistently warm and helpful and this goes for every single individual with whom I interacted. This management is clearly focused on customer satisfaction. Ayse, the concierge, was friendly and attentive, providing me with options for group tours as well as independent exploration. I detected absolutely no pressure or push whatsoever toward tours. ROOFTOP LOUNGE: Was open for drinks only as it was early in the season. It was charming and pleasant. RESTAURANT: Daily specials (15 Euro for complete meal w/ appetizer, salad, and dessert). Food was decent although forgettable. I absolutely recommend this hotel for its location, value, staff, cleanliness, and good beds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: princessUk
Reviews.Content: wanted a hotel with a central location since was travelling with my mum who has some mobility troubles. Hotel was prime location for visiting allthe major attractions, all within 10 min walk and if you needed a taxi there were plenty passing the hotel as it was a quite a major route for passing taxis. the tram stop is also just at the end of the street where the is also a british style pub. there is a shop opposite for basic drinks etc but found a tiny supermarket on the main road parallel to the hotel road just down the hill where u could get water etc cheaper. Breakfast had a wide choice , i am quite a picky eater abroad but managed to find something to eat each morning .. Our room (409) not very big but fine for us as we spent all day out and only came back in the evening to relax and sleep. Mian thing it was clean and the bathroom was clean and our shower was lovely. Am planning on going back to istanbul at some point for a girly holiday and would def choose it again , for the money you pay it is a grea bargain and location is perfect!! Oh and also you get free internet access through out the hotel , i took my lap top and was nice to beable to come back and use it whenver i wanted or needed.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Twente
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six days at this nice hotel. The Erboy is situated excellent. The Topkapi palace, the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofia are very nearby. So are the Galatabridge and the bazaars. Around the corner you will find the tram station. The staff is friendly and the rooms are very clean. Each morning we have had a very good breakfast. The rooms are good but a bit old-fashioned. Ask for the restaurant guide of the Sirkezy group. Every evening we have had a very fine dinner with good food. The restaurant in the hotel serves good meals. Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “It lived up to all the expectations of a clean, friendly and central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wenanddave
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel, as we do for all our foreign travel, based on previous tripadvisor reviews. Everything was excellent from our welcome at reception on arrival to our final breakfast before departure. The hotel seemed to be quite busy with people coming and going most of the time. As we had booked directly with the hotel, we benefited from complimentary dinner on the first night. We were pleasantly surprised to have a full choice from the a la carte menu - and meal was execllent. Our fairly small room (510) on the 5th floor (the only non-smoking floor) was very clean but you needed to be very agile to climb into the bath/shower. As you spend so little time in the room, the size was not a problem. If drinking in the hotel - take care of the 2 for 1 beer offer advertsised in reception ONLY applies to reception on not the Terrace Bar. This caused some confusion to a number of guests. As previously reported the hotel is very central with most sites easily within walking distance. Overall a very good, clean, friendly and good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, good breakfast,extremily clean”
Reviews.Author: lauraRome
Reviews.Content: the staff was very kind, the room is clean, confortable and luminous. It's well connected with the main tourist locations!!! A very good choice...

Reviews.Title: “Good choise for unpretentious travellers.”
Reviews.Author: trueol
Reviews.Content: Good location, in old city centre near to main historic places but not noise. Excellent breakfast, staff is very helpfull, hot water all the time, exellent cleaning. Although rooms need renovation and soundproofing is bad.

Reviews.Title: “cant go wrong for the money”
Reviews.Author: dontslam
Reviews.Content: i normally like to stay in boutique hotels, but this time i was away with family and they prefer some of the standard amenitis that you get with chain type hotels, and on that front, you cant fault Erboy. its in a great location, right by Srikeci train station, rooms are clean and simple, staff are nice enough, and we stayed more than three nights, so we got a complimentary meal for five people, and one way airport transfer. all at the budget end of hotel costs. recommended

Reviews.Title: “Could not be better”
Reviews.Author: CYMR0
Reviews.Content: I stayed with friends at this hotel for 6 nights in April 2009. Everything was excellent. Ideal location. Not expensive. Comfortable room with good air conditioning. Bath and shower with plenty of hot water. The cleaners were very fast and efficient and by the time we had finished breakfast the room was clean and tidy again. Breakfasts were superb and we had two excellent evening meals with attentive waiters. The terrace restaurant was not in use (out of season) but it would be a superb spot to have a meal in the summer. The reception staff were also extremely helpful - one even helped us sort out a swindling taxi driver (watch out for them!) who was trying to over charge us for what should have been a short trip. I arrived at 2:30 am but they were expecting me and check-in was very simple. Plenty of tourist information available too. No bad marks for anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 star with excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MrTBrighton
Reviews.Content: First time in Istanbul and lucky enough to stay at the Hotel Erboy. Friendly and helpful staff, informal atmosphere and fab breakfasts- they claim a 5star breakfast in a 3 star hotel which is correct. Friends staying at other hotel reported dismal breakfast by comparison. Position was central but not in one of the noisiest streets. Trying to think of negatives i can only come up with the fact that the room was a bit 'tired' though spotless but nothing that would put me off staying there again or recommending the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LinduFindu
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed at the Erboy eight years when traveling on a tour of Turkey and decided to return this time with my husband because of the positive memories. The hotel is clean, staff very friendly and courteous, rooms decent, and location superb. It's so easy to reach all the major tourist sights by foot, and what is farther away, you can visit via the very close tram stop. We wanted to travel to the Chora Museum and Ayse was most helpful in discussing how to get there via public transportation rather than taxi. She also made other helpful suggestions. Although the rooms are on the small side, they are clean, and I was happy to find a deep bath tub to soak in after a long day walking through the city's stone streets. In terms of breakfast, the buffet offers eggs, sausages, yogurt cereals, breads, cheeses, as well as local treats. Because we stayed four nights, we were treated to a free pick-up from the airport, as well as complimentary dinner on our first night. This was one of the best meals we had in the city--a very good three-course meal. Overall, the hotel is a bargain and I heartily recommend it to anyone looking for a three-star accommodation in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely capable and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorBergen
Reviews.Content: We organized a conference at Erboy Hotel, and we were very pleased with the service we got. The hotel has a good meeting room, and the location is perfect. The hotel building is a bit worn out and some of the rooms are a bit small, but the rooms are comfortable enough and the bathrooms are new and nice. The rooms and bathrooms were very clean. Especially regarding the reasonable room prices, the hotel gives excellent value for a stay in Istanbul. The most impressive part was the friendliness and the helpfulness of the staff. In particular, every single member of the staff was informed about the details of our meeting, so that we could get fast help from any member of the staff without further explanation. Our contact with the hotel before the conference was purely by email and just a couple of phone calls, and I was impressed by how well all our requirements and wishes were taken care of. No single point was missing or wrong. I can say that I never experienced this with any hotel before, after organizing several conferences, some at much more fashionable hotels. The staff at Erboy Hotel is really on top of their work!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with excellent staff with great service and location”
Reviews.Author: vacation1961
Reviews.Content: Erboy is excellent hotel in Istanbul. Room and bathroom are really clean. The breakfast was good even the restaurant, we had a best dinner in it. Erboy hotel is located in walking distance of the most interesting places, Aya Sofia, Blue mosqe, Bazzar and restaurants. Every member of the staff helpful; and lovely even the Guest Relation Manager Ayse Sancak and the front desk staff. They helped us a lot to pick our tours and also, helped us when my wife had an accident in the bus. They were concern about us. I will recomend this hotel to every person is going to Istanbul. My cousin with his family will be in this hotel next May 2009.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: MoandZe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Erboy . We had read good reviews about it beofre we made up our minds to stay there. It was my first visit to a country that speaks a languae I do not understand. The last thing we needed was a bad hotel. Erboy was clean, comfy and pleasant. You would usually get a warm welcome with some ot apple tea and get to enjoy Ayse's company (the guest relations manager) while she talks to you about the main attractions of the city, Once you pick what you want to see, you can mostly purchase your tickets at the hotel and the tour bus comes to pick up at the hotel ! Breakfast there is a real treat and internet is available freeof charge, I can't recommend this hotel more!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: loving_istanbul63
Reviews.Content: Have now stayed at the Erboy several times and have never been let down. The hotel has a great location - literally 100m from Gulhane tram stop which connects with all the major attractions. You can even use the tram/metro to get to and from the airport quickly and cheaply. Rooms and bathrooms are really clean and always smell really fresh. Some rooms are a little dated decor-wise but the rooms are a pretty good size. On this trip we were in room 503 which has amazing views of the Golden Horn and Topkapi Palace. Breakfast is great - loads more to choose from than the usual turkish breakfast and because of this it is really popular with all the guests. I have always found the breakfast staff very helpful and friendly and they work hard to keep all the food replenished and tables cleared quickly. All the staff working in the reception area (including the porters) too are very polite and helpful - I found them welcoming and not at all pushy. Always have time to chat and answer questions for you. The guest relations manager Ayse is lovely and is a great help for visitors as she can give great suggestions of how to maximise your sight-seeing in your limited time there. As I have been to Istanbul many times I did not need any help from her, but she was always happy to chat about where I had been that day and where I was intending to visit next. I have stayed in quite a few hotels in Istanbul - some better than others, but always rely on staying now at the Erboy. Good value for money, great location and friendly staff - what more do you want in one of the most exciting and breath-taking cities in the world?

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for your comfortable rest and convenient travel”
Reviews.Author: Konstantus
Reviews.Content: I and my wife we travel together much. We have visited Istanbul for the first time.Stayed at the Erboy from 4th to 8th March.Usually we stay in hotels 5*. However in Istanbul we have chosen Erboy Hotel 3 * as us have surprised exclusively positive reviews our tourists.Besides we were involved with the price and other conditions of hotel (the discount at payment by cash, a free transfer and a free dinner at hotel restaurant in day of arrival).Earlier we never wrote reviews as quality of rest corresponded to level of hotels.But this time we had a big desire to write review. Erboy hotel has surpassed all our expectations and has confirmed the best impressions of our tourists which have already visited this hotel earlier.We will not repeat those compliments which have been stated in published here earlier reviews concerning a site of hotel, fine service, quality and quantity of meal at restaurant and other moments. We simply join these compliments and we confirm - all the truth! We consider, that exactly thanking Erboy hotel only 5 days of stay in Istanbul have made this huge city for us clear, familiar, comfortable and attracting again and again to arrive here again to stop in this hotel and with pleasant feeling of the old acquaintance to learn about it more and more, to be surprised, again and again to enjoy the seen.If you wish to have the same feeling - this hotel for you. Very much we hope, as in future Erboy will keep and will increase greatly the better qualities!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, excellent personnel, comfort”
Reviews.Author: Richard_Lozin
Reviews.Content: Stopped with friends during journey at the beginning of March. There is excellent combination of cleanness on my, comfort and reasonable prices at the very successful location of hotel. To five minute availability of all basic sights, to the farthest places - half a hour of unhurried pedestrian hike. I recommend hotel to people who will arrive to take pleasure in survey of places of interest of Istanbul and plans hotel for a quiet night dream, an excellent breakfast, good restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “lovely comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: lupoicelady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found every member of staff helpful and the lovely lady in the breakfast room who made sure I had my english teabags was a joy to the Erboy the position of the Erboy was great within walking distance to all that was needed. The one comment not a complaint was the lighting in the room was very very dull and we found it difficult to read in bed, saying this nothing spoilt our holiday in the Erboy or wonderful Istanbul hope to return one day soon. Bedford United kingdom

Reviews.Title: “Well located, main places of interest reachable on foot, clean rooms, abundant breakfast”
Reviews.Author: daniele_1980
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in central position and easily reachable by public transports from the airport. Clean rooms. Very nice breakfast buffet. We had a great stay there!

Reviews.Title: “The warm welcome to the hotel made our visit to Istanbul a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: laesoe_9
Reviews.Content: The Guest Relation Manager's welcome with appletea and a lot of informations about the hotel and the city made us very happy. The breakfastbuffet was nice and different from day to day. We would however have liked a bit more fresh fruit for breakfast. The staff was friendly and helpfull whenever we needed help. The Guest Relation Manager Ayse Sancak helped us when we were cheated in a shop.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for a short stay/holiday, clean, central and staff excellent”
Reviews.Author: rbseahorses
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I had a short city break and stayed at the Erboy, very pleasently surpised -met at the hoteal by their guest relations and offered the local apple tea, had a short explaination of what was around and then shown to our room... the check in I should add, was very fast and effiecient and we wanted a non-smoking room which we got. Hotel is very, very central to all of the main tourist locations which can be found by walking the tram route. There is a bit of walking to be done and some hills that's Instanbul itself. Room and towels where always cleaned and replaced every day and the buffet breakfast was good. Not everything to everyone's liking but always something there and no need to go hungry. My only minor issue (not a complaint) , was there was some hotel noise of doors banging and corridors walking on a couple of mornings/evenings but this was very minor. If we went back to Istanbul I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location was great, but very basic.”
Reviews.Author: ms-itchyfeet
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Erboy for four nights. The location was perfect, you can see the wall of Gulhane Park from the hotel's entrance. The hotel itself was very basic, old, but clean. Breakfast was basic Continental and Turkish style. Beware of front desk person try to sell you day tour packages. They're not good tour companies, the tourguides are surly and they will "guide" you to carpet show and leather company weather you like it or not.

Reviews.Title: “feeling welcome”
Reviews.Author: fluorescent2
Reviews.Content: extremely kind and helpful people at the hotel, 3min from the "tramway", so easy to go anywhwere. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a genuine atmosphere in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: revolett
Reviews.Content: Erboy Hotel is situated so well that you can both feel, hear and see the history of this town. The rooms are nice and clean, and the atmosphere is warm and hearty. Accommodating and helpful personnel, to not speak about the wonderful food! Generous breakfast buffÃ© with pleasant service, and the hotels Restaurants food is probably the best food we have eaten during the 7 times we have visited Istanbul. We will definitely return to Erboy Hotel! Best Regards from Berit, Tabitha & Linn from Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Oh Boy its the Erboy”
Reviews.Author: TheBaldOneCroydon
Reviews.Content: A truely really great hotel,everyone we met from the first day to the last were so friendly and helpful made us feel so welcome. Even gave us apple tea on arrival so good after our arrival by coach and ferry from the airport. It was worth asking for a triple room 5th floor is ideal great views and very clean. All food was of a good standard breakfast set us up for the day ,dinner was always excellent so much choice in the area but hotel food was excellent staff in the rest were brilliant . Would go back to the Erboy at the drop of a hat. Ideal base for the best sights, beware the carpet salesman they are really good. Dont miss the Topkapi Palace especially the harem word of advice take the audio tour!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Doryte
Reviews.Content: Hotel Erboy has perfect location, helpful and friendly staff. If you are not a pretentious person, you won't have problems. In general, I was ok.

Reviews.Title: “well organized”
Reviews.Author: Babak523
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this Hotel for 9 nights , frankly speaking ,in this hotel you earn much , very much more than you pay ........... The Staffs are really helpfull , thier information were very important factors to make our trip easy and joyfull. the one thing that I never forget is the breakfast....really nice .......and the most wondefull aspect that we took advantage of , was the location . if I go to Istanbul 10 times , I wil certainely choose the Sirkeci , you can go to most of the historical sites on foot , all public transportations just 2 or 3 minutes far , the Sirkeci is not as expensive az Taksim and is not as crowd as Aksaray , Laleli with thier strange people at nights .......oh never forget to take slippers with yourself during your stay at Istanbul , most of the Hotels dont have Slippers in thier rooms .

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place, A Great Location with Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: mustafa78
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure to stay in this hotel with it's great location in Sirkeci. We stayed from January 16 till January 20 and found Ayse and her staff to be friendly and helpful at all times. The greeting was pleasant and the staff continued to be helpful throughout our stay. Our rooms were of modest size, clean and comfortable. Cable television and a phone were provided. The breakfast room and restaurant served excellent traditional food at a reasonable cost. If you stay more than three nights they will pick you up from the airport at no cost and provide a complimentary dinner. We were given a 7% discount for cash payment. Thanks Erboy!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Roberto36
Reviews.Content: Recently I had the pleasure to stay at Erboy Hotel. My stay was from December 23 till January 3. The cleanness, service and the location of this facility was outstanding. I am sure that many others hotel around Sirkeci area share the same quality. However, what makes Erboy special is the honesty of its staff. The day before I checked out, I did not found my small wallet which only contained a credit card, my driverâ€™s license and some cash. I thought it may have fallen from my packet. I reported the incident to the front desk. As time passed, I called the bank and cancelled my credit card. I finally left the hotel on January the fourth. To my surprise, two days ago, I received by mail my wallet with my credit card, driverâ€™s license and 25 Turkish Lira. A note inside the envelope said that a customer in the hotel found it. It does not say where it was found, but I am sure it was in my room (510). The fact that the front desk of the hotel mailed to me the entire wallet with cash says a lot about Erboy hotel. I congratulate all the staff for their honesty. I will never forget this incident. I am looking forward to come back to Erboy hotel and enjoy its great hospitality. Great choice in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “they know what hospitality is about”
Reviews.Author: NatBar
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Erboy for a workshop. Everything was perfectly organized via e-mail! Rooms were comfortable and cosy. Conference facilities were a good fit for 15 people. Food and service were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff, cleanliness - a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LenkaP_77
Reviews.Content: Me and my mother spent 3 nights in this hotel and we were absolutely satisfied. It has a perfect location, we felt safe walking in the neighbourhood late at night. The front desk staff was friendly and helped us in everything we needed. The rooms are smaller, but clean, the bathroom is nice too (women who like to make their hair should maybe bring their own hairdryer, since this is the one where you have to push a button all the time in order to make it work and you should bring your own soap and shampoo). Breakfast was plentiful, a bigger selection of fruits would be nice, but we always found something good to eat. Erboy Hotel has no pool, so we were a bit sorry that it was on our last day when we found out that we could have used a pool of a close-by Orient Express Hotel for a reasonable price ! Our overall experience was very good and if we ever come back to Istanbul, we will be happy to stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Erboy sent me packing!”
Reviews.Author: LondonAnn
Reviews.Content: I was rather pleased to find this little gem of a hotel in Istanbul, but I encountered a number of problems. Firstly you need to take a map there, the taxi driver was happy to accept me as a passenger and loop many times around the town. Finally I got out at the old station and had to make my own way there on foot - thankfully assisted by a local waiter. Despite receiving an email from guest relations a couple a days before I was horrified to hear that I would not be staying here due to rennovations or whatever, I was told to move to the sister hotel the Sude Konak (See separate review) which I was not happy with this at all but I did not have a choice since I had paid up in front.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Erboy”
Reviews.Author: darek123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Erboy with my girlfriend for five nights and it was a great experience! warm welcome, everyone is available to help you when you need. Go there for a perfect stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Dushanbe”
Reviews.Author: Shuhrat
Reviews.Content: I and my colleague from Tajikistan had been in Istanbul in December 2008. We had a workshop there. We stayed at Erboy hotel. The hotel is very comfortable, location is very convenient, it is near by famous Blue mosque, Sophia museum, and from other side is beautiful Marmora Sea, that morning time you can take a walk near Sea and evening time have round trip on ship. Hotel personnel are very attentive, the Cooks are excellent. and There are all conditions for both Rest and Business meeting. It was we very like for us to stay in this hotel, many thanks to hotelâ€™s staff and special thanks to Ayshe Sancak best relation manager and to Jan Berk reception for nice hospitality. The Istanbul is beautiful city there are a lot of places that you should visit, and best place for stay is Erboy Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: leii_tomo
Reviews.Content: our 5 day stay in Erboy was superbly the best... Ayse the Guest relation officer is very friendy, accomodating, informative and brilliant... i love the turkish apple tea which they served, i asked for the brand of it coz its my first time to drink an apple tea and i dont usually drink a tea and ayse gave me 2 packs of it, kool, now i am having much of a tea break in office...the employees are very good attending our needs, especially we had squeezed a capadoccia trip to our pre booked tour, and they manage to get as a flight to capadoccia without cancelling the prebooked tour we have.. my friends prob is the food everyday its like just the same, but for me its no big deal, ekmik is so delicious... internet for me is very important, here we had some prob connecting with the web, but later on twas solved...the location is very accessible and near to nice places to see in istanbul, transport is not hard at all as you just go down the street and you can find the tram station, we used tram and train when we went to Kanyon Mall in Levent, very exciting and you will not get lost... overall its the BEST experience... looking forward to come back to istanbul and stay in Erboy Hotel... Saul!!!

Reviews.Title: “Three days is too short time, but II will be back!”
Reviews.Author: piivi
Reviews.Content: Thank you for your hospitality.I liked very much for your hotel, because it is not too big and the situation of it was fantastic. It was so close to everything than you can just walk or if you went farther off hotel it was very easy to use public transport. This was my second time in Istanbul, first time was about 1995 and I was living in Pera Palais. I look foward to visit next autumn again and I will come to your hotel. Have a nice winter time and thank you for everything. Sincerly yours Lilian Bosley Hakaniemenranta 30B67 00530 HELSINKI FINLAND

Reviews.Title: “tremendous value”
Reviews.Author: Kevinw26
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault the hotel. It was ideally located to station and main tourist places. Met on arrival with cup of apple tea and tourist information chat. Room was excellent as was breakfast and overall sevice by staff. Like most places in Turkey the bar is unfortunately smoker friendly which is a pain and this also pollutes the foyer area. Would go back again definitely. Really appreciated the free internet facility.

Reviews.Title: “My Base Location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Chulolaw
Reviews.Content: Prior to my arrival, Guest Relations assisted me with travel recommendations and was willing to do the booking for me for bus tickets, transportation to and from the hotel. We stayed for more than 4 nights and were given a shuttle to the hotel from the airport. He was waiting for us with a sign having our names on it.
