The ride was nice and the driver was very helpful in providing us information of sights we passed on the way to the hotel. The rooms are clean and reception was nice. They introduced themselves and advised us on certain sites to check out. The room was nicely sized for Europe and a corner room is bigger than the other rooms. The shower was a full sized shower not a cube like other rooms we were given. The lighting was good, clean, satellite TV with about 3-4 english speaking channels. There is a discount if you pay cash. The breakfast was good and filling. I do comment that they should alternate a few additional or diffent items in daily so as to provide a feeling of change or new selections. Location is about 1 block from the Gulhane Tram Stop and within easy walking distance of the Eminonu, Sirkeci, Sultanahmet, Beyazit. These are all areas where you would not mind daytime walking. I felt safe even at 2 am walking back tot the room. I woudl dfinitely stay at thsi hotel again

Reviews.Title: “my favourite hotel (home away from home)”
Reviews.Author: Mumcular
Reviews.Content: I have been in the Erboy 3 times now! So what shall I say: I go there because staff is friendly and rooms are clean (you'll get clean towels every day!) and rooms have everything you'll need for a nice and carefree stay. The hotel is ideally situated in the heart of the touristic centre of Istanbul. Aya Sofia, the Blue Mosk, Topkapi....it is all just around the corner. If you want to go explore more of this beautiful city; the tram stops just 100 metres from the hotel and brings you to the harbour, to the ferries and the buses...But where to go from there? Well.....the Erboy has a guest-hostess called Ayse Sancak. She will give you all the information you need to make your stay unforgettable! The hotel itself has every facility you need. Breakfast is excellent and if you want, the hotelbar is open in the afternoon. You should also try the restaurant. If you don't believe me.....just go there and find out for yourself. I hope I can go again real soon!. Rita Raithel-Dannenburg, the Netherlands =(Holland)

Reviews.Title: “Very good location!”
Reviews.Author: mokay
Reviews.Content: I booked the room through www.alpharooms.com as they were the cheapest site. Everything was booked without any problems. The hotel itself is very close to the major tourist site of Topkai Palace, Hagia Sopia et al. Hagia Sopia was a gentle 8 - 10 mins stroll. The hotel itself - the remote control of the TV did not work when we arrived and notified reception. Within 30 mins, they had fixed the problem, even though it was only a matter of changing the batteries. The breakfast was very good, consisting of both hot and cold food stuffs. Sometimes, the eating area was quite full, although I never had to wait for a table. Our double room was very small and the shower cubicle was very small. If you dropped the soap, then you waren't going to bend down to pick it up, thats how tight it was. I did have a glimpse at other rooms though and they seemed of reasonable size. The rroms were clean with rooms cleaned everyday and room service was quick and importantly always got it right. When we arrived, our non-smoking rrom was not availabe and as we were tired, I accepted the smoking room and I could tell that it was a smoking room. The only problem was thr peiople in the next room were very loud, one day talking very loudly until 2am and usually shoutuing in the hall way as well. I would stay at this hotel again as the price is reasonable and the proximity is very close.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: annushkaMoscow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in historical city center Sultanahmed in 10mins walk from famous Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. The breakfast is very good though a bit of the same type.The beds and pillows are very cozy linen is snow white Super! the staff is very friendly and helpful! Excellent quality for reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and value”
Reviews.Author: CMMNZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very handily located within walking distance of all the main attractions in Istanbul. Rooms are small but clean. Walls are bit thin but it wasn't a major problem for us. Service is excellent. We were greeted and given a nice introduction to Istanbul as soon as we arrived. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “best value for money”
Reviews.Author: geebee5
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through tripadvisor and it lived up to all the reviews. While the decor is dated the room was very clean and comfortable. The bathroom worked very well and was well laid out and we had an opening window unlike many other hotels we stayed in on our tour. The breakfast was very good, with perhaps the best coffee we had had for a while and the food in the restaurant was of a high standard. Perhaps what is exceptional about the Erboy is the service provided by everyone there, in particular front of house staff. We were met by Ayse on arriving. She offered us apple tea and sat down with us to discuss what me might like to see in Istanbul. The free internet access was also a big bonus for us. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel near the main attractions”
Reviews.Author: NicoleAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, friendly personel,clean rooms and very good breakfast.Near the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel by far”
Reviews.Author: Dana_03
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th visit in Istanbul and we have tried different 3-4 stars hotels from the historical center (such as Carlton, Adonis, Legend- BEWARE of these), but Erboy is by far the best hotel in this area. First of all, we came by plane and we had free transfer from the airport. Also, we had a free dinner in our first night at Erboy. Rooms and bathrooms are quite small, but very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was delicious, various, with lots of sortiments, everything was fresh and well served. About the staff, only good remarks: they are very friendly and helpfully and they would do everything to please you. We had a funny experience: because we were in a big hurry, we forgot something in our room and I realised this, only at home. I sent a mail to the hotel and they have sent our belongings by post office in a short time. The location is perfect, very close to all the historical sites, to the tram and train station, to the Bophorus and to the shopping area. In spite of these advantages, there is a little problem: because Istanbul is a very crowded city, it's not possible to have a nice view from your room (excepting the upper levels). In our opinion Erboy hotel is ideal for the travellers who want to discover Istanbul and return to the hotel to have a good sleep after a full day. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “exellent walue for money”
Reviews.Author: loneCph_Denmark
Reviews.Content: Among the many hotels in Sultan Ahmed I was lucky to pick Erboy. 3 good days in this wonderfull hotel. The room was nice and spotless, the bathroom worked perfect. The breakfast was good, but most importantly for me, the staff was friendly and very helpfull in all respects. 3 nights and they will pick you up from the airport for free and even give you a free dinner. Pick this one if you travel on a budget and want to meet smiling and helpfull turks! Lone, Denmark.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Jill40Jill40
Reviews.Content: It is my pleasure to inform any interested travellers looking for accommodation in Istanbul that my stay at the Erboy was a very enjoyable experience. I have stayed previously at the Erboy and return because of the high level of hospitality shown and the friendly atmosphere. The meals provided are first class and the accommodation excellent. The ambiance of the Hotel and near proximity to all the wonderful sights is a big advantage. It is possible to walk to the Grand Bazaar and the Spice Markets, the beautiful Mosques - and the other attractions. Staff are extremely accommodating and friendly. It is my favourite holiday resort and I plan to return as often as I can. I highly recommend it to any travellers. Sincerely, Jillian Wilkins Perth, Western Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: VWF1
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed a 4-night stay at the Erboy and couldn't believe how ideally situated it is for all the sights. My room was spotless, bed comfy and bathroom with power shower immaculate. The breakfast buffet was a sight to behold and the two evening meals I had at the hotel were tasty and served promptly. There are plenty of good and lively restaurants to choose from nearby. I walked and walked and saw all the sights and can highly recommend a visit to the Ayasofya as the highlight of any trip to Istanbul. Getting the local E10 green bus from the Sabiha Gokcen airport and then the ferry to Eminonu was no problem and really cheap; the walk to the hotel with a trolley case was not too bad either. I would love to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Erboy was tremendously friendly and always helpful”
Reviews.Author: Rif_and_Ann
Reviews.Content: We returned home last night from our week's stay in Istanbul, determined to record our appreciation of the Erboy Hotel. We were at the Erboy for seven nights and seven breakfasts, and also used their restaurant for two evening meals and one lunchtime meal. The food was always excellent, and the service we received from every member of staff - both in the restaurant and throughout the hotel - was exemplary. The whole hotel was spotlessly clean, and our room in particular was thoroughly cleaned each day, with fresh and good quality bed-linen and towels provided. The hotel is centrally located for all the major tourist destinations, with numerous restaurants and shops in the network of streets around it, and is particularly useful for accessing Istanbul's excellent tram service. We think it is suitable for all types of guests; the one drawback for disabled travellors is that the lift is fairly small (a consequence of being a long-standing hotel with limitations on what can be done to the structure), so that a wheelchair user has to be able to get out of his/her wheelchair to use the lift, but the staff were always keen to help. We found it well worth the cost, and would be happy to recommend this hotel to anyone. Rif and Ann Winfield, Wales.

Reviews.Title: “Citytrip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AntwerpMary
Reviews.Content: We have been in the hotel for 4 nights. Public relations were very good, by the start of our stay, we got a good explaination from the lady who took care for the customers of the hotel. We are also offered an apple thee what we appreciated very much. The hotel reception organised for us also a day trip by boat over the Bosporus and we went by bus to Asia. Our room was very nice, calm and proper. The buffet breakfast was super and very various. The restaurant was also perfect. If we come to Istanbul again, we certainly go booking by Erboy Hotel again. Thanks very much !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience on the edge of Europe”
Reviews.Author: Martin-Slovakia
Reviews.Content: I have spent 4 nights in Erboy hotel just couple of days ago. Also because of hotel services: Ayse - very nice Guest Relation Manager and guys at the reception desk, was my stay "on the edge of Europe" very nice experience. Hotel has very good location in the heart of Istanbul and therefore I recommend it for especially those, who like to walk around the city (itâ€™s close to almost all important sightseeing places in Istanbul). Room was small but clean and comfortable. Only problem I had relate to Wi Fi connection in the room, but thanks to very friendly hotel staff weÂ´d fixed it soon. Hotel has my best recommendation for every traveler to Istanbul. Martin Slovakia

Reviews.Title: “Excellence at the Erboy!”
Reviews.Author: bondac
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Erboy Hotel for 10 days and would recommend this hotel whole-heartedly to any tourists visiting Istanbul. I received a warm welcome from the staff who were most helpful in every respect and readily answered any questions relating to places of interest and transport. The hotel is in a perfect location in the Sultanahmet, close to the Hagia Sophia, the Topkapi Palace and other major tourist attractions. Public transport is close at hand and access to other parts of the city and Ataturk Airport is very straightforward. The buffet style breakfast was excellent and evening dinner in the roof top restaurant, overlooking the Bosphorus was a delightful way to round of the day. The room was air conditioned and the bedding and towels were changed on a daily basis. An added bonus was the availability of free internet use in the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: itchyfeet65
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed at the Erboy Hotel by Ayse, a very informative young lady, and hot apple tea (an acquired taste). Ayse gave us maps and ideas of what to do during our 5 night stay. Our room was clean and comfortable, with lots of hot water. The Erboy is only a few minutes' walk to the tram which goes all over Istanbul for a small fare, plus a few more minutes' walk to the Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and the Sophia Mosque; it is about a 20 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar and main train station, so it is very well situated in a fairly quiet street with good restaurants on the ground floor and rooftop terrace. As we had a 5 night booking, we were picked up at the airport and, as we had booked direct over the internet, a voucher for dinner, so very good value.

Reviews.Title: “jbdo”
Reviews.Author: abcdParis
Reviews.Content: Impressive breakfast and very appropriate recommendations of the Guest relation manager.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was realy good one!”
Reviews.Author: tiulip
Reviews.Content: It was my 10th visit to Istanbul. I liked the location of the Erboy Hotel but most of my pleasure was the briliant hospitality of the crew, and specialy of Mis Ayse Sancak, the Guest Relation Manager. She and other member of the Hotel have done everything to make my staying as plausible as possible! The breackfast was delicious and very testy. I enjoyed my beeing in Istanbul, which was a mixture of business (my book is going to be published during the begining of 2009 here) and enjoing the pleasures of this great city! It was a very correct choosing of this Hotel! sencerely, Dr Zvi Keren

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, superb, definitly recommended”
Reviews.Author: starmirza
Reviews.Content: I came there on the 24th of August this year, and loved every day of our 7 day stay. The best part of the hotel for me are the staff members. There was not ONE person who was not polite to myself, my wife, and they even made the effort to get along with my 3 year old daughter. They REALLY made the best effort to make my family and I feel at home and succeeded 10 times over. The room was delightful with a great view over the water's. The bathroom was clean and well designed. The internet was always available on computers downstairs in the lobby. The buffet breakfast was excellent with a range of various foods. I sat in the restaraunt and had one of the best aubergine dishes I have ever had, and even asked for the recipe!!! All the ameneties which I wanted to see were within close proximity to the hotel, so travelling wasnt an issue. I have already recommended the hotel to my family members who I beleive will now make a plan to stay at the same hotel. I was gutted to leave and enjoyed my time so much, I hugged the bellboy as I left. I will never forget my stay at Erboy and have made my mind up that I will DEFINITLY go back there. Rehan

Reviews.Title: “Another satisfied customer!”
Reviews.Author: JawadHussain
Reviews.Content: Before my recent trip to Istanbul and stay at Erboy, I was pretty skeptical about the authenticity of hotel reviews that we find at the internet. I am glad to be proven wrong after a great stay at Erboy from 21st to 28th August (2008). I am not sure about the bad experiences by some reviewers but can assure that all the good things that you read about Erboy Hotel are true. A list of them, in no particular order of preference is: - Great service: (guest relations managers, front desk staff, housekeeping, kitchen) everybody very efficient and always willing to help. - Great location: Very close to tram stop from where you can go to most popular tourist locations and if you are fond of walking like me, you can conveniently stroll from the hotel to Topkapi Palace, Archeological museum, Gulhane park, Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Divan Yolu, Yerebetan sarayi, Grand Bazar, Spice Bazar, Eminonu ferry docks and many other places - Neat and Clean rooms and bathrooms - Free internet, safe boxes - Competitive rates

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Diners
Reviews.Content: 2008 Folktour and everything was just great. Free internet in Lobby. Two computers - one was broken. Staff very helpful in translating Turkish keyboard to English. I paid the single supplement but my room had two single beds. Staff offered to put them together for me. My small room was spotless. Beautiful bathroom with telephone shower. Don't forget to bring your own sink stopper! Didn't bring the right electrical converter, but The Desk loaned me one. The Chef exceeded all expectations with so many delicious selections offered. I usually lose weight when I travel, but I'm definitely on a diet now that I'm home. Great neighbourhood. Just follow the tram tracks to all the sights. I want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “a delightful experience”
Reviews.Author: saahmad
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 weeks. A quiet , comfortable, convenient location. close to all the historical sites and transport. Gorgeous free breakfast and lovely dinner menu, backed by very friendly personnel. highly recommended as facilities are a 3-star plus. loved the walk in adjacent gulhane park.

Reviews.Title: “Single female traveler found this hotel friendly, good value”
Reviews.Author: lkmiller
Reviews.Content: I found the Erboy an excellent place to stay for a reasonable price. Rooms not as luxurious as more expensive digs, but very friendly, helpful staff with an array of services available (ironing and other laundry services; free internet access in lobby; free use of safe boxes; etc) As a woman traveling alone, it was important to me to be someplace safe and friendly, and the Erboy fit the requirement. My room was good -- basic, but clean, with daily visits from maid service to bring new towels. Complimentary breakfast was nice, and was served until 10.30 which allowed me to be leisurely. Hotel on quieter street than many others nearby, which was great. Extremely close to major sights in that part of the city. Small rooftop terrace restaurant truly enjoyable. Room service food also good. Hair drier extremely simple so if you need one daily bring your own (and don't expect free shampoos and the like). If I return to this part of Istanbul, I'd be happy to stay here again. Be sure to ask about other services avail at the chain's other hotels (such as using the pool at the Orient Express around the corner), and the Erboy has someone on staff who can help you plan tours, either with companies or on your own, to make sure you see all the sights. I would advise single women travelers to consider going on group tours (or finding a one-to-one tour option), especially for the old city area. On your own, you will get an extra dose of harassment, with men asking you your name, where you're from, sometimes following you as you walk away even if you ignore them. It gets tiring and takes some of the enjoyment out of the experience. Also watch out for the taxi driver scam. Make sure you know what notes you give, and watch them as they take them from you. Otherwise, you may have someone claiming you only gave him a 5 when you actually gave a 50 lira note.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: annette7831
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Istanbul and I stayed 6 nights at the Erboy. I chose this hotel based on the good reviews it received on tripadvisor.com and they proved to be true to reality. First of all, it felt very reassuring that the PR staff of the hotel contacted us a few days before our arrival and offered to help with any information we needed regarding our stay in Istanbul. The hotel is indeed only 5 minutes away from all the important places of this incredible city (so you can stay out as late as you want since the Topkapi, Aya Sofia, the Blue Mosk, the Spice Bazaar, the Galata Bridge are so close - and seeing these places by night is definitely a must), 2 minutes away from the tram station (which will take you directly across the Golden Horn if you want to see the Galata Tower, the Dolmabahce palace or the Taksim Square or Istiklal street) and the Eminonu ferry station (5 minutes walk also). Thus we saved a lot of precious time, since there are so many tourists in Istanbul and we did not waste time finding or reaching these places of interest. On the other hand, the hotel is surrounded by a lot of restaurants, so you have a lot of choices when it comes to dinner or just having coffee or a tea. Clean, cosy room, VERY CLEAN bathroom (this is very important to me), rich breakfast, very clean sheets and towels, A/C that worked properly - these can be said about the hotel, all coming at a price we considered extremely reasonable. However, all of the above would not be enough to characterize the hotel without mentioning the helpful and kind staff of Erboy, be it the reception desk or the restaurant (I also recommend the Pasazade restaurant downstairs for ottoman specialties, choose a table by the narrow, colorful street and for dessert order the Sultan favourite). I had the strong feeling that kindness and friendly politeness come naturally to all of them. The first reassuring feeling I talked about earlier was constantly reinforced by their attitude. We were lucky to have a room which faced the Aya Sofia and I attach a picture since it was the ultimate view to wake up or go to sleep with.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Canadawrestling
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Erboy hotel were both professional, yet easy to get along with. They made you feel like you were right at home! Meals were prepared quickly and were great. The guest relations manager gave us great advise as to what to see and the best way to get there. What a perfect place to stay in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Oh Boy, The Erboy”
Reviews.Author: airedaler
Reviews.Content: We booked the Erboy primarily because of its location to all the 'must see' sights of the old city of Istanbul and because we found most of the published reviews were positive. We were very glad we did. The postion is just great, the staff very friendly and helpful and the rooms although small and a bit old, were very clean and totally acceptable. The breakfast room was a terrific place to start the day. Truly a meeting of all the peoples of east and west. The choice of foods was amazing, catering for the tastes of many cultures and plentiful. Again, the service was instantaneous and friendly. The rooftop garden restaurant was fantastic, with simple good food and service at cheap prices and a view across the bosphorous to die for. Try it for an evening meal in the warm summer evenings. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Istanbul at the Erboy. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “A superb stay at Erboy”
Reviews.Author: abslondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ideal location near to tram stops and major sites. You will find the staff friendly and efficient as well as extremely knowledgable. We tried to learn some Turkish phrases but you will find lots of the staff can converse well in English. Try the hotel top floor restaurant for a fantastic dining experience overlooking the historic sights of this amazing city. Try not to be too late for breakfast as the fresh pastries run out fast. Our room was presentable and had air conditioning which is a real plus as the city can get humid.

Reviews.Title: “very good touristic assistance”
Reviews.Author: PVRS
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very well located and the personnel willing to help. They have a â€œguest managerâ€� that helps everybody who needs with tourist information, reservations, maps, explanations. She is really good. We spoke not very good English but we could get along very well. Best cost/benefit ever. These types of help and service you can not find in any other hotel with this price. Thanks a lot, Ayse, for making our trip so much better!!! Brazilian Group!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Erboy”
Reviews.Author: KenS0
Reviews.Content: Our tour of Istanbul was arranged through a travel agent but we chose to stay at the Erboy because of the price and recommendations on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. We arrived by train from Thessaloniki (train trip an experience!!) and easily walked the short distance to the Erboy. When shown our room we were disappointed - very small,overlooking a dirty lane & dilapidated buildings. However when we went back to the desk & asked to be moved to something larger and better the gentleman had no qualms in giving us a key to another room. The room was alot larger, 2 single beds (although we would have preferred a double) and a good sized bathroom, overlooking the main street and not too noisy. We found the hotel very central to most of the tourist attractions and walked everywhere easily. We were only a block away from the tram stop when we wanted to travel and link to other services to explore the Istanbul Modern side. For value for money I do not think you can go past the Erboy. The staff were courteous & helpful, accommodation clean, the breakfasts more than enough.Guest relations manager Ayse assisted us with any enquiries or advice we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: tinav3_travels
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Istanbul a few days ago, and am missing everything already! Our stay at the Erboy was a wonderful experience. We were there for a Turkish folk dance workshop and stayed at the Erboy for 11 days in total. The rooms are small, but that is no big deal, since we were out all the time anyway, returning only to sleep. The staff are among the best I have ever encountered - very friendly, professional, and helpful. The rooms are very clean, in fact the entire hotel is very well taken care of and the location is excellent. The breakfast was superior! Lots of selection, tasty cheeses, excellent yogurt, and fresh fruit. Dinner on the terrace is amazing - the food is wonderful and the view is spectacular. I would definitely stay there again, it is excellent value, and I would recommend anyone to stay at the Erboy.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, great location”
Reviews.Author: Philara
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very well located, near the Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, as well as the Spice Bazar. Our room was quite small, although clean, and the shower worked very well. There's a gorgeous roof-top terrace and free Internet in the lobby. The breakfast buffet was good. On the downside, the personnel at the front desk were not helpul (speak with Ayse, the guest relations representative instead, she's wonderful). The phone in our room would also frequently ring for no reason during the night, so I strongly suggest you unplug it upon your arrival. If you're looking for a good "value" hotel, this is a good place to stay in Istanbul. The hotel compares favourably to most other places we stayed in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “A Four Star?”
Reviews.Author: welat
Reviews.Content: I was tremendously disappointed when I saw the hotel room -- a dark, outdated, cramped, uncomfortable room and was shocked that anyone could give this hotel 4 stars. I was generally unimpressed with Istanbul's hotels and those in Sultanahmet/Sirkeci are obviously older than the ones in Taksim. As for Erboy's "great location" -- it was in the hotel district of Sirkeci -- there were hundreds of hotels that you can choose from and most of them have an excellent location. I was also unimpressed with the fact that despite the fact that Erboy has a fantastic roof top terrace, it does not serve breakfast there. How aggravating. On the positive side, the hotel rooms were very clean and the staff extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Erboy? Boy oh Boy, It's Good”
Reviews.Author: ktelontour
Reviews.Content: Never mind what others may have said about this place; for us it has been a lovely stay, in a quite mesmerising city. The room is compact but not claustrophobic and has cable TV, free air-con (manual controls) and free wi-fi internet access if you provide your own computer. There are also two, free pcs in the lobby, if not. Very comfortable beds with clean linen every day, should you choose and the bathroom is more than adequate with an extremely good, powerful shower in a dedicated, fully enclosed cubicle, not a curtain. All staff are first class; helpful, friendly and courteous and the location of the hotel is another welcome bonus, with many major attractions a short stroll away. Breakfast is another treat as it provides a full choice of edible options from cereals, fruit and breads to cooked items, and the roof top restaurant provides delicious meals at affordable prices with a breath-taking view at night. We would certainly return here, given the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: didietf
Reviews.Content: The hotel can be found just by 3 minutes walking from the tram stop at Gulhane. Since we're taking tram most of the time during our stay in Istanbul, it's very easy to reach the hotel, including when we needed a few hours break in the afternoon. And it was very near from Topkapi palace, Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque and Basilica Cistern, so you could just do a nice walk to those places. The bedroom was a bit tiny, didn't have a good view, but it's clean and comfortable. The Air Conditioner was cold enough and controlable. Our bedroom was beside the elevator, so it was quite noisy especially when many people are using it for breakfast downstairs in the morning. We also asked for a room with one big bed, but they seem didn't notice it. When we entered the room, there were 2 small beds inside. We're too tired to ask for another room so we just moved the bed next to each other. So make sure that you get what you ask for...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Erboy - perfect for single female traveller”
Reviews.Author: istanbultravel
Reviews.Content: I booked my trip through venere.com, for three nights at the end of June. I have just returned from my trip and can't even explain how wonderful the Erboy hotel was. Having travelled to over 100 countries, I have never experienced the level of service as I did at the Erboy at any other 3 star hotel. I was a lone female traveller and they were exceptionally attentive to all my needs. This is an exceptionally clean, efficient and safe hotel. It was also in a great location. While some 3 star hotels in Sultanahmet are in some dodgy, quiet streets at the back of the area, the Erboy is located on a main street, right next to a tram station. That means that the area around the hotel is well lit and busy enough to make it safe enough to come home late at night alone, either by walking, tram or taxi. I am very happy that I chose the Erboy and would have no hestiation staying there again. In addition, I also stayed the first night at their sister hotel, the Sirkeci Konak, which was also an excellent choice, but in a different price range.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money”
Reviews.Author: KeighleyJetsetter
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel and I would recommend anyone to stay there.I travel all over Europe and am very well travelled,it was my first visit to Istanbul and would definately go back to the hotel and stay there again. It is in a good location and near to all the tourist sites. I would,though,take a map of the hotels location with you as I did, as most taxi drivers in Taskim Square do not know how to find the hotel. On arrival we were met by the porter who took our bags,were given a free glass of Apple Tea by the Welcome Mangeress and was informed about all the attractions to see in the city and was made to feel very welcome. The staff are very corteous,helpful and friendly. Tram stop only 40 yards from hotel. The room we stayed in(a double room) was OK for size,though we did notice the twin/double rooms did vary in size. Good double glazing.The room surfaces were cleaned Ok but one slight criticism was that the floor was carpeted and was not sufficiently cleaned.Blonde hairs from the previous guest remained on the floor for the whole of our 4 day stay. The breakfast was buffet style,excellent choice of food.Try to eat in the roof top restaurant too for stunning views of the city. Hotel has 2 terminals for free internet access - very useful,though as you would expect,always someone on them unless you use them early morning/late at night. Free safety deposit boxes too - another bonus. For female visitors visiting Istanbul it should be noted that there is a distinctive Eastern/Asian dress style for woman but this changesonce you cross the river to reach the main shopping street and Taskim Square which is much more European. I have no connections with the hotel and my review is totally independent- if you stay at the Erboy hotel,you will not be disappointed,Excellent location,good value for money and very helpful staff. I will definately stay there again on my next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: dgunbug
Reviews.Content: The Erboy is a reasonable hotel with a great location, just a short walk from the major attractions and right on the tram line. The staff was friendly and picked us up as promised at the airport. Note - our flight was delayed and we emailed them while in transit. We received a prompt reply and were met upon arrival at the airport. We were surprised to learn that a full course dinner with mezes, entre and desert was included in the price of the room for the first night. (I believe this is with a 3 night stay) The breakfasts were very nice as well. The only downfall to the hotel is that the rooms, while comfortable were only mediocre and the bedding (pillows especially - I like nice soft pillows) were adequate, but could be improved. The room size is small, but honestly, how much time are you planning to stay in the room! Overall, we got exactly what we expected as far as a room - just a basic accommodation, with good food, a nice staff and an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in a pearl of a city”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller08901
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Erboy Hotel when it first opened some 18 years ago, and not being disappointed then, chose to come again and stay for four nights this week. It continues to be a gem for many reasons, particularly the gracious hospitality, helpfulness and warmth of the staff; and its superb location within walking distance of Istanbul's finest attractions - Topkapi Palace, Sancta Sophia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar, Galata bridge, and Hippodrome, and enough carpets and ceramics to last a lifetime. The hotel provided a car to meet us on arrival, and the transfer to the hotel was efficient and courteous. On arrival we sat with the Manager of Guest Relations and enjoyed one of many hot apple teas and had all our questions answered - opening and closing times of museums, ATMs, tram tokens, local services. Our room, on the 5th floor looked out to Sancta Sophia - a view that was grand by day and magical at night. Breakfast was lavish, fresh and abundant, with enough hot and cold foods, breads, pastries, salads, even Turkish Delight and those wonderful Turkish apricots to fuel you for the day. The hotel's restaurant Pasade serving Ottoman food was beautiful - my meal of shoulder of lamb wrapped in a pistashio stuffing was one of the best meals I had in Instanbul. The hotel truly is a gem in a pearl of a city! And unlike the magnificent emeralds in the Topkapi Palace, this gem is inexpensive and well worth it. Dr Ross Todd New Brunswick NJ

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel But......”
Reviews.Author: KnightHawk3003
Reviews.Content: Hello, I would recommend the hotel for its sheer closeness to many well known sites, Helpful and friendly staff, amazing hot breakfast & easy access to many of the famous restaurants. The only problem is with the water. There is no continous flow of water. Taps run dry every 2-3 minutes. Also I must have burnt myself when the cold water tap ran dry all of a sudden and only HOT water was pouring. So if you are staying in Erboy just be careful while taking a bath!!! Cheers Knight

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: davidFloridaUsa
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at the Erboy Hotel in Istanbul. I originally chose the Erboy because of the recommendation of other travelers on the web and they were right. From my first contact by e-mail with the hotel my questions and requests were handled promptly, and very helpfully by Ayse Sancak the guest relations manager. The hotel is located within a few minutes walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Haiya Sophia , The Topkapi and the Archaeological Museum. The tram to take you all over Istanbul is 3 minutes walk. The price of the hotel is very reasonable for Istanbul and the building is very clean, in good repair and quiet. Though the rooms are small by American standards they are average for reasonable hotels in Turkey. The staff at the desk was increadably helpful and friendly with directions to places and handled any minor problems immediately. There is free use of the Internet in the lobby. Breakfast on the lower level is a Turkish style buffet with a big selection of breads, cheese , meat, olives, . Eggs were not cooked to order but they were offered scrambled and hard boiled. Though not a gourmet treat yoiu will have plenty to eat. Though this is not a luxury property it is as good as possible in an affordable price range.The staff are as attentive as in many 5 star hotels.Thank you..

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Best breakfast”
Reviews.Author: dr_umar
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after spending a month in turkey, a wonderful experience it was. Erboy was our first hotel and we stayed there 3 nights. The only thing bad was despite me confirming with them nobody seem to know that we were arriving, i had to call and remind them to come to airport. well everything else can be ranked excellent, nice freindly staff, good locaion, very good buffet breakfast, Dinner was also excellent, i think they have really nice chefs, i loved the lamb chops. I rnak it a good four star hotel, i definately recomend it if your budget is around 60-80 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy65
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a 6 night visit and would thoroughly recommend this hotel. The location of the hotel was perfect as it is situated between all the major attractions so we were able to walk to most of them. Our party included 3 young children and whilst there were no other guests with young families, the hotel staff were highly attentive and and very friendly, nothing was too much trouble especially where the children were concerned. The only thing I would say is that as the walls are quite thin between rooms so the chances of your neighbours being able to hear your 'little angels' laughing, talking and playing are quite high! The breakfasts were great and offered a good variety of meat and veg dishes. The rooms were clean and although the bathrooms were a little small this didn't really impact on our stay. We were not expecting to find air conditioned rooms for the price we paid so this was pleasant surprise. All in all a great hotel providing good value for money with good levels of customer care.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price, excellent location, warm service”
Reviews.Author: politis
Reviews.Content: Erboy Hotel has an ecxellent location if one is interested in visiting historical sites, as well as if a traveller wants to catach boats or trams, since they are all close by. Service at Erboy was warm and welcome, the room had the basics, but very clean and free wireless which is excellent. And all this at a very reasonableprice. I would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb place”
Reviews.Author: Wisdomtooth
Reviews.Content: I booked Erboy after reading rave reviews about it on Trip Advisor. And they deserve every bit of praise they've received. The location is excellent. It's within easy walking distance of the SultanAhmet area on one side and Sirkeci on the other. That itself covers a whole lot of sites of tourist interest. The tram line is at the end of the street, so getting to places further away is no problem either. In fact if you do not have much luggage you can travel to and from the airport very comfortably and without hassle using public transport alone. The room we stayed in was not too large, but for the two of us it was quite adequate. Most important, it was clean, and the plumbing in the bathroom worked very well. The breakfast spread was very generous and of very high quality, and access to the internet was free. However, when we found both PCs occupied, we used the internet cafe on the first floor of the restaurant across the street. Most important was the super service we received from every staff member. I wish to name two in particular, viz. Sinan (at the Reception desk) and Ayse (Guest Relations) , both of whom went well out of their way to make sure we were not wanting for anything. To give just one example, we had purchased an expensive and rather fragile ceramic vase at the Dolmabahce Palace gift shop, and had asked them to hold it for us for about a week when we would return to pick it up on our way back home. On my request Sinan wrote a brief note in Turkish to the Palace Authorities requesting them to allow us to enter the Palace grounds without a ticket so we could proceed straight to the gift shop to collect our package. It worked, and we were let in. Ayse too very willingly helped us plan our days, working out the optimal routes we should take to be able to fit in as much as possible in the all-too-brief timespan we had in Istabul. All in all, a wonderful place to put up at reasonable prices, where you get super value for your money. Thanks, everyone at Erboy. I would whole-heartedly recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget trip to Istanbul. In fact, I already have. Please also have a look at their very informative website.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Staff, Great Service.... Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: simes78
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from staying 6 nights at the Erboy Hotel and have really enjoyed our stay there. Upon arrival at the airport we were met with a taxi provided by the hotel. The rooms were pleasantly furnished and equipped, we booked 2 triple rooms as there were 6 of us, 3 adults and 3 children, which comprised of a double bed and one single in each. We had lovely views out of our window and felt completely comfortable. The only negative i can think of is that the walls are quite thin, we could hear when next door were having a shower or when their water was running in the bathroom. We could even hear each other talking in the side by side rooms we were in. There was a complaint put in to reception from the couple next door saying that our children were too loud, even though we didn't think they were, and we became conscious of this and tried to spend the rest of the week whispering! In spite of this we still can't really fault the rooms. Breakfast offered a wide range of breads, pastries, fruits and cereals, the waiters were very friendly and incredibly efficient, they made sure that we had everything we needed and always had a smile for the children. That is one of the best things about the hotel, the staff are very child friendly and always had time for them. Our favourite member of staff was one of the porters, Hamdi Ergul, the children were completely bowled over by him, he was always had time for them and laughed and joked with them, my 5 year old nephew was talking about him most of the plane journey home and says he misses him and wonders what he is doing now! The hotel is very conveniently placed within walking distance of most of the major attractions, the only thing i would be wary of is when taking a taxi to somewhere further afield to book it directly through the hotel. We made the mistake of taking a taxi ourselves back to the hotel one day and were charged 21 lira, we did think it was too much but felt like we couldn't say anything, we were told by Ayse, the hotel guest relations manager ,that it should have come to no more than 5 lira! She was completely shocked that we had been charged that much! After that we always booked through the hotel. Ayse answered any questions and queries that we had and nothing was too much trouble for her, she put us completely at ease and arranged for whatever we required. Overall we all loved our stay in Istanbul, and loved staying at the Erboy, the service provided by the staff exceeded all our expectations, for a 3 star hotel it provides 5 star service! If we do go back to Istanbul (and we really want to!) then we will definitely be staying at the Erboy again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RMJOldmeldrum
Reviews.Content: An absolutely superb small Hotel ideally situated for the main tourist locations, ferries and excellent nightlife. The staff were all helpful and willing to assist with any problem or request. The rooms small but spotlessly clean and well maintained. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, helpful staff, excellent restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisK5
Reviews.Content: We were recommended to this hotel for the restaurant and it lived up to our expectations, with a good variety of Turkish food, lovely flavours and excellent service. I needed gluten free food and was provided with good advice and an appropriate diet. The hotel is centrally located, near to the Topkapi Palace, and on a tram line to the Galata Bridge and up to Aghia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. The rooms were spacious and clean, with en-suite facilities, but in need of some up-grading. We thought it was excellent value for money. The views from the terrace bar and restaurant were stunning, to the Galata Bridge and up the Bosphorus. We found the staff very helpful and they gave us good advice and service, including the transport to and from the airport. It is good to be met on arrival, after getting the Â£10 Visa required for Turkey at the airport, and to be welcomed and taken efficiently to the hotel and our rooms. We arrived in the evening, passing through the old city and Sultanahmed district, seeing the Blue Mosque with floodlights on it and gulls whirling around the minarets. It was a wonderful introduction to the city and Istanbul lived up to all of our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “I would go again”
Reviews.Author: Traveller618
Reviews.Content: My wife & I took great care choosing our hotel. We used Trip Advisor of course. We were not disappointed. The staff were great - all of them. One night I rang reception at 0200hrs as a faulty air con was making a racket. Within 10 minutes a technian was knocking on the door. I was so surprised at the prompt attention & it was quite a while before I realised I had no clothes on. The next day reception insisted that we move to an upgraded room as an apoligy. The Guest relation Manager, Ayse Sancak, was very helpful in planning our days & even arranged for me to swim in a hotel one hundred yards away which belonged to the same chain. Incidently another Hotel in the chain has been recently voted 1st out of the 431 hotels in Istanbul. We had a great four days in the city. The only critism is the cost of eating out Â£25-Â£30 a head for a decent meal is, I feel, over the top. The Erboy Hotel has a good restraunt book a table on the roof garden -what a view! Yes no problem I would go again. Thank you all the staff at The Erboy. P&J

Reviews.Title: “a very memorable citytrip”
Reviews.Author: vanmens
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a city trip to Istanbul (first time in Turkey). The day before leaving we received an e-mail from the Hotel (Aysha) warmly welcoming us to her Hotel and indicating that she would be there to welcome us the following day. And so she was; with a cup of hot apple tea and a lot of information about the city. The Hotel room was small but adequate and well equipped. Breakfast was pure luxury and the dinners we ate in Erboy and two other Hotels in the same chain were very good. Staff members were friendly and helpfull and Aysha had a lot of helpfull information and good tips. All in all the Hotel had a relaxed but also efficient atmosphere. Looking back at our stay we must say that Erboy Hotel made us feel safe and homely and certainly contributed to one of the best city trips we have made thus far. Finally the excellent position of this Hotel in relation to public transport, the great monuments and museums within a short walking distance just caps the best trip we have had so far in visiting some 32 cities.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Fault”
Reviews.Author: Alpat
Reviews.Content: Hotel just was all that you needed, Rooms slightly on the small side but what more do you want. They were clean and tidy with a good view over the Bosphorus. Good showers with plenty of hot water. Breakfast was first class with eggs, ham, various types of cheese, tomatoes, bread, cakes and pastries etc. All you could want and require. Tea & coffee served at your tables by happy cheerful staff who did all they could to be helpful. A nice touch was a daily new letter/paper pointing out attractions points of interest and giving the weather for the next 2 days they even put an explanation of Turkish words and broke down the pronunciation so you could try and say them correctly. A very nice Hotel in a good location in the Old City, the tram stop is only 50 yrds from the hotel and a 5 min walk to the Sea Front or Spice Bazaar or the other way to the Blue Mosque or Hagia Sofia or Topkapi Palace. Would visit again, well done.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot you should stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: roscoe2007Ireland
Reviews.Content: We spend a week in this hotel and it definalely fullfilled our needs. Really good staff and fanatastic breakfast. Rooms were clean and good size. Free internet as well. Very well located to old part of the city and within walking distance ( 5 mins) to all of the main attractions. As well as being really close to the tram/metro line. Price was reasonable, you really couldn't have asked for more. Istanbul is a great place for a holiday !!

Reviews.Title: “good deal, service, location”
Reviews.Author: ersilberstein
Reviews.Content: We found a good deal online for staying three nights. We thought the Erboy was in a great location (after we got orientated). The staff were helpful at helping w/our luggage and booked us some dinner as lovely restaurants. The restaurants in the hotel, although had beautiful views was quite terrible (we had to send something back) and overprice. The one internet didn't often work or was monopolized when they offered to use their sister hotels facilities, the same situation was true. Other than that, no real complaints. I remember the elevator was funky, but we always got to breakfast in time for the fresh fruit and enjoyed our time exploring Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Served our purpose admirably”
Reviews.Author: FarooqUK
Reviews.Content: Couple, mid 50s from United Kingdom 29 April to 3rd May Top marks for location - within minutes of major attractions as well as tram and ferry stations. The hotel arranged for us to be picked up from the Airport and on arrival we were met with friendly Guest Relation Manager, Ayse Sancak, and a welcome cup of apple tea. She briefed us on the major attractions and how to plan our next day. Her advice was very valuable and we consulted her before planning each day. The room was slightly small (no room for a chair) and the decor was rather dated but very clean and comfortable and was cleaned daily. The view from the room was of other buildings but this was not important to us â€“ we were hardly in. Bathroom was clean and adequate with plenty of hot water at good pressure. Towels were changed daily Hotel staff was friendly and helpful; they provided me with a socket adapter to charge my camera batteries. Breakfast had a good variety to cater for most tastes and there was plenty of everything. I would recommend this hotel to those who are out and about all day and want a comfortable clean room at the end of the day and good breakfast to start the day. For the price, you can not go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Really good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Ania850
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our holiday in Istanbul where we stayed in Erboy hotel.The hotel is really a good choice and its main advantages are as follows: 1) Hotel location is perfect as most important touristic attractions are within walking distance from it 2)Tram stop is very close as well (not more than 100 metres from the hotel) - you can "use it" to travel to more distant parts of the city 3) In spite of the fact that the location is so convenient it's very silent at the same time ( the street where the hotel is located is not very busy and the tram is not audible either - the latter is very important to mention as many hotels in Sultanahmet overlook the tramlines) 4) Hotel staff is very friendly, communicative (good level of English) and willing to help 5) You get exactly what you expect to get (room pictures on the web reflect the reality and all the complimentary services are delivered) - this may be taken as granted but it is not so obvious in Turkey Ania i Dominik

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: LallyAustralia
Reviews.Content: We found the Erboy Hotel very user friendly and in a great location. The hot buffet breakfast was one of the best breakfasts that we have ever had. The staff on the desk were very friendly and helpful and the Travel Consultant Ayse was outstanding in her dediction to helping everybody to find the best of Istanbul and Turkey. Ayse assisted us in all of our travel requirements. We look forward to once again staying at the Erboy and hopefully the same staff are still there.

Reviews.Title: “It is a nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: tchan33
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Erboy for 5 nights two weeks ago. The best thing of this hotel is the location which is close to everything. The Tokapi palace is just down the block and most other tourist spots are in walking distance. The tram stop (Sirkeci) is just down the street in 2 mins walk. The staffs are very nice and helpful. I email the hotel before I came to request what room I want and the reply was quick and positive. The hotel and room is clean in general but the room is a little bit small. I am not sure if that is true to all hotels nearby in same rating since most buildings look tiny! We didn't stay in the hotel often, so it is not a problem to us. Unfortunately, there is a construction site working on the opposite side outside of our room. It is quite noisy during daytime but quiet at night. Breakfast was good. There were many choices. There is A/C in the room. Internet connection was on and off in the first few days of our stay that we needed to go down to the lobby to use internet. After the rooftop cafe open, we got internet connection in our room (top floor). By the way, the rooftop cafe has a very good view. In general, I think this hotel is not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant Erboy hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChiaraEngland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very well-situated for most of the important tourist sights in Istanbul. Furthermore, the staff were able to give friendly and helpful advice during our stay. The rooms were quite small but clean and functional. The buffet breakfast was very good and there was free internet access on a computer in the foyer. Overall, I would say that this was a great hotel for visitors to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Hellow everybody”
Reviews.Author: factorone
Reviews.Content: Erboy hotel is well situated. The whole staff was very friendly. It was very clean. Breakfast en food was very good. But I don't recommand for wintertime because it was very cold in our room. The heating didn't function every time. The windows are old and not isolated, so you heared everything what happend outside and the coldness came inside the room.

Reviews.Title: “Erboy...Oh Boy!”
Reviews.Author: miss_antalya08
Reviews.Content: This fantastic little hotel that is close to most major tourist attractions within walking distance. The friendly hotel staff were always at hand to help. And I can not forget to mention the wonderful and ever so helpful guest relations manager...Without having a chat, I would have been lost. Thank you so much for everything...I will be back early next year and would love to stay again!!! Chastity Brisbane, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethMcLeod
Reviews.Content: Erboy Hotel is wonderful place to stay given the comparatively low cost. The staff is great, the rooms very good for the price, the breakfast is great. Everything is very clean, AC and heating works, satellite TV works, too. The location is great, easy to reach, very close to the major sights (walking distance), well connected to public tranport. The hotel offered us a free airport pick up by taxi and a free dinner on the first day (for direct internet customers). There is a wonderful roof garden overlooking the sea. And again, the staff is great! Very good experience, we will be back! Astrid

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good location for budget trip”
Reviews.Author: SunTravellers
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Erboy after a 26 hour trip from Western Canada. Our 'airport pick-up service' from the Erboy did not show up. After waiting one hour we took a cab to the hotel, which the hotel paid for. Disappointing and an unnecessary irritation after having confirmed the date and time of arrival several times. We had booked a double room and were shown to a twin room, very tiny. We asked for what we had booked and were then taken to another room with two twin beds pushed together, again a very tiny room with a window overlooking a noisy street. However, we settled in and found the bed comfortable. The endless noise from the street made sleeping difficult. The front desk staff at the Erboy were friendly and helpful. The housekeeping staff was very good - our room always cleaned early and well. There was a buffet breakfast provided each day. The food was plentiful and satisfactory. The offerings did not change at all during the 8 day stay but there was always something to get the day started and we ate an early lunch. The location is great. It is a short walk to all attractions as well as the tram and ferries to other locations. The neighbourhood felt safe to walk in during the evenings and there are several good restaurants nearby serving authentic Turkish food. We did not try the hotel restaurant for dinner based on our experience with the breakfasts - unexciting. The price was good for what we got. Overall our experience was satisfactory. We did not spend much time in the room/hotel since we were out sightseeing most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “More than 3* !”
Reviews.Author: barkhuis1
Reviews.Content: The Erboy Hotel is located in the centre of the old town. Centrally located betwee Topkapi palace, Blue Mosk, Hagia Sophia, Egyptian Bazar, Galata Bridge and the Harbour. Erboy is a 3* hotel, with clean not too large rooms, but which have enough space to live (sleep).Due to the fact it is located in the centre of town, there is some traffic noise. Bed linen and towels are changed every day. The bar is excellent and a quiet place to sit. The restaurand is good. The guest relations manager is prepared to give you any touristic information you need. Free internet is availlable. This is a hotel, where you feel like at home. Our advise is to make a ferry trip over the Bosporus and see the dolphins. Go by ferry or small fishing boat to EyÃ¼p and by cable car to Pierre Lotti. Walk through the little streets of Kumkapi and visit there the small Hagia Sophia.

Reviews.Title: “Not really helpful staff, OK location”
Reviews.Author: torkildl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Erboy hotel in Easter 2008 for our trip to Istanbul. When we arrived we were a bit disappointed with the room, as it was not very aesthetically appealing had a very small window into an inner courtyard. We had booked a double room , but got a twin room. Because of these annoyances we asked the staff the morning after if we could change to a better room. They told us that when we came back after a sightseeing trip, we would get the keys to a new room. This new room did not exactly live up to expectations. The bed was small (actually only 1,5 and not double), the room was still facing the inner courtyard and was markedly smaller than the first. The staff did not tell us that we were getting a much, much smaller room with the same annoyances in order to secure a "double" bed. The location in Sultanahmet (the oldest historical centre of Istanbul) is good. But, be aware that options for eating and going out are limited to tourist traps in this area. Beyoglu, the most westernized area, is better for these things. Other issues: - Breakfast is not worth the price at this hotel - Our experience also includes offers from the hotel to get us cabs/airport lift at over-the-top rates. We would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Are Wonderful with Children”
Reviews.Author: AllSaintsSuffolkUK
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a family of 4 adults and one child and were made to feel thoroughly welcome through out our stay. The staff were helpful and friendly especially towards our forgetful 8 year old boy who left his precious toy cat behind in our room at the Erboy Hotel. Imagine our horror when it was realised on take off that this scruffy little grey toy cat that he has had since birth was missing. We need not have worried as the hotel answered our anxious email on our return-not only had they found it they posted it back to us in the UK on Signed For Delivery and we were re united within a week. The Staff are truly understanding and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The Breakfast service is simply stunning and offers terrific value when you compare with other other hotels in this class. The Staff were attentive and friendly. We plan to come again soon and explore the other sights of Istanbul from this very well placed central hotel.Thank you Hotel Erboy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Marina82Jelena80
Reviews.Content: The Erboy hotel is definitely one that i can recommend to fellow travelliers. The Erboy allows short walks to most interesting places of Istanbul ( Hagia Sophia, Topkapi palace, Great Bazar, Egyptian Bazar, Cisterns... etc.) and to the railway station. The rooms and bathrooms were clean and nice. We always had fresh sheets and towels. The service was excellent from the reception and from the rest of the staff. The breakfast was lovely and breakfast area was nice. The staff were, without exception, very friendly and helpful. You wont regret staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy atmosphere, clean rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Javilafranca
Reviews.Content: We are a couple from Spain who stayed at Erboy Hotel for four nights. I would recommend the hotel because it is not expensive for the service you get. The hotel was recently refurbished and rooms are cosy (though a bit small). The staff is very friendly, in particular the Guest Relations Manager, AyÅŸe Sancak, who was very charming. She e-mailed us before we arrived in Istanbul and said goodbye to us personally after having given some advice on transport to the airport and after having invited us to two cups of tea! These little details help you feel more satisfied. We booked the rooms by e-mail, and there were no problems. In addition to the e-mail by the Guest Relations Manager, we also got quick confirmation of our booking. Even though we asked for a queen bed, we were assigned twin beds. However, rooms with twin beds are on the 5th floor (the top one) and this is better because you don't hear the noise of the street (at all!) Of course, the location of the hotel in the historical peninsula of Istanbul was perfect. We were within walking distance of the major attractions (just a few minutes away from Topkapi Palace, Saint Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Cistern...) Bus, train and tramway stops, as well as docks, were also no more than a stone's throw away. As for meals, breakfast was included and it was plentiful. We were offered a wide range of food (though every day was the same). We also had dinner at the restaurant one evening for a relatively good price (we were not very hungry and just ordered one dish per person, so we can't really give a reliable rating). In summary, Erboy Hotel is a good election for the price we paid. Things being the same, we would like to stay there if (hopefully) one day we come back to Istanbul! Javier and Ana

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeliaSpain
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay in Istanbul at Erboy Hotel. Since the price was so low, we didn't expect to find such a nice hotel... First of all, hotel location is great: 5 minutes walk from Santa Sofia, and just a little more from the rest of important places. Hotel is also next to a tram stop, and very close to all ferry departures. Rooms are simple but clean, with comfortable beds. We had read in other reviews that rooms were small, but ours was of normal size (for a 3* hotel). The hotel has a computer with internet for free use. We had dinner one night at the restaurant of the hotel, which was really nice. Buffet breakfast was good, although I would introduce some changes (better juices, bread toaster). Every morning there's a little sheet at your breakfast table with information about concerts, places to visit and places closed that day. We find a great restaurant with live music at Istiklal Caddesi, thanks to this little bulletin. And the best of all was the staff: all of them are very nice and helpful. When we arrived, Ayse (the guest relation manager) explained us all the things we could do at Istanbul, and gave us very helpful maps (even a tranportation guide, which I had been unsuccessfully looking for at internet). She also told us which days are best for visiting places, for instance, on tuesday there's a street bazar at Kadikoy. So if you are planning to visit places outside the historic centre, it's great to know when there's something interesting to see. Ayse also manages for you restaurant reservations and things like that. So, I highly recommend this hotel to eveybody!

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to its superb recommendations.”
Reviews.Author: Stewartl
Reviews.Content: Having previously booked the Erboy ( Oct 07) we were on arrival upgraded (free) to the Sirkoni Konak ( a nearby member of the chain) This was a a five star hotel which offered a number of features we did not require (at the time) - However for luxury check it out! This time however we did stay at the Erboy and were not disappointed. The group has developed a customer friendly based policy which works. Customer Guest Relation Managers on this occasion Ayse, are there to assist in any way they can. It is certainly worth while contacting the hotel before your arrival if you have any special requests (non smoking, w fi, reservations etc). The staff genuinly seem to take pleasure in helping their 'guests' The room was clean and fully met our requirements. The location left little to ask for. The Hotels own restaurant stands in it own right. Breakfast was extensive and the girl serving coffee (sorry we didn't catch the name) remembered my wifes preference for candorel instead of sugar. The barman, although the bar was underused due to the time of year, was attentive and cheerrful. All in all the hotel offers superb value for money and makes you want to return

Reviews.Title: “sweetly hospitality - super simpatia dello staff”
Reviews.Author: marcoitaly
Reviews.Content: Erboy's staff is simply nicefully, otherwhise del pr management Aise but also the recpetions people, the waither and everybody. It's position in a best location in the center of the old city, nearly Topkapi palace, Santa Sophia, the port and simply to reach in tram and near the railways station. Room is comfortable and such is necessary to spent 4-5 days sweetly. Go there if you want to make a good holiday in Istanbu.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: samlovesturkey
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Erboy Hotel you are immediately greeted by the lovely staff, they cannot be more helpful or generous with their time. i would go back to this hotel for sure. The rooms are clean and pleasent and is conveniently located for everything you could need. The food was wonderful and had a wide choice for all. i look forward to returning to istanbul and will book to stay at the Erboy Hotel. thank you to all staff ..

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Rose098
Reviews.Content: The Erboy Hotel is definitely one that I can recommend to fellow travellers. The location is very central yet reasonably quiet and my double room was clean, warm and welcoming to come back to after a cold day sightseeing in the unexpected winter snow! The staff were, without exception, very friendly and helpful and even uncomplainingly served us dinner when we arrived from the airport just as evening service should have finished. When I make a return visit to Istanbul I will be very happy to stay at the Erboy again.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: gypsygirl08
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from Istanbul & must say that for price/value then this hotel is the pick. Its located near Sultanahmet which is where all the main attractions are. A 5-10 minute walk will have you at Aya Sofya & the Blue Mosque with another 10 minutes up the street & your at the Grand Bazaar. For anything further or if you can't walk a great distance, down the road from the hotel is a tram stop. I found this useful when returning to Ataturk Airport as I caught the tram from here to the end of the line where I connected to the metro to the airport. Not bad for the equivalent of AU$3.00. The other direction will take you to the ferry terminals & the spice bazaar in about a 10 minute walk. The rooms were small but well maintained & very clean & being winter were very warm. The reception staff were friendly & accommodating. The breakfast room was lovely with an information newsletter each morning on the table. I found this useful as at a quick glance you knew what was open/closed, weather & also included each day 2 turkish phrases with pronunciation. The waiters were also very friendly & the food was lovely. There is also a restuarant on the ground floor serving dinner but I never ate there so can't comment. There are some nice local restuarants nearby with one directly opposite the hotel with a small shop selling water etc beside it. The only small fault would be that there is only one computer available free to guests to connect to internet. There seemed to be always a few people waiting to use it & I felt conscious of this when I was on the computer. They are set up for wireless internet in the foyer if you bring your own laptop however.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: addictivepsycho
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a stay in Istanbul. I found the Erboy one of the best 3* hotels i have stayed in. The best factor was the staff - they bent over backwards to help us, from everything such as reserving a table at local restaurants to booking city tours., and their English is impecible. Rooms are fairly standard as you would expect for a 3*. Bathroom was a little small in our room (413) but adequate. After all, you're only in the bathroom to freshen up. I found the soundproofing was a little poor, especially on Monday night, for some reason there seemed to be much more noise than on Sat and Sun of my stay - possibly due to the start of the working week? Some of our neighbours also seemed to enjoy slamming their doors very late at night raher than simply shutting them, which didn't help in trying to sleep! This is the reason my review is not a 5* one. Breakfast was excellent - a vast array of foods as a buffet.The restaurant on the bottom floor do good local lunches and dinners. I also recommend the Imbat restaurant in their sister hotel Orient Express just 1 street away. It has a great panormic view of the bosphorus and skyline. Location is probably the biggest attraction to this hotel. It is about a 10min walk up to the Topkapi palace and Sultanahmet Square (Haghia Sophia, Blue Mosque and Basilica Cistern etc). Even in thick snow (which is v.rare for Istanbul) we managed to reach these places easily within 15mins at a slow pace. ADVICE: If coming from the UK, be aware Easyjet run flights to Istanbul, which can be very cheap. If you arrive with them (or another carrier) into Sabiha-Gokcen airport, get a transfer for Â£39 each way with [-] - very efficient and safe drivers. They also run transfers from Ataturk. The Erboy hold luggage after you checkout for no extra cost which we found good as our flight wasn't until 20:20. You may be hounded by sneaky carpet tradesmen who lurk around popular sites. They may begin by coming across as fellow tourists before mentioning that they "have a shop a few streets away". As soon as that comes into conversation simply say you are not interested in buying anything and politely ask them to leave.It may be advisable to pretend you have been to the city a few times before if it is your first time here.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: AstridNorway
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one week. We really enjoyed the hotel because of the friendly atmosphere. The rooms and bathrooms were clean and nice. We always had fresh sheets and towels. The service was excellent from the reseption and from the rest of the staff. This hotel is in an exellent location, very close to all the wonderful sights of istanbul...Topkapi, Hagia Sophia, Spice bazaar and the blue mosque. The hotel is located close to the tram, so is easy to go to other parts of the town. The breakfast was lovely and the breakfast area was nice. Close to the hotel you can find lot of resturants. I recomend this hotel for a enjoyable stay in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “very kind environments”
Reviews.Author: nikoTehran
Reviews.Content: hello , first of all i woul like thank you for every think , i,m for sure that you know who i am , a,m Hamed from Iran . it,s been my fist time that i came to Istanbul and i really enjoyed there i,m cultural person and i love books . i saw that Erboy hotel has the best staff because of their behavior , one of the problem that is weakness in Erboy hotel is : guidence . for example AYSA is the best person to guide everybody but she doesn,t have any book to give to tourisms . in my idea hotel Erboy,s manager should give her too much books ( my mean she should has handle it ) to give them to tourism that,s why i,m telling this problem it is more beneficial if hotel Erboy manager done it . at the last but not the least i highly recommend to Erboy hotel,s manager to support lady AYSA , because she is strive and intelligence and also i would like thank you lady AYSA to made good envrionment for me and all staffs from Erboy hotel and ENSHALLAH i,m going there at may month and i need to your help lady AYSA . all the best , sincerely , Hamed-Chaki representative of Iran-Croatia friendship society

Reviews.Title: “Felt pretty pampered”
Reviews.Author: sylvia49
Reviews.Content: After the decision to visit Istanbul in 2008 we looked for a reasonable and handy accomodation and found the Erboy hotel by accident. And we didn't regret the choice. We enjoyed staying there at this nice, quiet and clean hotel. The rooms are adequate. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Dinner at the restaurant was delicious. Especially the Breakfast buffet was gorgeous. Special thanks to Aysa. She answered all questions about places, events or anything else in a very friendly, ambitious and profesional way. We will recommend the hotel to friends and colleagues and hopefully stay there again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: katiepotatie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Erboy as part of a study group and would have no hesitation booking return trips there. The rooms were simple but very clean, with as new bathrooms in most rooms, although some were perhaps a little on the small side for 2 people. The breakfast was great, well above what was expected, although a little different to the traditional western breakfast i am used to. We did not make the most of happy hour in the bar as much as we would have liked! There were lots of restaurants in the nearby streets serving both Turkish and International cuisine. It was conveniently located near the tourist attractions of the old part of the city, with a tram stop practically at the doorstep and very close to the main train station. There are plenty of shops nearby, although a tip not to use the overpriced laundry service there but look for laundry services down the adjoining streets. Likewise, avoid the mini supermarket over the road but find the bigger supermarket a few streets behind the hotel on the main tram line. The staff at the hotel were always friendly and helpful, and gave me a good rate when i opted to stay on there myself after the tour finished. I think my parents would prefer to spend more money and stay somewhere a little swankier, but for a 3-star hotel and my budget it was clean, secure, convenient and i will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “special staff, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: asiadavide
Reviews.Content: We spent few days in the hotel on jan 2008. We loved staff and atmosphere. room are very clean and quite. The hotel has every conforts (internet, bar, 2 restaurant...) and breakfast is great. Special care for customers and "every memeber of the crew" is very gentle and kind. The hotel is located in a strategic position for everything you visit. We suggest to try it. We loved Istanbul and people most of all.

Reviews.Title: “Erboy Hotel: An ideal place for an ideal holiday”
Reviews.Author: Timucin_Leflef
Reviews.Content: I stayed over at the Erboy Hotel twice in the last year (Feb & May) and enjoyed it thoroughly both times. I found the staff to be quite friendly, helpful and very professional, especially the receptionists (Ayse, Birol and the other staff & managers). Even the waiters and porters have time to talk and give help and advice about the sites to visit. Also I found the cuisine to be quite good at the hotel and breakfast is an all-you-can-eat buffet. Erboy is located in Sirkeci and is very convenient for visiting the Haigha Sophia, the Covered Bazaar and various other tourist attractions. There's even a street nearby with a Starbucks, McDonalds etc. for tourists who have kids, although I prefer to eat at the hotel due to the good food and atmosphere.
