I especially liked the fact we were so close to the sea-buses (small ferries), which allow you to reach anywhere in Istanbul for less than 50c. Also, they have a terrace on the top floor where you can have your meals outside during the summer. The view is quite exceptional and picturesque. The rooms have double beds and have good heating, constant hot water as well as air-conditioning which you can adjust to your own needs. Also I found the room prices to be ideal. In fact, some friends who were staying at another hotel wanted to change to the Erboy just because of the better room rate, but they were leaving the next day. I think they will be returning to Turkey at some point and will be staying at the Erboy. All in all it's a perfect location, especially for tourists, to spend their holidays in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Great service asd location.”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel91
Reviews.Content: I was travelling as part of a group and we all thought the service, friendly staff, cleanliness and location were excellent at the Erboy. We also would recommend it for its reasonable prices and hearty breakfast. We walked everywhere from the Hotel, as it is located very convieniently to many of the sights and markets in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful !!”
Reviews.Author: Kitty801
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Erboy Hotel for 2 nights and were very impressed with the very professional attitude of all the staff especially at reception. Everybody was friendly and efficient and the restaurant is excellent - not just the food (and as a French resident I know what to compare with) but also the service and the explanations about the food. Very good quality-price ratio and somewhere we would recommend and certainly come back to. Also to recommend is the Sircesi Konak (part of the same chain of hotels). A memorable stay with a personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “An Istanbul Hidden Spark”
Reviews.Author: tripaddicted
Reviews.Content: That was my first time to Istanbul and we arrived at evening 8 pm by a taxi from Ataturk International Airport. It took around 30 minutes with moderate busy traffic and cost me YTL32 on 'Gunduz Fare' (equivalent to US$26). Erboy hotel is located in the old town of Istanbul and within walking distance to most of the city attractions. Gulhane Tram station is only 150 meters left side from the hotel. The tram took to all other destinations within the city with YTL1.3 one way ticket fare, should it need a connection with furnicular train or tunnel train - the fare should be added up another YTL1.3 one way. The surrounding area of the hotel is convenient for pedestrian with numbers of cafetarias, groceries and neigborhood hotels such as Best Western. Lobby area is very effective with a guest access computer for internet access and two lifts lead to the guestrooms. These lifts are small and only for up to 3 persons to ride. The stair and guestroom's corridor is less light. Room is generally twin bed and outdated furnishing with standard facilities, 14 inches TV, safety box, hair dryer and mini bar. Ask for room #212 for larger space and quieter since the other of our first stayed is very cramped and dark facing out the road. Air-con is working normally but the heather is centrally controlled and sometimes too heated and forced us to open the window when we were in the room. The temperature outside was 2 to 6 degree celcius only. Breakfast room is in the basement. Avoid peak tourist hours having breakfast at the same time at 7 to 8:30 am or you will find no empty seat or clean table. Food and drinks choices are standard but sufficient to start your day. Overall, Erboy hotel might be suitable for leisure adventurer and might not be suitable for business travelller looking for comfort and place to rest. It is worth for the centrally located premise though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kuss
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, easy walking distance to all top sights. The rooms are small but spotlessly clean and perfectly adequate for a short break. Breakfast is good with plenty of choice. We would recommend this hotel especially as the price is a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “The choice I made ..............”
Reviews.Author: PiliHamburg
Reviews.Content: My name is Pedro, I arrived yesterday (21.12.2007) from Istanbul. I travelled alone and stayed during this period at the Erboy Hotel. This Hotel its perfect located. From the Hotel you reach in no more then five minutes the most famous tourist points of the city. From the airport you can reach easily the Hotel using the public transports in 40 min and paying no more than 3 YTL (Turkish currency). So, if you are someone who doesnâ€™t need luxury but only a quiet, comfortable and not expensive Hotel, this one should suits you perfectly. The staff is one of the strongest points. They are very friendly, helpful and they donâ€™t try to sell you nothing. I am very happy about the choice I made and I am glad to share this feeling with you. Pedro (Portugal)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, below average rooms, amazing rooftop”
Reviews.Author: Waterbabie
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel in a good location in Istanbul (5-7 minute walk to Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, etc). The rooms were small and pretty average but clean. The rooftop restaurant has amazing views and we very much enjoyed hanging out there for a meal/drink. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful (organzing day trips, airport pick up etc). I did get stuck in the elevator for 20 teriffying seconds in the dark so just beware! Tip: the baggage porter will expect a tip so ensure you have smething organized (we only had a Â£5 note which I'm sure is above the going rate!)

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: riocoribri04
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed in this wonderful hotel for 2 weeks and the service in every way was excellent and could have the ranking of a 4 star hotel from the time we arrived til the day we left we had the best service we could have wanted and the staff on the reception, JOHN,BAROL AND SINAN were always very helpful and open to any questions we had and always eager to give us good advise and suggestions...they were very knowledgable and polite as for the restaurant "PALAZADE" it was a wonderful experience to taste the ottoman cuisine and the waitstaff there,MAHMUD,ALI AND ENJIN gave us excellent service and for a busy restaurant they deserve topratings. we rarely dined elsewhere as we did not want to miss the good food they had.,it was just too good to be missed the room was very clean and the service was very prompt in the morning the lounge area by the reception was very comfortable and cozy and we relaxed many times there after long walks sightseeing in istanbul if we go back to istanbul,HOTEL ERBOY definitely will be our choice heidi and rashid moore,oklahoma riocoribri04@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jandal99
Reviews.Content: We were group of 8 that stayed at The Erboy Hotel for 4 nights in September at the end of a cruise. Given we had come from luxurious accommodations on the Cruise Ship, we were initially surprised at the smallness and dated decor of the rooms. One couple of our party requested a room transfer after finding their room was very small and dark with single beds (our bookings were for double rooms). This request was accommodated with no problems. Myself and another couple of our party also requested room changes to double rooms, one party changing and myself deciding to stay because our other option did not have so much nice natural lighting so it was a trade off we decided to go with. The rooms are really only to sleep in, you cannot spend any time in them socialising as they are too small BUT we came to visit a different country to appreciate a different culture and how boring it would be if everything was the same the world over. Breakfast had a good selection and was included in the room rate so that was a good added bonus. We socialised outside at the lovely seating down the side street and spent a couple of hours in the evening at the rooftop bar. We found the happy hour outside to be good value but upstairs bar was rather pricey and sometimes the order for drinks got mixed up in the translation. Location is fantastic, staff were friendly and helpful. Free internet was another bonus. We went away for an overnight trip and our luggage was kindly accommodated for us. When we returned we were all in different rooms and this time myself and partner had a lovely corner room with a double bed, single bed and sofa with lots of windows and natural lighting - it was fantastic. Given this is our first time in Turkey, I cannot compare the accommodations with anything else so would possibly stay here again if we returned to Istanbul. Thank you for having us to stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a recommendation!”
Reviews.Author: massiveArt
Reviews.Content: If you are searching for a hotel in Istanbul, - which is near the touristic centers and sights (Sultanahmet, Ayasofia, Galatabridge e.g.), - has nice, clean rooms, - has a tramline near by (five min. afoot), - has a nice reastaurant (where you can even find some vegetarian food) and a roof terrace, - a friendly staff, which is speaking english, - w-lan internet without extra charge and still is low priced Erboy Hotel is the best choice you can make! What I did like most was the staff. The most friendly and heldfull people you can ever expect. But there is more to tell. There are nice coffee bars and restaurants close by. There are less aggressive sellers in the streets. Not to forget the breakfast, which can even suit a vegetarian. What is the purpose of five-star hotels, if there are three star hotels like Erboy? :) I hope to come to Istanbul again and if I do, I will definitely stay at Erboy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: profannie
Reviews.Content: Unfortunatly, many tourist coming for the first time to Istanbul are making the bad choice of staying in the Sulthanhamet district. The disadvantage are numerous: -You are not close the new tramway line, going to Eminonu and Karakoy -You can't walk in the street without being harassed by carpet/leather/Bosphorus cruise sellers -The accomodation are overpriced The Sirkeci district, (where the hotel Erboy is located) is a much better choice. No aggressive sellers here; the new tramway line have two station nearby (Gulhane and Sirkeci); Topkapi, Haggia Sofia and the Blue Mosque are within a 10 minutes walk. Also, the Egyptian Bazaar and the Galata bridge are much closer. There are many little affortable hotels in the Sirkeci district, but I found that the Erboy is one of the greatest value for your money. The rooms are tiny, like every rooms in Istanbul, but they are modern, immaculate and the beds are very confortable. If you are coming by Ataturk airport with not a lots of luggage, the location of the hotel is perfect for taking a cheap option transfert: the metro, than the tram. You will not have more than 300 meters to roll your luggage before arriving at the hotel. There is a free internet spot in the lobby, so you will not have to go outside, wandering to find a place to retrieve your mail. The staff is very pleasant and helpfull; they will give you any information you need, and with a smile. Also, they are speaking english. I also recommand the restaurant of the hotel. The food is good, the prices modest and the waiters friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Love the lounge”
Reviews.Author: amoUk
Reviews.Content: Just back from Istanbul travelled on 08/06/07 to 11/06/07. Good location 3 to 4 minute walk and in view of the Sultan Ahmed mosques and Aya Sofya. Gulhane tram stop at the end of the road, there you can get on the tram for 1.30YTL about 0.60p, buy a token at the booth on the right side. Anyway hotel was perfect for location and value for money. Breakfast was standard which included, cheese, potato wdges, boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, bread, salad, salami, coffe tea and more. Lounge is spacious and clean, bright and very relaxing. There is a terrace on the fifth floor, very nice to sit in with the view of the Aya Sofya. Coffee, tea and soft drinks are expansive in comparison so ask the price before ordering. The rooms were slightly tiny but we enjoyed our stay. Staffs were helpful when we requested a room change as there was a boiler next to our room. All room have air con. BY THE WAY, there are two lifts, one has no inner door and moves very fast, little dangerous as the lift is not contained and children can easily be exposed to this hazard. If you would like to try the water pipe with different flavours then pop in the cafe infront of the Erboy hotel and asked to be seated upstairs. Anyway we were four Asian lads from Oldham (Greater Manchester) and enjoyed our stay. There are lot sof Australian holiday makers, we enjoyed chatting with them and also made friends, very nice people with good humour.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location!”
Reviews.Author: Stella B
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Erboy Hotel. We stayed there for 7 days. It was good. About the hotel...The bathroom was very clean and the breakfast was excellent for a 3 star hotel. Our room was a bit small but OK. The staff were friendly and helpful. We didn't try the restaurants in the hotel but we heard good comments from people. We will definitely choose this hotel again when we go back!

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked and Bumped - Place Sucks!”
Reviews.Author: sftor73
Reviews.Content: We showed up to the hotel and suddenly the place was overbooked and they sent us down the street to their sister hotel....Hotel Azur which was a complete dump. I would NEVER book with Erboy again....the whole thing was just a game. Completely unprofessional...if you book with them you will likely end up somewhere else.
